know about this must-have display feature</strong></a></li></ul><p>A quality TV is the centerpiece of any home entertainment system, but finding the right display for your needs and the right price for your wallet can be challenging. When shopping for a TV, there are many different aspects to consider, including size, panel type, resolution, HDR support, smart TV platform, and more.&#160;</p><p>If you're looking for a display with genuine home theater performance in mind, then you'll likely want to opt for a 65-inch- or- larger premium 4K TV. The <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-4k-tv\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">best 4K TVs</a> typically use an <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-oled-tv\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">OLED panel</a>, or a high-end LED panel with quantum dots and local dimming. These display types will provide you with the best contrast, black levels, and brightness performance for dazzling <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/what-is-hdr-tv\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">high dynamic range</a> (HDR) images.&#160;&#160;</p><p>For buyers who simply want a reliable TV for casual viewing, however, a smaller screen and a more budget-friendly LED panel should get the job done just fine. Though picture quality won't be quite as impressive as more expensive display types, there are many <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-tv-under-500-dollars\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">affordable LED TVs</a> out there with solid performance. And, while 4K resolution and built-in smart TV interfaces were once thought of as premium features, nowadays even entry-level TVs come with 4K panels and smart TV capabilities as default features.&#160;</p><p>Once you've settled on the basics for what you're looking for in a new display, there are plenty of deals readily available from all of the major TV manufacturers, including Sony, Samsung, LG, Vizio, TCL, and Hisense. Removed deals that are no longer active.</em></p>\n<div id=\"slideshow\">\n\tBest OLED TV deals\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5efa5b7f988ee375785b8226?format=jpeg\" alt=\"VIZIO OLED TV and Elevate soundbar\" height=\"829\" width=\"1106\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Vizio</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>When it comes to picture quality, no other display type offers better overall performance than an <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-oled-tv\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">OLED TV</a>. Unlike traditional LED TVs (which use LCD panels), OLED TVs don't require a backlight. Instead, every pixel is able to produce its own light or shut off completely. This enables OLED displays to produce superior black levels, contrast, and viewing angles compared to regular LED models. With that said, OLED panels can't get as bright as LED TVs, and they can be susceptible to burn-in if you leave a static image on the screen for hours on end.</p><p>For most buyers, however, the pros of OLED tech far outweigh the cons. Of course, the high-end picture performance of an OLED TV typically comes with a high price tag. Thankfully, OLED TVs from LG and Sony often go on sale.&#160;</p><p>The best OLED TV deal available right now is for the <a href=\"https://bestbuy.7tiv.net/c/196318/614286/10014?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.bestbuy.com%2Fsite%2Fvizio-65-class-oled-4k-uhd-smartcast-tv%2F6416848.p%3FskuId%3D6416848\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Vizio 65-inch 4K OLED TV</a>, which is currently available at Best Buy for $100 off its full price. At $1,900, this Vizio model is now the most affordable 65-inch OLED on the market..&#160;</p><ul class=\"summary-list\"><li><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\"><strong>LG 77-inch GX OLED 4K TV (2020 model), $4,700 (originally $5,200) at Best Buy</strong></a><strong> [You save $500]</strong></li></ul>\n\tBest premium LED TV deals\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f1f348b988ee34ba00086c4?format=jpeg\" alt=\"tcl 8 series 4k tv\" height=\"603\" width=\"804\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Best Buy</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>Unlike OLED displays, LED TVs still use traditional LCD panels with backlights to produce their images. Though this tech does have some drawbacks when it comes to black levels and viewing angles, high-end LED TVs are still capable of very impressive picture quality with industry-leading brightness. High brightness is particularly desirable for the best <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/what-is-hdr-tv\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">HDR</a> performance, allowing highlights to really pop from the screen.&#160;</p><p>Many high-end LED TVs are branded as QLED TVs since they include quantum dot technology. This feature allows the displays to achieve a wide color gamut for more accurate and rich colors. Premium LED TVs typically include full-array local dimming as well, enabling the backlight to dim in specific zones across the screen. This enables the display to achieve much better contrast and black levels compared to LED TV models without local dimming.&#160;</p><p>The best value on a premium LED TV right now is for the <a href=\"https://bestbuy.7tiv.net/c/196318/614286/10014?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.bestbuy.com%2Fsite%2Ftcl-75-class-8-series-led-4k-uhd-smart-roku-tv%2F6377907.p%3FskuId%3D6377907\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">TCL 8-Series 4K TV</a>. This flagship 75-inch display features quantum dot color and full-array local dimming with mini-LED technology. 4K TV\" height=\"2101\" width=\"2805\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Best Buy</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>Like premium LED TVs, the best mid-range LED TV models also offer many impressive picture quality features, including quantum dots or other wide color gamut technologies. Brightness levels aren't quite as high as more expensive models, however, and contrast isn't as precise since there are typically fewer dimming zones or no dimming zones at all.&#160;</p><p>Still, if you're a buyer who wants to save a bit without losing support for the latest display technologies, like HDR, then a mid-range LED TV model will likely be a good fit.&#160;</p><ul class=\"summary-list\"><li><a href=\"https://bestbuy.7tiv.net/c/196318/614286/10014?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.bestbuy.com%2Fsite%2Fsony-65-class-x900h-series-led-4k-uhd-smart-android-tv%2F6401205.p%3FskuId%3D6401205\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\"><strong>Sony 65-inch X900H 4K TV (2020 model), $1,000 (originally $1,600) at Best Buy</strong></a><strong> [You save $600]</strong></li><li><a href=\"https://bestbuy.7tiv.net/c/196318/614286/10014?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.bestbuy.com%2Fsite%2Fhisense-65-class-h8g-quantum-series-4k-uhd-tv-smart-led-with-hdr%2F6402783.p%3FskuId%3D6402783\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\"><strong>Hisense 65-inch H8G 4K TV (2020 model), $750 (originally $800) at Best Buy</strong></a><strong> [You save $50]</strong></li></ul>\n\tBest budget LED TV deals\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f75e2100ab50d00184ad87c?format=jpeg\" alt=\"LG 55UN7000PUB TV\" height=\"1055\" width=\"1407\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Amazon</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>For buyers who are less concerned about picture quality and more interested in simply finding an affordable display with reliable smart TV connectivity, there are plenty of budget-friendly options to consider. src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=ndC1Y8UjbDI:6kX0rMoifvE:gIN9vFwOqvQ\" border=\"0\"></img></a>\n</div><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/ndC1Y8UjbDI\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\"/>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 19 Oct 2020 18:30:00 +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5efa5b7f988ee375785b8226?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"770cbe86d1eadef4fc7127f9121b36bf","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn6@2020_4/2020/10/20/02-04-36-026_04888c2ff703cd2b.webp","destWidth":1106,"destHeight":829,"sourceBytes":40376,"destBytes":40376,"author":"insider@insider.com (Steven Cohen)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5f8dda8ec21cfb0019468d70?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn72@2020_1/2020/10/20/02-05-16-326_b5e417d054299cbc.webp","https://i.insider.com/5efa5b7f988ee375785b8226?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn6@2020_4/2020/10/20/02-04-36-026_04888c2ff703cd2b.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f1f348b988ee34ba00086c4?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn87@2020_3/2020/10/20/02-05-16-224_0b3734bfd8d4efaf.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f8dd8879e9fe4001900a293?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn28@2020_1/2020/10/20/02-05-17-388_322ceb66cf3e47af.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f75e2100ab50d00184ad87c?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn99@2020_4/2020/10/20/02-05-20-447_3f7e7fa7ca138b00.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn67@2020_3/2020/10/20/02-05-22-757_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=ndC1Y8UjbDI:6kX0rMoifvE:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn40@2020_1/2020/10/20/02-05-15-192_bfb9407ec1c40180.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=ndC1Y8UjbDI:6kX0rMoifvE:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn91@2020_4/2020/10/20/02-05-17-963_7ced5b745bf80421.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn79@2020_1/2020/10/20/02-05-18-571_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=ndC1Y8UjbDI:6kX0rMoifvE:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn91@2020_3/2020/10/20/02-05-24-819_d9c75c127a126829.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/ndC1Y8UjbDI":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn72@2020_4/2020/10/20/02-05-25-925_5355414d0eafea16.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1603159473352},{"createdTime":"2020-10-20 10:04:33","updatedTime":"2020-10-20 10:04:33","title":"The $300 billion breakthrough that gave us frozen food","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-birds-eye-frozen-peas-gave-us-eggo-and-digiorno-2020-10","description":"<div style=\"position:relative; overflow:hidden; padding-bottom:56.25%\">\n<iframe src=\"https://cdn.jwplayer.com/players/EXtA1la9-jZbcmOYf.html\"\nwidth=\"100%\" height=\"100%\" frameborder=\"0\" scrolling=\"auto\" title=\"The $300 billion breakthrough that gave us frozen food\"\nstyle=\"position:absolute;\" allowfullscreen></iframe>\n</div><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/category/frozen-food\">From frozen pizza to Eggo waffles</a>, frozen food has taken over the grocery store.</li>\n<li>But it wasn't always this popular. There was a time when Americans bought only a couple of pounds of frozen food per year.</li>\n<li>Clarence Birdseye's breakthrough started with frozen peas and fish. But it has grown to an almost $300 billion industry.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p><em>Following is a transcript of the video.</em></p><p><strong>Clancy Morgan: </strong>If you're like me, your freezer is packed full of frozen food that came from a giant frozen section from a factory that freezes millions of pounds of food every year. It's an enormous operation, but all of that actually started with this, or, more specifically, this.</p><p>The story behind this logo is key to understanding how one idea completely changed how we eat and cook and along the way created an almost $300 billion industry.</p><p>To understand how we got this, we have to go back to the early 20th century. Before frozen foods, diets in the US looked a lot like this. They were very meat and potatoes, and I know this kid looks super excited, but it was often really bland.</p><p>To get meat, people would go to a quaint butcher shop, like this one from 1910. And they'd go to a small, often mom-and-pop grocery store, like this one. You'd actually bring a list, and a worker would pick out your items for you. I'm not sure why this lady looks so displeased with that artichoke, though. But anyway, people could keep food cold, but not really frozen.</p><p><strong>Amy Bentley:</strong> You had an icebox, but iceboxes were minimally functional. They tended to be smelly. They could create mold.</p><p><strong>Clancy:</strong> Frozen food at the time actually had a really bad reputation.</p><p><strong>Clip: </strong>Is that right?</p><p><strong>Clancy:</strong> Because it was frozen at temperatures that weren't actually that cold, it sometimes took a day or longer to freeze. This formed large ice crystals, which ruined the taste and texture. Basically, the quality was terrible. But soon that would all change, thanks to this guy. Clarence Birdseye. He invented what we think of as frozen food, and it totally changed the way we eat. I find Clarence Birdseye fascinating.</p><p>He was always inventing things, and he actually has over 100 patents. Here's a photo I printed out of him working on a food dehydrator. And he had a real, like, 20th-century vibe. The editors of his college yearbook actually wrote this quote next to his photo. I don't even know how to say this. \"I ain't afeer'd o'bugs, or toads, or worms, or snakes, or mice, or anything.\" Interestingly, he never actually graduated from college.</p><p>Birdseye spent several years working in Labrador in Northern Canada, where he observed Inuit fishermen freezing fish in the frigid outdoors. The fish froze so quickly they actually retained their taste and texture. So like any good inventor, Birdseye engineered a machine that would replicate this process, quickly freezing small quantities of food between two super-cold metal plates. The plates were later swapped for belts, which was more efficient. The machine used temperatures as cold as 50 degrees below zero, and the food was prepackaged in insulated containers. Birdseye called his product \"frosted food\" to differentiate it from low-quality frozen food.</p><p>Now, obviously Birdseye didn't invent the concept of frozen food, but he did figure out a way to mechanize its production, and it worked great. In 1932, The New York Times described the process as a scientific miracle, having food ready without any \"laborious preparation.\"</p><p><strong>Clip:</strong> ♪ Birds Eye peas [pop] ♪ ♪ Sweet as the moment [pop] ♪ ♪ Sweet as the moment when the pod went pop [pop] ♪</p><p><strong>Clancy:</strong> But there was just one problem. Pretty much no one had a freezer. And I mean no one. When some families did start to get electric refrigerators around the 1930s, it was a really new concept.</p><p><strong>Clip:</strong> Sliding shelves, too. A marvelous convenience.</p><p><strong>Clancy:</strong> But it wasn't just homes. Retailers didn't have freezers that could keep frozen food from thawing, reportedly failing to keep temperatures \"much under 40 degrees Fahrenheit.\" And retailers were also skeptical about this new product. One industry analysis wrote that \"customers not only did not demand quick-frozen foods but probably had never heard of them.\"</p><p>Changing how millions of people eat was a daunting task, and Birdseye's company was running out of money. So in 1929, Birdseye sold his patents and company to Postum for $23.5 million, or over $350 million today. Now, all of that money didn't go directly to Clarence Birdseye, but he did make around a million dollars from it. [pop] And he must have really liked frozen foods, because he stayed on at the company as a consultant.</p><p>Birdseye needed to figure out how to sell frozen food, but he also literally needed to figure out how to sell it. Distribution was cited as \"the quick-frozen-food industry's most serious problem.\" So the most serious solution? The company would not only make the food, but also the freezers and the trucks, then lease hundreds of them to retailers as a proof of concept for frozen food. And it worked. It demonstrated that it could be a popular product. By the end of 1937, 2,000 stores carried Birds Eye frozen food.</p><p>To market frozen food, Birds Eye focused on its freshness and convenience, advertising peas \"as gloriously green as any you will see next summer.\"</p><p><strong>Clip: </strong>Yes, Birds Eye peas are as sweet as that because they are freshest picked, freshest frozen.</p><p><strong>Clancy: </strong>And this entire cookbook was written just to advertise all the ways you can use frozen food. And there's some real gems in here. Like, there's one for French fried asparagus. And this thing called a jellied salmon loaf. But there still wasn't a big need that frozen foods filled.</p><p>In 1937, it was estimated that only around 23% of homes had electric refrigerators. And according to American Heritage, \"In 1945 Americans still bought less than two pounds of frozen food apiece.\" For context, I have, like, 15 pounds right now. But Clarence believed in frozen food. That same year he told The Washington Post, \"I believe we'll see a phenomenal increase in the demands for both home and commercial use.\" And he was right.</p><p><strong>Clip:</strong> And so they joined the stream of family life in the suburbs.</p><p><strong>Bentley:</strong> The 1950s and the '60s is called \"the golden age of food processing.\" Consumers who had been deprived of consumer goods through the 1930s and the '40s, with the war and food rationing, all of a sudden have disposable income. The country is very wealthy. And all of these products are flooding the market.</p><p><strong>Clip: </strong>Miles of checkout counters and endless rows of carts.</p><p><strong>Clancy: </strong>In less than a decade, frozen-food sales grew from $496 million to almost $2 billion. It was the fastest-growing segment of the food industry, according to a 2003 study. During that time, exciting new products like frozen OJ, TV dinners, and even frozen pizza were introduced. And this is when we see the rise of those household-name brands, like Eggo, Hungry-Man, or Ellio's.</p><p><strong>Clip: </strong>And your big Birds Eye buy this week is Birds Eye orange juice.</p><p><strong>Clancy:</strong> Birds Eye itself reportedly offered over 100 different items. You can actually see the Birds Eye logo here in a freezer ad from 1948. And grocery stores went from having a couple of hundred products to a few thousand. This A&#38;P ad from 1950 boasts over 2,400 items.</p><p>But possibly the biggest shift was when families started to move to the suburbs. Now you could drive to the supermarket, buy a ton of food, and store it all in your refrigerator, which actually had a freezer built in now.</p><p><strong>Clip: </strong>A completely separate food freezer that holds 84 pounds of frozen foods. There's simply nothing like it.</p><p><strong>Clancy:</strong> Convenience played a bigger role in American homes, and companies capitalized on it. Birds Eye advertised its frozen spinach as the \"work-free-est, farm-freshest.\"</p><p><strong>Bentley: </strong>And so the cuisine and the culture shifts somewhat, and the technology gets better, and the two converge to create this moment where frozen food is seen as no longer, like, low class or a compromise.</p><p><strong>Clancy:</strong> In 1955, The New York Times wrote, \"frozen foods are no longer a specialty item but an integral part of the grocery business.\" And about a decade later, the microwave made things even more convenient. What I can't get over is the brilliance and the absurdity of Birdseye's invention was that it worked really well, but it was engineered way before retailers or consumers were ready for it, or even wanted it. It took two decades and a world war to catch on. But today, frozen foods are cemented into American society.</p><p><strong>Bentley: </strong>And it's emblematic of all of these values that we have always had about food: shelf stable, predictable, relatively low cost, much of it. We want fresh, local, seasonal food. We value that, but we also value frozen food.</p><p><strong>Clancy: </strong>A lot has changed since the days of the icebox. But you can thank Clarence Birdseye, at least in part, for your Kid Cuisine and your DiGiorno. That was maybe a little too much struggle. I'll do a little in between.</p><p>&#160;</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a (Clancy Morgan)","articleImgCdnMap":{"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn67@2020_3/2020/10/20/02-05-22-757_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=vBNcsgzcBeM:03D4_Se-Fyg:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn84@2020_3/2020/10/20/02-05-20-516_a2c831c4023c39ea.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=vBNcsgzcBeM:03D4_Se-Fyg:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn7@2020_6/2020/10/20/02-05-25-379_e2deb96cab096286.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn79@2020_1/2020/10/20/02-05-18-571_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=vBNcsgzcBeM:03D4_Se-Fyg:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn51@2020_5/2020/10/20/02-05-18-456_c1efe9ff1c2e25f6.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/vBNcsgzcBeM":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn91@2020_6/2020/10/20/02-05-14-117_bd4018bd8857c46d.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1603159473340},{"createdTime":"2020-10-20 10:04:33","updatedTime":"2020-10-20 10:04:33","title":"Perdue Chicken faces boycott threats and races to deny connections to Sen. David Perdue, after he mispronounced Sen. Kamala Harris' name as 'Kamala-mala-mala'","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/perdue-chicken-faces-backlash-after-sen-david-perdue-mispronounces-kamala-2020-10","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f2c5d15aee6a8490c1847c8?format=jpeg\" alt=\"david perdue\" height=\"683\" width=\"1024\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Zach Gibson/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>People threatened to boycott Perdue Chicken after Sen. David Perdue repeatedly mispronounced Sen. Kamala Harris' first name at a Trump rally on Friday.</li>\n<li>Perdue Chicken's official Twitter account fired back at any confusion over the weekend, saying the senator is not affiliated with the company.&#160;</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>Some people are threatening to boycott Perdue Chicken after mistakenly associating the company with Republican Sen. David Perdue from Georgia.</p><p>The senator sparked outrage on social media after <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/sen-david-purdue-mispronounces-kamala-harris-name-at-trump-rally-2020-10\">repeatedly mispronouncing</a> the first name of California Sen. Kamala Harris, who is Democratic presidential nominee Joe Biden's running mate.</p><p>Some of that outrage targeted Perdue Chicken, a poultry producer with no relation to Sen. Perdue.</p><p>The company's official Twitter account swiftly sought to dispel any confusion by responding to critics and stating that it has no connection to the senator.</p><blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet blockquote\" data-lang=\"en\" data-cards=\"\" data-conversation=\"\">&#8212;Perdue Chicken  (@PerdueChicken) <a href=\"https://twitter.com/mims/statuses/1317927415805562886?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw\">October 18, 2020</a></blockquote><script async src=\"//platform.twitter.com/widgets.js\" charset=\"utf-8\"></script><p>\"KAH-mah-la, Kah-MAH-la, Kamala-mala-mala, I don't know, whatever,\" Perdue <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/sen-david-purdue-mispronounces-kamala-harris-name-at-trump-rally-2020-10\">said</a> at a Friday Trump rally in front of thousands of supporters. Perdue's campaign communications director, John Burke, later said that the GOP senator \"simply mispronounced Senator Harris' name.\"</p><p>Many others, however, were quick to condemn Perdue's comments given the fact that he and Harris have served in the US Senate together for over three years.&#160;</p><p>\"Well that is incredibly racist,\" Sabrina Singh, Kamala Harris' campaign press secretary <a href=\"https://twitter.com/sabrinasingh24/status/1317234609105547266\">tweeted</a> on Friday.</p><blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet blockquote\" data-lang=\"en\" data-cards=\"\" data-conversation=\"\">&#8212;Dave Brown  (@dave_brown24) <a href=\"https://twitter.com/mims/statuses/1317459203406106624?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw\">October 17, 2020</a></blockquote><script async src=\"//platform.twitter.com/widgets.js\" charset=\"utf-8\"></script><p>This isn't the first time that the Georgia senator landed in hot water for attacking a Democratic candidate. Democratic Senate candidate Jon Ossoff <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/gop-senator-deletes-campaign-ad-that-enlarged-jewish-opponents-nose-2020-7\">accused</a> Perdue in July of using an anti-Semitic trope in a Facebook ad that portrayed Ossoff, who's Jewish, to have an enlarged nose.</p><p>The ad read: \"Democrats are trying to buy Georgia.\" The Perdue campaign deleted the ad and later <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/gop-senator-deletes-campaign-ad-that-enlarged-jewish-opponents-nose-2020-7\">said</a> that the nose enlargement was an \"unintentional\" edit. Perdue and Ossoff are in a <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/georgia-senate-race-david-perdue-vs-jon-ossoff-polls-fundraising-2020-8\">tight US Senate race</a> in a state that has historically voted Republican.</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/perdue-chicken-faces-backlash-after-sen-david-perdue-mispronounces-kamala-2020-10'>Business Insider</a></div><div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a border=\"0\"></img></a>\n</div><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/5AwFl9utIg0\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\"/>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 19 Oct 2020 20:43:53 10:04:33","updatedTime":"2020-10-20 10:04:33","title":"The best backpacking stoves","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-backpacking-stoves","description":"<ul class=\"summary-list\"><li>Eating well on a backpacking trip is often an oxymoron — since the intent is to travel light, bringing food that's fast and easy to prepare is highly preferred.&#160;</li><li>But with the right backpacking stove, you're able to improve the quality of those trail meals without dramatically increasing how much you stow in your backpack.&#160;</li><li>The best backpacking stoves should all have these three features in common: They're portable, reliable in inclement weather, and are fuel-efficient enough to avoid the need for an assortment of gas canisters.</li><li>Our top pick, the <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/MSR-WindBurner-Personal-Stove-System/dp/B076DVTTVW/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener nofollow sponsored\"><strong>MSR WindBurner</strong></a>, is an all-in-one camp stove that's efficient, lightweight, and dependable — and it's worthy of a spot in anyone's backpack.&#160;</li></ul><p>There's nothing quite like enjoying a hot meal at your campsite following a long day on the trail. Energy bars and trail mix do well to curb hunger during the day but when it's time to relax for the night, you'll want something a bit more substantial. That's where a reliable camp stove opens up the options for meals, snacks, and hot beverages, making your <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/camping-essentials-list\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">time in the backcountry</a> much more enjoyable.</p><p>I spend much of the year, regardless of season, either out on a multi-day backpacking trip or planning my next one — and I've learned that prioritizing how and what I'll eat is always a vital consideration. This means making sure I'm able to start each morning with a cup of <a href=\"https://www.avantlink.com/click.php?tt=cl&mi=10248&pw=184534&ctc=biipgf_022720_best-backpacking-camp-stoves&url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.rei.com%2Fproduct%2F123167%2Falpine-start-instant-coffee-package-of-8fee-package-of-8\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">instant coffee</a> and a few bites of <a href=\"https://www.avantlink.com/click.php?tt=cl&mi=10248&pw=184534&ctc=biipgf_022720_best-backpacking-camp-stoves&url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.rei.com%2Fproduct%2F175698%2Fmountain-house-scrambled-eggs-with-bacon-single-servingn-single-serving\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">rehydrated scrambled eggs</a> so that I'm replenished enough and able to take on however many grueling miles lay ahead.&#160;&#160;</p><p>Refueling at night is just as important, too. A satisfying evening meal goes a long way to making my legs feel less tired and my body less sore, despite having hauled a 30-pound pack for several hours prior. Satisfying those meal needs always comes down to the type of backpacking stove I bring along. Even on shorter trips, it always finds its way into my pack — it's <em>that</em> important.&#160;</p><p>To find the best currently available, I tested an array of camp stoves from popular brands like MSR and JetBoil (as well as a budget model from BRS). As you'll notice by which stoves ultimately made this guide, those two brands have the backpacking camp stove market almost entirely covered, and recommending another brand just for the sake of it isn't worth it — these are the best for a reason. At the bottom of this guide, you'll find some tips on <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-backpacking-stoves#how-to-shop-for-a-backpacking-stove-6\" rel=\"noopener\">how to shop for a backpacking stove</a> and what else to consider, as well as the <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-backpacking-stoves#how-we-test-backpacking-stoves-7\" rel=\"noopener\">testing methodology I used</a>.&#160;</p><h2>Here are the best backpacking stoves:</h2><ul class=\"summary-list\"><li><strong>Best backpacking stove overall: </strong><a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/MSR-WindBurner-Personal-Stove-System/dp/B076DVTTVW/ref=as_li_ss_tl?ie=UTF8&linkCode=ll1&tag=biipgf_022720_best-backpacking-camp-stoves-20&linkId=a564b18148f9d981f86c8bded6276881&language=en_USp;language=en_US\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\"><strong>MSR WindBurner</strong></a></li><li><strong>Best ultralight backpacking stove: </strong><a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/Pocketrocket-Deluxe-Stove-Color-SIZE/dp/B07L5S65HR/ref=as_li_ss_tl?ie=UTF8&linkCode=ll1&tag=biipgf_022720_best-backpacking-camp-stoves-20&linkId=0d5fed9ecb0e7addaa8db25c154e9f1e&language=en_USp;language=en_US\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\"><strong>MSR PocketRocket Deluxe</strong></a></li><li><strong>Best budget backpacking stove:&#160; </strong><a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/BRS-Ultralight-Camping-Portable-Titanium/dp/B01AKF4USW/ref=as_li_ss_tl?ie=UTF8&linkCode=ll1&tag=biipgf_022720_best-backpacking-camp-stoves-20&linkId=1812556040fb925062129b949d6b5829&language=en_USp;language=en_US\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\"><strong>BRS 3000-T Ultralight</strong></a></li><li><strong>Best beginner backpacking stove: </strong><a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/Jetboil-Flash-Camping-Cooking-System/dp/B07N8HMPYF/ref=as_li_ss_tl?ie=UTF8&linkCode=ll1&tag=biipgf_022720_best-backpacking-camp-stoves-20&linkId=9c1c24c6914296a35400ac1124f5c4f9&language=en_USp;language=en_US\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\"><strong>JetBoil Flash</strong></a></li><li><strong>Best travel backpacking stove: </strong><a backpacking stove overall\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e5821a9fee23d1de1534f4d?format=jpeg\" alt=\"msr windburner stove\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Amazon</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3>You'll always want to consider weight, size, efficiency, and ease of use when shopping for a backpacking stove and none deliver on those as well as the <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/MSR-WindBurner-Personal-Stove-System/dp/B076DVTTVW/ref=as_li_ss_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;linkCode=ll1&#38;tag=biipgf_022720_best-backpacking-camp-stoves-20&#38;linkId=a564b18148f9d981f86c8bded6276881&#38;language=en_US\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">MSR WindBurner</a>, the best stove currently available.&#160;</h3><p>MSR's made excellent backpacking stoves for decades and one of the mainstays in its line-up is the <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/MSR-WindBurner-Personal-Stove-System/dp/B076DVTTVW/ref=as_li_ss_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;linkCode=ll1&#38;tag=biipgf_022720_best-backpacking-camp-stoves-20&#38;linkId=a564b18148f9d981f86c8bded6276881&#38;language=en_US\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">WindBurner Personal Stove System</a>. What makes this particular stove stand out is that it's an all-in-one option that gives users everything they need in one package. That includes the stove itself, a 1-liter insulated cook pot, a stabilizer, straining lid, and a plastic bowl. The only added extra you'd need is a canister of fuel and you're set.</p><p>Unlike other all-in-one systems, the <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/MSR-WindBurner-Personal-Stove-System/dp/B076DVTTVW/ref=as_li_ss_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;linkCode=ll1&#38;tag=biipgf_022720_best-backpacking-camp-stoves-20&#38;linkId=a564b18148f9d981f86c8bded6276881&#38;language=en_US\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">WindBurner</a> offers a few extras that make it easier to use. For instance, its simmer-control system allows users to dial in exactly how much heat they want to apply to the pot. This also provides a measure of control over fuel consumption.&#160;</p><p>The <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/MSR-WindBurner-Personal-Stove-System/dp/B076DVTTVW/ref=as_li_ss_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;linkCode=ll1&#38;tag=biipgf_022720_best-backpacking-camp-stoves-20&#38;linkId=a564b18148f9d981f86c8bded6276881&#38;language=en_US\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">WindBurner</a> truly shines with its versatility and efficiency. Very few backpacking stoves are as good in cold and windy conditions, and most use more fuel when preparing a meal. In fact, the WindBurner often gets twice as many uses out of a single fuel canister as its competition. That performance remains surprisingly consistent, too, even when used in a variety of environments or altitudes.&#160;</p><p>Weighing in at 15.2 ounces, the <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/MSR-WindBurner-Personal-Stove-System/dp/B076DVTTVW/ref=as_li_ss_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;linkCode=ll1&#38;tag=biipgf_022720_best-backpacking-camp-stoves-20&#38;linkId=a564b18148f9d981f86c8bded6276881&#38;language=en_US\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">WindBurner</a> isn't the lightest stove on this list but it is compact enough to comfortably carry inside a backpack, along with each of the add-ons which store inside one another. The entire package is easy to clean and can be set up or taken apart quickly. It also has the ability to boil a liter of water in just four and a half minutes, which is quite fast for a model of this size.&#160;</p><p><strong>Pros: </strong>Compact, fast, and efficient, the MSR WindBurner is an all-in-one system that backpackers will love</p><p><strong>Cons: </strong>No built-in igniter and not as lightweight as some other models</p>\n\tBest ultralight backpacking stove\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e5821fffee23d246e72ed53?format=jpeg\" alt=\"msr pocketrocket deluxe\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Amazon</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3>Ounce counters will love the <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/Pocketrocket-Deluxe-Stove-Color-SIZE/dp/B07L5S65HR/ref=as_li_ss_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;linkCode=ll1&#38;tag=biipgf_022720_best-backpacking-camp-stoves-20&#38;linkId=0d5fed9ecb0e7addaa8db25c154e9f1e&#38;language=en_US\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\">MSR PocketRocket Deluxe</a>, which delivers outstanding performance in a tiny package. If you want to travel fast and light, this is the stove you need.&#160;</h3><p>MSR's original PocketRocket is an iconic piece of gear in the outdoor industry, setting new standards for lightweight performance from a backpacking stove. But the new Deluxe model takes things to a new level by adding a push-button starter and a regulator for improved control in cold environments.&#160;</p><p>The <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/Pocketrocket-Deluxe-Stove-Color-SIZE/dp/B07L5S65HR/ref=as_li_ss_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;linkCode=ll1&#38;tag=biipgf_022720_best-backpacking-camp-stoves-20&#38;linkId=0d5fed9ecb0e7addaa8db25c154e9f1e&#38;language=en_US\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\">PocketRocket Deluxe</a> tips the scales at a mere 2.9 ounces, making it one of the more svelte stoves on the market. It also measures just 3.3 inches in length, which is considerably smaller than almost any other model. Despite the small size, it still manages to perform well, boiling water at a rapid clip and offering solid fuel efficiency, too. It even has an integrated simmer control and a solid level of wind resistance, which aren't common in similar stoves.</p><p>With this <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/Pocketrocket-Deluxe-Stove-Color-SIZE/dp/B07L5S65HR/ref=as_li_ss_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;linkCode=ll1&#38;tag=biipgf_022720_best-backpacking-camp-stoves-20&#38;linkId=0d5fed9ecb0e7addaa8db25c154e9f1e&#38;language=en_US\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\">new-generation of PocketRocket</a>, MSR included an onboard igniter, eliminating the need to carry matches or a lighter. The igniter can be a source of frustration at times, though, as it's not always 100 percent reliable.&#160;</p><p>It's worth pointing out that this stove isn't a full cooking system, meaning you'll need to bring a pot to prepare your meal (and possibly to eat from). Those additional items take up space and add weight to your pack, potentially negating any shaved ounces from using the PocketRocket in the first place. Additionally, the stove's pot supports aren't very large and can create some instability when used on uneven ground.&#160;</p><p>Still, this little stove punches well above its weight class, delivering outstanding all-around performance in a tiny form factor. That alone makes it easy to recommend as the best ultralight backpacking stove available today.</p><p><strong>Pros: </strong>Weighs less than 3 ounces, yet is still fast, efficient, and powerful</p><p><strong>Cons:</strong> Built-in igniter can be finicky and pot supports aren't overly large</p>\n\tBest budget backpacking stove\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e582344fee23d1fbb282d05?format=jpeg\" alt=\"BRS\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Amazon</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3>The <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/BRS-Ultralight-Camping-Portable-Titanium/dp/B01AKF4USW/ref=as_li_ss_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;linkCode=ll1&#38;tag=biipgf_022720_best-backpacking-camp-stoves-20&#38;linkId=1812556040fb925062129b949d6b5829&#38;language=en_US\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener nofollow\">BRS 3000-T Ultralight</a> stove is a budget-conscious backpacker's dream. Not only does it weigh next to nothing but it offers solid performance at a rock-bottom price, making it a great choice for those who'd rather spend their hard-earned money on other gear instead.&#160;</h3><p>Budget-friendly backpacking stoves aren't particularly common in the outdoor industry but occasionally a model comes along that manages to offer solid performance at a great price. Such is the case with the <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/BRS-Ultralight-Camping-Portable-Titanium/dp/B01AKF4USW/ref=as_li_ss_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;linkCode=ll1&#38;tag=biipgf_022720_best-backpacking-camp-stoves-20&#38;linkId=1812556040fb925062129b949d6b5829&#38;language=en_US\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\">BRS 3000-T Ultralight</a>, a stove that's compact, lightweight, and easy on the wallet.&#160;</p><p>You won't find a lot in the way of frills on this stove, though. It doesn't have a built-in starter, nor does it include simmer control or a regulator to help maintain performance in cold or windy conditions. The BRS 3000-T is the very definition of a basic backpacking stove, with just the bare minimum of features.&#160;</p><p>With that said, it does weigh less than an ounce and boils a liter of water in roughly three minutes. It also comes with a set of built-in pot holders that do a reasonably good job of maintaining balance even on rough terrain. Best of all, the <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/BRS-Ultralight-Camping-Portable-Titanium/dp/B01AKF4USW/ref=as_li_ss_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;linkCode=ll1&#38;tag=biipgf_022720_best-backpacking-camp-stoves-20&#38;linkId=1812556040fb925062129b949d6b5829&#38;language=en_US\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\">BRS 3000-T</a> costs just $17, making it an absolute bargain.&#160;</p><p>Of course, at that price, this stove does come with a few caveats. It's recommended that backpackers handle it with care as it isn't the most durable. The stove can also perform poorly in windy conditions and its small burner head delivers only average performance.&#160;</p><p><strong>Pros: </strong>Very inexpensive and lightweight compared to other models</p><p><strong>Cons: </strong>Not very durable and average performance in all but the best of outdoor conditions&#160;</p>\n\tBest backpacking stove for beginners\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e582372fee23d2c5b5fa644?format=jpeg\" alt=\"jetboil flash\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Amazon</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3>The <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/Jetboil-Flash-Camping-Cooking-System/dp/B07N8HMPYF/ref=as_li_ss_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;linkCode=ll1&#38;tag=biipgf_022720_best-backpacking-camp-stoves-20&#38;linkId=0eb561d9793468c9d076fbc85be18b92&#38;language=en_US\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\">JetBoil Flash</a> offers excellent all-around performance and great features that make it especially beginner-friendly. Compact and convenient, this is a stove first-time backpackers can quickly learn to operate and continue to use for many years.&#160;</h3><p>Inexperienced backpackers looking for a great first backpacking stove should look no further than the <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/Jetboil-Flash-Camping-Cooking-System/dp/B07N8HMPYF/ref=as_li_ss_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;linkCode=ll1&#38;tag=biipgf_022720_best-backpacking-camp-stoves-20&#38;linkId=0eb561d9793468c9d076fbc85be18b92&#38;language=en_US\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\">JetBoil Flash</a>. Like the MSR WindBurner, this model is an all-in-one solution that not only provides a stove but also a cooking pot wrapped in a protective outer shell. That's essentially all you need to prepare the dehydrated backpacking meals that have become increasingly popular in recent years.&#160;</p><p>The <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/Jetboil-Flash-Camping-Cooking-System/dp/B07N8HMPYF/ref=as_li_ss_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;linkCode=ll1&#38;tag=biipgf_022720_best-backpacking-camp-stoves-20&#38;linkId=0eb561d9793468c9d076fbc85be18b92&#38;language=en_US\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\">JetBoil's</a> ease of use is one of its biggest strengths. Simply fill up the pot with water and you're ready to go. The entire system connects seamlessly to a gas canister, allowing the Flash to bring liquids to a boil in about three and a half minutes. That means you won't have to wait long to get a warm meal or a hot beverage.</p><p>With its built-in heat exchanger, the Flash remains efficient, even in shifting weather conditions and colder temperatures. While not as fuel-efficient as the WindBurner, it still does a decent job of getting as much performance out of a single canister as possible.</p><p>At 13.1 ounces, the <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/Jetboil-Flash-Camping-Cooking-System/dp/B07N8HMPYF/ref=as_li_ss_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;linkCode=ll1&#38;tag=biipgf_022720_best-backpacking-camp-stoves-20&#38;linkId=0eb561d9793468c9d076fbc85be18b92&#38;language=en_US\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\">JetBoil Flash</a> falls into the middle ground concerning size and weight. Smaller stoves, such as the MSR PocketRocket Deluxe, are more compact and less bulky but don't include pots to prepare a meal, making the weight difference much closer than it seems. The Flash's modular design only enhances its reputation as an easy to use option, too.&#160;</p><p><strong>Pros: </strong>Fast and relatively efficient, the <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/Jetboil-Flash-Camping-Cooking-System/dp/B07N8HMPYF/ref=as_li_ss_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;linkCode=ll1&#38;tag=biipgf_022720_best-backpacking-camp-stoves-20&#38;linkId=0eb561d9793468c9d076fbc85be18b92&#38;language=en_US\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\">JetBoil Flash</a> is extremely easy to operate, making it a great choice for beginners</p><p><strong>Cons: </strong>No simmer control means the stove lacks subtle options when cooking a meal and its loss of efficiency in windy conditions is noticeable</p>\n\tBest travel backpacking stove\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e58255cfee23d2edf335308?format=jpeg\" alt=\"msr whisperlite universal\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Amazon</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3>The <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/MSR-WhisperLite-Universal-Canister-Liquid/dp/B005I6P2VS/ref=as_li_ss_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;linkCode=ll1&#38;tag=biipgf_022720_best-backpacking-camp-stoves-20&#38;linkId=82a679855dd13a33fff8abd0e0206bd8&#38;language=en_US\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener nofollow sponsored\">MSR WhisperLite Universal</a> is easy to travel with and uses liquid fuel rather than traditional gas canisters, making it the best backpacking stove for those going abroad.</h3><p>Another mainstay in the MSR line-up, the <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/MSR-WhisperLite-Universal-Canister-Liquid/dp/B005I6P2VS/ref=as_li_ss_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;linkCode=ll1&#38;tag=biipgf_022720_best-backpacking-camp-stoves-20&#38;linkId=82a679855dd13a33fff8abd0e0206bd8&#38;language=en_US\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener nofollow sponsored\">WhisperLite Universal</a> is without a doubt the best option for backpackers traveling outside the U.S. This stove comes with its own canister which can be filled with a variety of fuels, including white gas, kerosene, or even unleaded gasoline. It even uses standard isobutane-propane canisters when available, allowing this a stove to go anywhere you're able to find a viable fuel source.&#160;</p><p>Compact and easy to carry, the <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/MSR-WhisperLite-Universal-Canister-Liquid/dp/B005I6P2VS/ref=as_li_ss_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;linkCode=ll1&#38;tag=biipgf_022720_best-backpacking-camp-stoves-20&#38;linkId=82a679855dd13a33fff8abd0e0206bd8&#38;language=en_US\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener nofollow sponsored\">WhisperLite Universal</a> heats up quickly and gets nearly two hours of burn time from a single canister of white gas. Its overall efficiency varies depending on the fuel but it typically boils a liter of water in under four minutes. The stove is also easy to use, supports large pots for feeding groups of campers, and is surprisingly quiet for a liquid gas model.</p><p>The downside of using this type of stove is that it requires routine maintenance to keep it performing optimally. This maintenance isn't particularly difficult but can be daunting and intimidating to newcomers. Additionally, at 14.9 ounces in weight, it's a little heavier compared to other options.&#160;</p><p>MSR ships the <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/MSR-WhisperLite-Universal-Canister-Liquid/dp/B005I6P2VS/ref=as_li_ss_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;linkCode=ll1&#38;tag=biipgf_022720_best-backpacking-camp-stoves-20&#38;linkId=82a679855dd13a33fff8abd0e0206bd8&#38;language=en_US\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener nofollow sponsored\">WhisperLite</a> with a fuel pump, heat reflector, and a windscreen to help improve performance in windy conditions. It also comes with a few small parts to aid in the maintenance process. Unfortunately, a fuel bottle is not included, which adds an extra expense for international travelers, as well as a few additional ounces.&#160;</p><p><strong>Pros: </strong>Fast and efficient, compatible with multiple types of fuel which adds versatility and makes it great for international travel</p><p><strong>Cons: </strong>A bit on the heavy side and requires regular maintenance in order to achieve optimal performance</p>\n\tHow to shop for a backpacking stove\n\t\n\t<p>Shopping for a backpacking stove is different than <a href=\"https://www.insider.com/car-camp-kitchen\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">what you'd look for while car camping</a>, where size and weight don't matter as much. When you're carrying your entire allotment of gear inside a backpack, it's vital to go small and lightweight. It's also important to find a stove that's highly fuel-efficient in order to reduce the number of gas canisters you'll need.&#160;</p><p>But those aren't the only features to consider. You'll also want to take into account the number of people the stove supports, the kind of fuel it uses, and how durable it is. As with all outdoor gear, your stove should be extremely reliable and easy to use, as well. After all, there's nothing quite like arriving at your campsite after sunset, exhausted and hungry, only to find your stove won't start.&#160;</p><h3>What else to consider</h3><p>It's also important to think about when and where you'll be using your camp stove. If you go backpacking in cold and windy conditions, you'll want a stove that quickly boils water without using excess fuel. The same holds true when hiking at higher altitudes, where thinner air has a dramatic impact on efficiency.&#160;</p><p>If this sounds too complex or overwhelming, fret not. There are plenty of reliable backpacking stoves to choose from, many of which are lightweight, compact, and fast. In fact, we've field-tested a crop of stoves currently available and came away impressed. There are now options available for just about every type of backpacker with any kind of budget.&#160;</p>\n\tHow we test backpacking stoves\n\t\n\t<p>Each stove featured in this guide went through a series of on-trail tests to see how well it held up across these four categories:&#160;<strong>Portability, weight, dependability,&#160;</strong>and <strong>value</strong>. Here's how each category specifically factored into which backpacking stoves ultimately made this guide:</p><ul><li><strong>Weight:&#160;</strong>For literally anything backpacking-related, weight is perhaps&#160;<em>the</em> most important consideration. Even if you're not an ultralight backpacker, counting down to the ounce is common practice, and your camp stove is no different. During each test, we loaded a backpack with roughly 20 pounds of gear (sleeping bag, clothing, food, headlamps, etc.) and would spend one to two days with the stove in our backpack, and at least one day with it in someone else's. This helped us judge just how much of a difference those ounces truly made.</li><li><strong>Portability:&#160;</strong>Though weight may first come to mind when assessing how portable a camp stove is, we also judged how well the stove packed down, whether into itself or as pieces that were easily packable. A highly portable backpacking stove shouldn't take up much valuable room in your pack, and also shouldn't be so many separate pieces that you feel like you're assembling a jigsaw puzzle each day.&#160;</li><li><strong>Dependability:&#160;</strong>Setting up camp after a grueling day on the trail can turn sour&#160;<em>very</em> quickly if the stove you're about to rely on for sustenance doesn't work (and this is doubly true when the weather starts to turn wet, cold, and windy). We've tested these stoves in hot weather often but also made sure to put them through their paces when the wind and rain picked up. For these, we had to resort to doing so in our backyard, though time spent on-trail this winter will allow for further testing.</li><li><strong>Value:&#160;</strong>The value of a backpacking camp stove isn't just how much it costs but more so a combination of the three categories before it, as well as what it's final sticker price. You want something that's dependable and often that means spending a little more for something you can rely on (as opposed to spending less, more often on an inferior stove).&#160;</li></ul>\n\tCheck out more Insider Reviews Outdoors coverage\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5ebc0550578532722f212f15?format=jpeg\" alt=\"camping trip\" height=\"828\" width=\"1104\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">REI Co-op</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-sleeping-bags\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">The best sleeping bags</a></h3><p>Whether you're on the hunt for an ultra-comfy backcountry sleeping bag or need a budget-friendly option to round out your kit, we tested dozens from brands like REI Co-op and Big Agnes to find the industry's best.&#160;</p><h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/camping-essentials-list\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">The essential camping pack list</a></h3><p>Packing for a camping trip isn't just about throwing a tent and sleeping bag into the back of your car &#8212; it's a science. For car campers looking to rough it the right way, this checklist helps guide you through all the essential items you'll need to be prepared.&#160;</p>\n</div><div class=\"read-original\">Read the Becker)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5e5821a9fee23d1de1534f4d?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn52@2020_4/2020/10/20/02-05-15-116_df434bd282180cef.webp","https://i.insider.com/5e5821fffee23d246e72ed53?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn23@2020_1/2020/10/20/02-05-14-971_9c151e6db02a3db5.webp","https://i.insider.com/5e582344fee23d1fbb282d05?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn15@2020_6/2020/10/20/02-05-18-164_215681643aff38ae.webp","https://i.insider.com/5e582372fee23d2c5b5fa644?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn35@2020_3/2020/10/20/02-05-21-649_44f04758363300f2.webp","https://i.insider.com/5e58255cfee23d2edf335308?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn49@2020_2/2020/10/20/02-05-12-845_e3703cfb9f50ac23.webp","https://i.insider.com/5ebc0550578532722f212f15?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn80@2020_3/2020/10/20/02-05-17-868_a57fd73699e59190.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn67@2020_3/2020/10/20/02-05-22-757_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=Ecun-Jzac8g:LXOpL_WD0eo:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn15@2020_1/2020/10/20/02-05-19-044_5236e8a9bdd7debc.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=Ecun-Jzac8g:LXOpL_WD0eo:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn23@2020_3/2020/10/20/02-05-20-878_b7c723b5ec0bc8c8.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn79@2020_1/2020/10/20/02-05-18-571_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=Ecun-Jzac8g:LXOpL_WD0eo:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx23/cdn20@2020_3/2020/10/20/02-05-17-468_0b0e2ff66a85e84b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/Ecun-Jzac8g":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn15@2020_2/2020/10/20/02-05-17-218_95264098bb7cd20f.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1603159473359},{"createdTime":"2020-10-20 10:04:33","updatedTime":"2020-10-20 10:04:33","title":"Trump and Biden are virtually tied in swing state Ohio 2 weeks before Election Day","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/trump-biden-tied-in-ohio-two-weeks-until-election-day-2020-10","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f8da1fe9e9fe4001900a0d7?format=jpeg\" alt=\"trump biden debate shut up man\" height=\"1196\" width=\"2392\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Democratic nominee Joe Biden and President Donald Trump during the first presidential debate.\n<p class=\"copyright\">JIM WATSON/AFP via Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>With about two weeks until Election Day, President Donald Trump and Democratic nominee Joe Biden are virtually tied in Ohio, a key swing state in this election.</li>\n<li>After voting for President Barack Obama in 2008 and 2012, the state swung right and voted for Trump over Hillary Clinton by 8.1 percentage points in 2016.</li>\n<li>Ohio holds 18 electoral votes.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>With about two weeks until Election Day, President Donald Trump and Democratic nominee Joe Biden are virtually tied in Ohio.</p><p>Losing the state would not substantially hurt Biden's chances for president, but it would be disastrous for Trump: Not a single Republican candidate has ever ascended to the presidency without winning Ohio.</p><p>Ohio is the quintessential swing state: the state has flipped which party it votes for in presidential elections <a href=\"https://www.270towin.com/states/ohio\">six times</a> in the last 12 years and currently possesses 18 electoral votes. But after the state voted Democrat for President Barack Obama in 2008 and 2012, it characteristically swung right once again in 2016 and voted for Trump over Democratic nominee Hillary Clinton by <a href=\"https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/u/0/d/1zxyOQDjNOJS_UkzerorUCf2OAdcMcIQEwRciKuYBIZ4/pubhtml/sheet?headers=false&gid=6587268026802\">8.1 percentage points</a>.&#160;&#160;</p><p>According to election forecasting from <a href=\"https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2020-election-forecast/ohio/\">FiveThirtyEight</a>, Trump currently has just a 51% chance of winning in Ohio. <a href=\"https://forecast.decisiondeskhq.com/president/P2020OH\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"100\" data-uri=\"edfbe557d3ccde38f66725ce096e16f8\">Similar forecasting</a> from Decision Desk HQ shows Trump with a 55.6% chance of emerging victorious in the state.</p><p>In DDHQ simulations, only 7% of instances where Trump wins a second term in office are accompanied by a loss in Ohio. Conversely, simulations show a second Trump term accompanied by a win in the Ohio 93% of the time.&#160;</p><p>But while Trump is narrowly predicted to win by election forecasters, recent polling shows that Biden may be gaining an edge in the Buckeye State. Polling from October 8 to October 12 by <a href=\"https://poll.qu.edu/georgia/release-detail?ReleaseID=3679\">Quinnipiac University</a> estimates Biden leading Trump by 1 percentage point among likely voters in the state.&#160;</p><p>According to <a href=\"https://twitter.com/MediumBuying/status/1318195004578422785\">Medium Buying</a>, a media buying and tracking company based out of Ohio, the Trump campaign recently cancelled scheduled television ads in Ohio. This comes just one week after reports of the Trump <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/trump-campaign-nearly-went-broke-amid-200-million-budget-shortfall-2020-10\">campaign nearly going broke</a>, so campaign officials may be reconfiguring its spending to what it deems to be more crucial at this time, though it is difficult to find a more important race at the moment.</p><p>According to Kiel Williams, an author at DDHQ, losing in Ohio would severely hurt Trump's chances in nearby battleground states.</p><p dir=\"ltr\">\"Ohio is also emblematic of the winning coalition Trump assembled in 2016: a Midwestern Rust Belt state, where supercharged rural support propelled Trump to victory following back-to-back Obama wins,\" Williams said. \"If Trump has lost enough support to lose Ohio, he has almost certainly lost Wisconsin, Michigan, and Pennsylvania as well.\"</p><p dir=\"ltr\">If the Trump campaign is to win over undecided voters in the Rust Belt, it must act quickly before it is too late.</p><p>As of October 19, <a href=\"https://electproject.github.io/Early-Vote-2020G/index.html\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"100\" data-uri=\"92235dcf49c8479097fa7c34970cf487\">over 28 million people</a> have already cast their votes through mail-in and early voting in an election expected to receive the most mailed votes in US history. At this point in 2016, about two weeks away from the election, <a href=\"http://www.electproject.org/early_2016\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"100\" data-uri=\"87fe344aa09337f91a2aa54ef72f5e18\">just 5.9 million mail-in votes</a>&#160;had been cast. According to&#160;<a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/america-likely-wont-know-presidential-race-winner-on-election-night-2020-5\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"100\" data-uri=\"1e9ae4f6973e5e60f4f470f70336a2d3\">voting rights experts</a>, voting by mail is expected to make up 50% to 70% of the total vote in November.</p><p dir=\"ltr\">\"Bottom line: Trump cannot realistically afford to lose Georgia, Florida, or Ohio while also winning reelection. That Trump is currently struggling in all three states is indicative of the extent to which his reelection is in serious jeopardy,\" said Williams.</p><section></section><div Luckily, there are more work-appropriate leggings out there now more than there have ever been. Thanks to details like pleats, buttons, and belt loops, your favorite weekend wear looks more like officewear these days.&#160;</p><p>What is considered \"appropriate\" for the office varies from workplace to workplace. pockets and other great little details.</h3><p>The only way to make work-appropriate leggings even more of a blessing is to give them pockets. And that's exactly what <a href=\"https://shareasale.com/r.cfm?b=999&#38;u=1088116&#38;m=63261&#38;urllink=www.thisisaday.com%2F%23%21%2Fproducts%2Fcategories%2Fbottoms\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow nofollow sponsored\">ADAY</a> has done with its <a href=\"https://shareasale.com/r.cfm?b=999&#38;u=1088116&#38;m=63261&#38;urllink=www.thisisaday.com%2Fcollections%2Fleggings%2Fproducts%2Fthrow-roll-legging%3Fvariant%3D31288417058953\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Throw &#38; Roll Leggings</a>.</p><p>ADAY is all about simplicity and seeks to create fabrics and clothing that are multipurpose, long-lasting, and sustainable. And that's incredibly evident in the brand's Throw &#38; Roll leggings. Thanks to small details like zippered pockets with locks to keep them from jangling, these leggings look too good for a workout (but would certainly stand up to one).</p><p>The Throw &#38; Roll Leggings are made out of a quick-drying, sweat-wicking material that is also sunscreen- and oil-resistant. We love these leggings so much, we even named them our <a href=\"https://www.insider.com/best-leggings#the-best-leggings-overall-1\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">best leggings overall</a> &#8212; not just for work.&#160;</p><p><strong>Pros: </strong>Leggings that are truly made for work, convenient pockets, little details add sophistication</p><p><strong>Cons:&#160;</strong>These leggings are extremely thick, which is great for dealing with opacity issues, but tough in the summer</p>\n\tThe best formal leggings for work\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f8a0957d260780019341f8b?format=jpeg\" alt=\"JetSetTrouser\" height=\"1068\" width=\"1424\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Époque Évolution</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3>With their sophisticated pleats and unique front slits, the <a href=\"https://go.skimresources.com?id=35871X943606&#38;xs=1&#38;url=https%3A%2F%2Fepoqueevolution.com%2Fcollections%2Fbottoms%2Fproducts%2Fjet-set-trouser%3Fsscid%3Da1k4_j9fp6%26\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow nofollow nofollow nofollow noopener sponsored sponsored sponsored sponsored\">Jet Setter Trousers</a> from &#233;poque &#233;volution look like slacks, but feel like leggings.&#160;</h3><p>The <a href=\"https://go.skimresources.com?id=35871X943606&#38;xs=1&#38;url=https%3A%2F%2Fepoqueevolution.com%2Fcollections%2Fbottoms%2Fproducts%2Fjet-set-trouser%3Fsscid%3Da1k4_j9fp6%26\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow nofollow noopener sponsored sponsored\">Jet Setter Trouser</a> by &#233;poque &#233;volution may be expensive, but we think of them more as a real pair of work trousers that just so happen to be comfy enough to wear on the weekends.</p><p>The front slit adds a touch of sophistication and a unique twist, but it also means you can wear the leggings over a pair of ankle boots, which looks a lot more sophisticated than just tucking regular leggings into a boot shaft. The material is slick and stretchy, and it pairs really well with oversized blazers or white button-downs. Plus, a back pocket makes them more practical than plain leggings.</p><p>The <a href=\"https://go.skimresources.com?id=35871X943606&#38;xs=1&#38;url=https%3A%2F%2Fepoqueevolution.com%2Fcollections%2Fbottoms%2Fproducts%2Fjet-set-trouser%3Fsscid%3Da1k4_j9fp6%26\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow nofollow noopener sponsored sponsored\">Jet Setter Trouser</a> also comes in sizes up to 16, with the option for a petite hem.</p><p>Our senior editor Sally Kaplan calls these her favorite leggings for work, and though she acknowledges the price isn't ideal, she will passionately tell you that they're worth the cost if you have the budget &#8212; especially if you're someone who prefers to maintain a more edited \"better, not more\" kind of closet.</p><p><strong>Pros:&#160;</strong>Super comfortable, sophisticated pleats, handy back pocket</p><p><strong>Cons:&#160;</strong>Some customers have said the length is a little short on taller folks</p>\n\tThe best cropped leggings for work\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f8a0aabd260780019341f90?format=jpeg\" alt=\"PonteLeggingKickFlare\" height=\"1084\" width=\"1445\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">American Giant</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><a href=\"https://go.skimresources.com?id=35871X943606&#38;xs=1&#38;url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.american-giant.com%2Fproducts%2Fwomens-ponte-legging-kick-flare-super-black\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">American Giant's Ponte Legging Kick Flare</a> are super minimal and ultra cropped, making them look more like trousers than leggings.&#160;&#160;</h3><p>These leggings from American Giant are made from a ponte knit fabric that's thick and supportive, so you'll never have to worry about your pants looking see-through. Thanks to the slight crop and the understated kick flare, they look like real trousers, but feel just like loungewear.</p><p>The <a href=\"https://go.skimresources.com?id=35871X943606&#38;xs=1&#38;url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.american-giant.com%2Fproducts%2Fwomens-ponte-legging-kick-flare-super-black\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Ponte Legging Kick Flares</a> feature a no-droop waistband, so you can wear them all day long without them stretching out. And while other leggings feature more pockets than these ones, they do have a small front pocket that's big enough for your phone and a credit card.&#160;</p><p>The real beauty in the <a href=\"https://go.skimresources.com?id=35871X943606&#38;xs=1&#38;url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.american-giant.com%2Fproducts%2Fwomens-ponte-legging-kick-flare-super-black\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Ponte Legging Kick Flares</a>, though, is in the detail, including a thick hem that makes them look tailored and polished. From the knee down, they're your perfect work slacks. And from the knee up? Some of the coziest leggings you've ever worn.&#160;</p><p><strong>Pros:&#160;</strong>Trendy kick flare, no-roll waistband, and super thick material</p><p><strong>Cons:</strong> The inner thigh area begins to pill after a while due to chaffing, and if you're tall, the crop may be slightly short</p>\n\tThe best petite-friendly leggings for work\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5d6edd9b2e22af10ea4cab23?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Screen Shot 2019 09 03 at 5.18.37 PM\" height=\"1385\" width=\"1846\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Banana Republic</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><a href=\"https://gap.igs4ds.net/c/196318/383276/5554?u=https%3A%2F%2Fbananarepublic.gap.com%2F%3Ftid%3Dbraff6415797%26ap%3D2%26siteID%3Dbrafcid11555231%26cjevent%3Df4d65b9c123211eb82a504870a240612\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Banana Republic</a>'s petite leggings are fitted and structured like traditional workwear, but with the feel of loungewear.&#160;</h3><p>Banana Republic is one of our team's go-to destinations for reliable petite work pants, and their <a href=\"https://gap.igs4ds.net/c/196318/383276/5554?u=https%3A%2F%2Fbananarepublic.gap.com%2Fbrowse%2Fproduct.do%3Fpid%3D874755%26irgwc%3D1%26clickid%3DwKvWrsXezxyOT1-wUx0Mo38LUkExSFWMwx2wSM0%26ap%3D6%26tid%3Dbraff3640647%26siteID%3Dbrafcid383276%23pdp-page-content\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow nofollow sponsored\">Petite Devon Legging</a> is a great example for why.&#160;</p><p>The <a href=\"https://gap.igs4ds.net/c/196318/383276/5554?u=https%3A%2F%2Fbananarepublic.gap.com%2Fbrowse%2Fproduct.do%3Fpid%3D874755%26irgwc%3D1%26clickid%3DwKvWrsXezxyOT1-wUx0Mo38LUkExSFWMwx2wSM0%26ap%3D6%26tid%3Dbraff3640647%26siteID%3Dbrafcid383276%23pdp-page-content\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow nofollow sponsored\">Petite Devon</a> sits at the waist, runs fitted through the leg to the ankle, and is offered in three inseams that produce the effect of nicely tailored workwear. The three leg lengths are 26-inch petite, 28-inch regular, and 31-inch long. Petite sizes go from 00 up to 14.</p><p>The bi-stretch material (a blend of cotton, rayon, and elastane) is machine-washable and remains stretchy even after multiple washes. A hidden zipper keeps the look streamlined, and darts added in the back lend a figure-flattering fit.&#160;</p><p>Another benefit to shopping at a big store like Banana Republic is catching your favorite items on sale. While 40% off styles may be unlikely at smaller startups, it's commonplace here. If you shop strategically, it's more likely you can get a deal. <em>&#8212; Mara Leighton</em></p><p><strong>Pros:</strong> Comfy \"legging-fit\" with the look of a work trouser, stretchy fabric that withstands multiple washes</p><p><strong>Cons: </strong>Some reviewers noted quality issues with the zipper</p>\n\tThe best size-inclusive leggings for work\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5d6ecdba2e22af2cc23aa803?format=jpeg\" alt=\"MoroPintuckPocketPontePants_Black_1028_009_2048x.progressive.jpg\" height=\"1759\" width=\"2345\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Universal Standard</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><a href=\"https://imp.i240138.net/c/196318/786259/11299?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.universalstandard.com%2F%3Fsscid%3D51k4_snfaf%26irclickid%3D3G-T7P036xyLW1r0TWXZ0S3wUkExSBWMwx2wSM0%26utm_source%3DBusiness%2520Insider.%26utm_medium%3Dmediapartner%26utm_channel%3DAffiliate%26irgwc%3D1%26irclickid%3D3G-T7P036xyLW1r0TWXZ0S3wUkExSMxMwx2wSM0%26utm_source%3DSkimbit%2520Ltd.%26utm_medium%3Dmediapartner%26utm_channel%3DAffiliate%26irgwc%3D1\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Universal Standard</a>'s sizing ranges from 4XS to 4XL, and the site's Fit Liberty policy states that if your size shifts, they'll replace the eligible clothes for free.&#160;</h3><p>Universal Standard's <a href=\"https://imp.i240138.net/c/196318/786259/11299?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.universalstandard.com%2Fproducts%2Fmoro-pocket-ponte-pants-black%3Fsscid%3D91k3_2cby8\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Moro Pocket Ponte Pants</a> are technically pants, but they have the feeling of leggings. The midweight ponte material is soft and designed to be pill-resistant, and they have a high waist with a flat band that won't roll or twist. As the name suggests, there's also an out-of-the-way pocket and matte black zippers at the ankles for dressing them up or down. If you need a <a href=\"https://imp.i240138.net/c/196318/786259/11299?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.universalstandard.com%2Fcollections%2Fnew%3Firclickid%3D3G-T7P036xyLW1r0TWXZ0S3wUkExSBygwx2wSM0%26irgwc%3D1%26sscid%3D51k4_sniho%26utm_channel%3DAffiliate%26utm_medium%3Dmediapartner%26utm_source%3DBusiness%2520Insider.%26irclickid%3D3G-T7P036xyLW1r0TWXZ0S3wUkExSMwYwx2wSM0%26utm_source%3DSkimbit%2520Ltd.%26utm_medium%3Dmediapartner%26utm_channel%3DAffiliate%26irgwc%3D1\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">petite version</a>, Universal Standard offers that too.&#160;</p><p>The company also guarantees that if your size shifts up or down within a year of purchase, it will exchange any piece in its <a href=\"https://imp.i240138.net/c/196318/786259/11299?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.universalstandard.com%2Fpages%2Ffit-liberty%3Fsscid%3D51k4_snj7q%26irclickid%3D3G-T7P036xyLW1r0TWXZ0S3wUkExSBUkwx2wSM0%26utm_source%3DBusiness%2520Insider.%26utm_medium%3Dmediapartner%26utm_channel%3DAffiliate%26irgwc%3D1%26irclickid%3D3G-T7P036xyLW1r0TWXZ0S3wUkExSMzkwx2wSM0%26utm_source%3DSkimbit%2520Ltd.%26utm_medium%3Dmediapartner%26utm_channel%3DAffiliate%26irgwc%3D1\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Fit Liberty collection</a> for your new size, for free. The <a href=\"https://imp.i240138.net/c/196318/786259/11299?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.universalstandard.com%2Fproducts%2Fmoro-pocket-ponte-pants-black%3Fsscid%3D91k3_2cby8\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Moro Pocket Ponte Pants</a> are included in the collection.&#160;</p><p>In terms of cons, the Ponte Pants are available in only two colors (black and olive) though that tends to be the standard for work-adjacent leggings, and are recommended for hand wash and hang dry. <em>&#8212; Mara Leighton</em></p><p><strong>Pros:&#160;</strong>Wide selection of sizes, petite styles, generous fit policy</p><p><strong>Cons: </strong>Relatively involved fabric care</p>\n\tCheck out our other style guides\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f7f6570d5f23d00195951d1?format=jpeg\" alt=\"EverlaneSweaters\" height=\"1444\" width=\"1925\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Everlane</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h2><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-sweaters-women\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">The best places to buy women's sweaters</a></h2><hr /><h2><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-winter-coat-women\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">The best winter coats for women</a></h2><hr /><h2><a src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=ouZ_8rKFbBI:mOHURjeGmY4:gIN9vFwOqvQ\" border=\"0\"></img></a>\n</div><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/ouZ_8rKFbBI\"
