+0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5f8dbadcc21cfb0019468cb2?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"4e1523da90ba8a8f4b07f5c595146325","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn71@2020_3/2020/10/20/02-05-12-890_e5e3afce0b57fd9d.webp","destWidth":1352,"destHeight":1014,"sourceBytes":75236,"destBytes":75236,"author":"jwong@businessinsider.com (Lulu Chang,Mara Leighton)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5c3ce0c5bd773043a4434a92?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn31@2020_5/2020/10/20/02-05-17-461_2b71d1093c04db87.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f8a0957d260780019341f8b?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn67@2020_4/2020/10/20/02-05-17-846_0bec632e7a439136.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f8a0aabd260780019341f90?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn7@2020_2/2020/10/20/02-05-17-182_2e40dfdd5d75bac4.webp","https://i.insider.com/5d6edd9b2e22af10ea4cab23?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn71@2020_2/2020/10/20/02-05-15-214_8510f5cf2ec70912.webp","https://i.insider.com/5d6ecdba2e22af2cc23aa803?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn39@2020_1/2020/10/20/02-05-19-103_61b97b07667fecec.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f7f6570d5f23d00195951d1?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn15@2020_3/2020/10/20/02-05-15-522_aff0af37b41b6117.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn67@2020_3/2020/10/20/02-05-22-757_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=ouZ_8rKFbBI:mOHURjeGmY4:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn3@2020_5/2020/10/20/02-05-23-794_2b900c7416a3651d.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=ouZ_8rKFbBI:mOHURjeGmY4:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn43@2020_1/2020/10/20/02-05-18-263_84a3dc605dbb8899.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn79@2020_1/2020/10/20/02-05-18-571_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=ouZ_8rKFbBI:mOHURjeGmY4:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn59@2020_6/2020/10/20/02-05-23-557_caf212ffeff75178.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/ouZ_8rKFbBI":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn47@2020_1/2020/10/20/02-05-16-602_626e2315e98ad940.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1603159473327},{"createdTime":"2020-10-20 10:04:33","updatedTime":"2020-10-20 10:04:33","title":"How to change your language on the Signal messaging app for iPhone, Android, or desktop","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-change-language-on-signal","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f8df555c21cfb0019468e20?format=jpeg\" alt=\"couple travelers looking at phone\" height=\"1249\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Most versions of the Signal messaging app let you change your language within the app.\n<p class=\"copyright\">EMS-FORSTER-PRODUCTIONS/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>You can change the default language on Signal in the secure messaging platform's Android, iPhone, and desktop apps.&#160;</li>\n<li>Some versions of Signal rely on a device's default settings when it comes to choosing a language, while other versions let you select a language independently from your device's settings.</li>\n<li><strong><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/tech-reference\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" data-analytics-module=\"summary_bullets\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"0\">Visit Business Insider's Tech Reference library for more stories</a>.</strong></li>\n</ul><p>If you're bilingual, traveling to another country, or simply want to practice your language skills, you may want to use <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/category/signal\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Signal</a> to send messages in another language. You can change your language settings on the Signal secure messaging app on <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/category/android\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Android</a> and on newer <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/category/iphone\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">iPhones</a>. However, if you're using the desktop app, you can't change only the Signal app's language — you'll need to change the language of your whole computer.&#160;</p><h2><strong>How to change language on Signal using the desktop app</strong></h2><p>On the desktop version of Signal, the language used in Signal will match that of your computer's general settings. To change the overall language used in Signal, you'll have to change your computer's language settings directly. However, you can still toggle spell check options.</p><p><strong>1.</strong> In Signal's desktop application, click on your profile icon in the upper left corner of the screen, then click \"Preferences.\"&#160;</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f8dea9a9e9fe4001900a2fc?format=jpeg\" alt=\"How_to_change_language_on_Signal_ _1\" height=\"1080\" width=\"1920\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>In the dropdown menu under your profile icon, click &#34;Preferences.&#34;\n<p class=\"copyright\">Chrissy Montelli/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p><strong>2.</strong> Scroll down to \"General.\" You can click on the box next to \"Enable spell check of text entered in message composition box\" to check or uncheck it. If the box is checked, spell check is enabled; if the box is unchecked, spell check is disabled.&#160;</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f8dec36c21cfb0019468ddd?format=jpeg\" alt=\"How_to_change_language_on_Signal_ _2\" height=\"1080\" width=\"1920\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Check or uncheck the box next to &#34;Enable spell check of text entered in message composition box.&#34;\n<p class=\"copyright\">Chrissy Montelli/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><h2><strong>How to change language on Signal using the Android app</strong></h2><p><strong>1.</strong> Open the Signal app and sign in if necessary.</p><p><strong>2.</strong> Tap on your profile icon, located in the upper left corner of your screen.&#160;</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f8decd29e9fe4001900a305?format=jpeg\" alt=\"How_to_change_language_on_Signal_ _3\" height=\"800\" width=\"1069\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Tap on your profile icon in the upper left corner.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Chrissy Montelli/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p><strong>3.</strong> Tap \"Appearance.\"&#160;</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f8dee779e9fe4001900a30e?format=jpeg\" alt=\"How_to_change_language_on_Signal_ _4\" height=\"1531\" width=\"800\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Select &#34;Appearance&#34; in Signal&#39;s settings menu.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Chrissy Montelli/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p><strong>4.</strong> Tap \"Language.\"&#160;</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f8deeee9e9fe4001900a312?format=jpeg\" alt=\"How_to_change_language_on_Signal_ _5\" height=\"800\" width=\"1079\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>On the next screen, select &#34;Language.&#34;\n<p class=\"copyright\">Chrissy Montelli/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p><strong>5.</strong> Swipe up or down until you find the language you want to switch to, then tap on it. The language will change instantly.&#160;</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f8def549e9fe4001900a314?format=jpeg\" alt=\"How_to_change_language_on_Signal_ _6\" height=\"1526\" width=\"800\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Choose your new language from the list.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Chrissy Montelli/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><h2><strong>How to change language on Signal using the iPhone app</strong></h2><p>Your ability to change the language on Signal for iPhone depends on the version of iOS your iPhone uses. If you're using iOS 12 or earlier, Signal's language will match your iPhone's default language settings. If you're using a more recent version of iOS, like iOS 13 or 14, you can change the language via your iOS settings for the Signal app.</p><p><strong>1.</strong> To change the language of Signal on iOS 13 or 14, you must first enable multiple languages in your phone's Settings app. Open the Settings app on your device.</p><p><strong>2.</strong> Tap \"General.\"</p><p><strong>3.</strong> Scroll down and select \"Language &#38; Region.\"</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f8df11ac21cfb0019468dfb?format=jpeg\" alt=\"signal\" height=\"2436\" width=\"1125\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Select &#34;Language &#38; Region&#34; from the General tab of your phone&#39;s Settings app.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Grace Eliza Goodwin/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p><strong>4.</strong> On the next screen, tap \"iPhone Language,\" then select a secondary language from the list.&#160;</p><p><strong>5.</strong> Now that you've added a secondary language in your phone, you can change the language of Signal. Go to your phone's Settings app. Scroll down until you see Signal in the list of apps, and tap it.&#160;</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f8df2479e9fe4001900a32d?format=jpeg\" alt=\"signal2\" height=\"1474\" width=\"1125\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Select Signal from the list of apps.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Grace Eliza Goodwin/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p><strong>6.</strong> On the next screen, tap \"Preferred Language,\" and select a language from the following list.&#160;</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f8df2c89e9fe4001900a330?format=jpeg\" alt=\"signal3\" height=\"1894\" width=\"1125\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Tap &#34;Language.&#34;\n<p class=\"copyright\">Grace Eliza Goodwin/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p><strong>7.</strong> Now, you can go back to the \"General\" tab and change your phone's default language back to your primary language, without affecting the Signal language you chose.&#160;</p><div id=\"ProductCard_5d8e19fb2e22af18f40d281d\" style=\"position:relative; display:block; width: 100%\"><iframe src=\"https://produktor.businessinsider.com/productCardService?id=5d8e19fb2e22af18f40d281d&type=small&live=true\" width=\"100%\" height=\"150%\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\" style=\"position:absolute; top:0; left: 0\"></iframe></div><div id=\"ProductCard_5e87473ab3b0922aa94f2764\" style=\"position:relative; display:block; width: 100%\"><iframe src=\"https://produktor.businessinsider.com/productCardService?id=5e87473ab3b0922aa94f2764&type=small&live=true\" width=\"100%\" height=\"150%\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\" style=\"position:absolute; top:0; left: 0\"></iframe></div><h2><strong>Related coverage from&#160;<a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/tech-reference\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" (Chrissy Montelli)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5f8df555c21cfb0019468e20?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn75@2020_3/2020/10/20/02-05-21-983_e6fa67c784628db7.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f8dea9a9e9fe4001900a2fc?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn79@2020_5/2020/10/20/02-05-19-577_f472aeefba7df459.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f8dec36c21cfb0019468ddd?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn20@2020_3/2020/10/20/02-05-24-829_23d24b32f059608b.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f8decd29e9fe4001900a305?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn83@2020_3/2020/10/20/02-05-16-160_42dc7424ea84eae5.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f8dee779e9fe4001900a30e?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn11@2020_5/2020/10/20/02-05-23-944_583e2467e913c197.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f8deeee9e9fe4001900a312?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn67@2020_4/2020/10/20/02-05-21-874_bcc10e2e6cb9f09e.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f8def549e9fe4001900a314?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn95@2020_5/2020/10/20/02-05-15-330_44c54f4fc1253486.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f8df11ac21cfb0019468dfb?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn47@2020_3/2020/10/20/02-05-19-213_a3055f7cbc8f8c45.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f8df2479e9fe4001900a32d?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn87@2020_2/2020/10/20/02-05-15-392_a34601da162bef62.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f8df2c89e9fe4001900a330?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn39@2020_6/2020/10/20/02-05-21-021_c7380c931ba4c9ef.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn67@2020_3/2020/10/20/02-05-22-757_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=YLM3h1c_7Us:iUHU8416VZM:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn24@2020_2/2020/10/20/02-05-16-587_518b5e923fb5df34.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=YLM3h1c_7Us:iUHU8416VZM:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn4@2020_1/2020/10/20/02-05-20-634_93c18196f8ab082b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn79@2020_1/2020/10/20/02-05-18-571_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=YLM3h1c_7Us:iUHU8416VZM:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn95@2020_4/2020/10/20/02-05-23-121_e10368c07b3d4a8b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/YLM3h1c_7Us":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn63@2020_3/2020/10/20/02-05-14-026_53ff4169314bc1a2.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1603159473332},{"createdTime":"2020-10-20 10:04:33","updatedTime":"2020-10-20 10:04:33","title":"Trump is 'sitting' on $9 billion earmarked for COVID-19 testing because of a controversial advisor, report says","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/trump-hasnt-spent-9-billion-earmarked-for-coronavirus-testing-report-2020-10","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f8df74a9e9fe4001900a365?format=jpeg\" alt=\"GettyImages-scott-atlas\" height=\"512\" width=\"1024\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Scott Atlas, senior fellow at the Hoover Institution, speaks with President Donald Trump during a COVID-19 coronavirus briefing on Aug. 12.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Jabin Botsford/The Washington Post via Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>The Trump administration has not spent $9 billion in funding for COVID-19 testing because of opposition from Scott Atlas, an advisor on the White House coronavirus task force, The Washington Post reported.</li>\n<li>Atlas is not an infectious-disease expert and has emerged as an influential and controversial advisor on the task force as he's promoted ideas in line with Trump's approach to the pandemic.</li>\n<li>\"We're demanding that the feds release ... those dollars,\" Senate Minority Leader Chuck Schumer said on Sunday, urging the Trump administration to commit to a \"robust testing and tracing program.\"</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>The Trump administration has yet to spend $9 billion allocated by Congress for COVID-19 testing because of a controversial advisor who has garnered significant influence over the White House's pandemic response, <a href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/trumps-den-of-dissent-inside-the-white-house-task-force-as-coronavirus-surges/2020/10/19/7ff8ee6a-0a6e-11eb-859b-f9c27abe638d_story.html\">according to a Washington Post report</a> based on interviews with 41 administration officials, advisors to the president, public-health leaders, and others.</p><p>Dr. Scott Atlas, a radiologist who is not an expert on infectious diseases, has taken a fervent stance against expanded testing, The Post reported, in contrast to the advice of top experts on the White House coronavirus task force such as Dr. Anthony Fauci and Dr. Deborah Birx.</p><p>Senate Minority Leader Chuck Schumer on Sunday decried the Trump administration, and more specifically the Department of Health and Human Services, saying it was \"sitting\" on the $9 billion in funding for testing and tracing.&#160;</p><p>\"We're demanding that the feds release ... those dollars,\" Schumer said, calling on the Trump administration to commit to a \"robust testing and tracing program.\"</p><p>The White House did not immediately respond to a request for comment from Insider.&#160;</p><blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet blockquote\" data-lang=\"en\" data-cards=\"\" data-conversation=\"\">&#8212;Bloomberg QuickTake  (@QuickTake) <a href=\"https://twitter.com/mims/statuses/1317858343659180033?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw\">October 18, 2020</a></blockquote><script async src=\"//platform.twitter.com/widgets.js\" charset=\"utf-8\"></script><p>Atlas, a healthcare-policy expert who works at the Hoover Institute, a conservative think tank at Stanford University, has quickly consolidated influence on the task force in recent months as he's advocated for strategies that are more in line with the president's rejection of strict restrictions to mitigate the spread of the virus.&#160;</p><p>The Post reported he's pushed hard for a herd-immunity approach to the pandemic, which occurs when enough of a population develops resistance to a disease, whether through exposure or a vaccine, to interrupt the virus' spread. Top experts have said that allowing COVID-19 to spread through the country unchecked could lead to <a href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/opinions/tom-frieden-herd-immunity-wrong-solution-coronavirus/2020/10/16/acb4ae8a-0fe6-11eb-8074-0e943a91bf08_story.html\">half a million US deaths</a> from the virus, which has killed nearly 220,000 Americans as of Monday afternoon.&#160;</p><p>Atlas, who was tapped by Trump to join the task force in August after repeated appearances on Fox News, in a statement to The Post rejected the notion he's advocated a herd-immunity strategy, but <a href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/trump-coronavirus-scott-atlas-herd-immunity/2020/08/30/925e68fe-e93b-11ea-970a-64c73a1c2392_story.html\">multiple reports suggest otherwise</a>.</p><p>Over the weekend, Twitter removed a tweet from Atlas that misleadingly told the public that face masks don't help to prevent the spread of COVID-19. Trump has also pushed against wearing masks or face coverings, contradicting his advisors and a mountain of evidence that masks are a vital tool in preventing the spread of COVID-19.&#160;</p><p>Atlas' presence on the coronavirus task force has created tension within the unit and seen top advisors like Fauci and Birx increasingly sidelined, according to The Post. Atlas has also challenged the analysis of Birx and other top officials with \"junk science,\" three senior administration officials told The Post.</p><p>The president on Monday <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/anthony-fauci-donald-trump-coronavirus-restrictions-election-2020-10\">attacked Fauci during a campaign call</a> and referred to him as a \"disaster,\" CNN reported.</p><p>\"People are saying whatever. Just leave us alone. They're tired of it. People are tired of hearing Fauci and all these idiots,\" Trump said, according to CNN, adding,&#160;\"If I listened to him, we'd have 500,000 deaths.\"</p><p>A few hours later, Trump also <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/trump-ridicules-fauci-for-worst-first-pitch-in-baseball-history-2020-10\">mocked the infectious-disease expert's baseball skills on Twitter</a>.</p><p>\"Tony should stop wearing the Washington Nationals' Mask for two reasons. Number one, it is not up to the high standards that he should be exposing,\" the president tweeted. \"Number two, it keeps reminding me that Tony threw out perhaps the worst first pitch in the history of Baseball!\"</p><p>Trump was diagnosed with COVID-19 earlier this month and subsequently hospitalized. Top public-health experts have <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/disease-experts-surprised-by-us-response-coronavirus-pandemic-2020-3\">pointed to his response</a> as a key factor in the US outbreak spiraling out of control. There have been over 8.1 million confirmed cases of COVID-19 in the US, more than any other country, <a href=\"https://www.arcgis.com/apps/opsdashboard/index.html#/bda7594740fd40299423467b48e9ecf6\">according to Johns Hopkins University</a>.</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on rel=\"noopener\">iPhone 12 series</a> consists of two premium models, the <a href=\"https://go.skimresources.com?id=35871X943606&xs=1&url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.apple.com%2Fshop%2Fbuy-iphone%2Fiphone-12phone-12\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored\">iPhone 12 Pro</a> and <a href=\"https://go.skimresources.com?id=35871X943606&xs=1&url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.apple.com%2Fshop%2Fbuy-iphone%2Fiphone-12-proe-12-pro\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored\">iPhone 12 Pro Max</a>.</li><li>There's about a $300 gap between these two categories, and the differences are subtle.</li><li>All of the models have lots in common, including major features, like 5G, MagSafe for iPhone, and OLED displays.</li><li>The main differentiating factors are screen sizes, frame metals, and cameras.&#160;</li></ul><bi-shortcode id=\"table-of-contents-sticky\" class=\"mceNonEditable\" data-type=\"h2\">Table of Contents: Masthead Sticky</bi-shortcode><p>Apple's new <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/apple-iphone-12-price-specs-release-date\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">iPhone 12 series</a> consists of four different iPhones, and they can be broken down into two distinct categories — premium and ultra-premium.</p><p>There's a big jump in price between the standard and \"pro\" models of the iPhone 12. Here's a breakdown of prices starting from least expensive to most expensive:&#160;</p><ul><li><a href=\"https://go.skimresources.com?id=35871X943606&xs=1&url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.apple.com%2Fshop%2Fbuy-iphone%2Fiphone-12phone-12\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored\">iPhone 12 Mini</a>: $699</li><li><a href=\"https://go.skimresources.com?id=35871X943606&xs=1&url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.apple.com%2Fshop%2Fbuy-iphone%2Fiphone-12phone-12\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">iPhone 12</a>: $799</li><li><a href=\"https://go.skimresources.com?id=35871X943606&xs=1&url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.apple.com%2Fshop%2Fbuy-iphone%2Fiphone-12-proe-12-pro\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored\">iPhone 12 Pro</a>: $999</li><li><a href=\"https://go.skimresources.com?id=35871X943606&xs=1&url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.apple.com%2Fshop%2Fbuy-iphone%2Fiphone-12-proe-12-pro\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored\">iPhone 12 Pro Max</a>: $1,099</li></ul><p>Indeed, that's about a $300 difference between the two standard iPhone 12 models and the two \"pro\" versions, and it's the cameras that make up the bulk of the distinction between Apple's premium and ultra-premium lineup.</p><p>Otherwise, the standard iPhone 12 and \"pro\" versions are mostly the same phones. That's a similar situation to the iPhone 11 series, where iPhone 11 buyers weren't missing out very much compared to iPhone 11 Pro owners.</p><p>There's still time to make a decision on which model you'd like. The <a href=\"https://go.skimresources.com?id=35871X943606&xs=1&url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.apple.com%2Fshop%2Fbuy-iphone%2Fiphone-12phone-12\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">iPhone 12</a> and <a href=\"https://go.skimresources.com?id=35871X943606&xs=1&url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.apple.com%2Fshop%2Fbuy-iphone%2Fiphone-12-proe-12-pro\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">iPhone 12 Pro</a> are now available to preorder and will ship on October 23. The <a href=\"https://go.skimresources.com?id=35871X943606&xs=1&url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.apple.com%2Fshop%2Fbuy-iphone%2Fiphone-12phone-12\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">iPhone 12 Mini</a> and <a href=\"https://go.skimresources.com?id=35871X943606&xs=1&url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.apple.com%2Fshop%2Fbuy-iphone%2Fiphone-12-proe-12-pro\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">iPhone 12 Pro Max</a> will be available to preorder on November 6 and will ship on November 13.</p>\n<div id=\"slideshow\">\n\tWhat they all have in common\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f8daa469e9fe4001900a127?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Apple iPhone 12 October Event\" height=\"1226\" width=\"1634\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Apple/Youtube</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>All four models in Apple's new iPhone 12 series have these factors in common:</p><ul><li>Apple's A14 Bionic processor</li><li>5G connectivity for the same carriers and specific 5G networks</li><li>Wireless charging, including MagSafe</li><li>Super Retina XDR displays</li><li>All the screens are OLED</li><li>Screens protected with \"Ceramic Shield\" glass</li><li>Metal frames: aluminum for <a href=\"https://go.skimresources.com?id=35871X943606&#38;xs=1&#38;url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.apple.com%2Fshop%2Fbuy-iphone%2Fiphone-12\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored\">iPhone 12</a> and <a href=\"https://go.skimresources.com?id=35871X943606&#38;xs=1&#38;url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.apple.com%2Fshop%2Fbuy-iphone%2Fiphone-12\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored\">iPhone 12 Mini,</a> and steel for <a href=\"https://go.skimresources.com?id=35871X943606&#38;xs=1&#38;url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.apple.com%2Fshop%2Fbuy-iphone%2Fiphone-12-pro\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored\">iPhone 12 Pro</a> and <a href=\"https://go.skimresources.com?id=35871X943606&#38;xs=1&#38;url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.apple.com%2Fshop%2Fbuy-iphone%2Fiphone-12-pro\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored\">iPhone 12 Pro Max</a>.</li><li>Glass backs: glossy on iPhone 12 and iPhone 12 Mini, and matte on iPhone 12 Pro and Pro Max</li><li>IP68 water resistance</li></ul>\n\tScreen size\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f8606d6fd1f49001964d63f?format=jpeg\" alt=\"apple_iphone 12_super retina xdr display_10132020\" height=\"1406\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>iPhone 12 mini.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Apple</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>There are three screen sizes between the four phones that should satisfy preferences and, as mentioned earlier, they're all Apple's Super Retina XDR OLED for ultra-rich colors, brightness, and contrast. Here are the iPhone 12 screen sizes from smallest to biggest:</p><ul><li><a href=\"https://go.skimresources.com?id=35871X943606&#38;xs=1&#38;url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.apple.com%2Fshop%2Fbuy-iphone%2Fiphone-12\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored\">iPhone 12 Mini:</a> 5.4-inch</li><li><a href=\"https://go.skimresources.com?id=35871X943606&#38;xs=1&#38;url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.apple.com%2Fshop%2Fbuy-iphone%2Fiphone-12\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored\">iPhone 12:</a> 6.1-inch</li><li><a href=\"https://go.skimresources.com?id=35871X943606&#38;xs=1&#38;url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.apple.com%2Fshop%2Fbuy-iphone%2Fiphone-12-pro\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored\">iPhone 12 Pro:</a> 6.1-inch</li><li><a href=\"https://go.skimresources.com?id=35871X943606&#38;xs=1&#38;url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.apple.com%2Fshop%2Fbuy-iphone%2Fiphone-12-pro\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored\">iPhone 12 Pro Max:</a> 6.7-inch</li></ul>\n\tCameras\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f8da95dc21cfb0019468c1c?format=jpeg\" alt=\"iphone 12 pro cameras\" height=\"1800\" width=\"2400\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Apple</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>Cameras are where the bulk of the difference will be found between the standard iPhone 12 models and the iPhone 12 Pro versions. If you're looking for the absolute best and latest that Apple has to offer &#8212; and you can afford them &#8212; the iPhone 12 Pro versions are what you're after.&#160;</p><p>Otherwise, the iPhone 12 will, in almost all likelihood, take extremely good photos, too.&#160;&#160;</p><h3>What all the iPhone 12 cameras share:</h3><ul><li>12-megapixel wide; f/1.6; OIS</li><li>12-megapixel ultra wide; f/2.4; 120-degree field of view</li><li>Smart HDR 3</li><li>Apple's Deep Fusion for improved detail, texture, and less noise in low light</li></ul><h3>The extra specs and features in the iPhone 12 Pro cameras:</h3><ul><li>12-megapixel telephoto; f/2.0; up to 4x optical zoom; up to 10x digital zoom</li><li>Apple ProRAW &#8212; an option that gives greater control over photo editing to those who want it</li><li>Night mode portraits enabled by the new LiDar scanner</li></ul><h3>The extra&#160;<em>extra</em> specs and features in the iPhone 12 Pro Max cameras:</h3><ul><li>12-megapixel telephoto; f/2.2; up to 5x optical zoom; up to 12x digital zoom</li><li>Apple's advanced sensor-shift optical image stabilization</li></ul>\n\tBattery life\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f8da9ff9e9fe4001900a124?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Apple_iPhone12Pro back camera magsafe charger_10132020\" height=\"734\" width=\"979\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Apple</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>Apple only gives estimated battery life, and it commonly uses video streaming playback as a reference. To that end, here's how each model stacks up:</p><ul><li><a href=\"https://go.skimresources.com?id=35871X943606&#38;xs=1&#38;url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.apple.com%2Fshop%2Fbuy-iphone%2Fiphone-12\" Villas-Boas)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5f86eb3afd1f49001964d84b?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn12@2020_5/2020/10/20/02-04-49-936_4a28406ccaf341b1.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f8daa469e9fe4001900a127?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn47@2020_4/2020/10/20/02-05-22-574_62aa8d436812a6f4.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f8606d6fd1f49001964d63f?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn32@2020_4/2020/10/20/02-05-21-650_19b558e6ede8c2ac.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f8da95dc21cfb0019468c1c?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn7@2020_5/2020/10/20/02-05-24-620_5ebd00f725e538ca.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f8da9ff9e9fe4001900a124?format=jpeg":null,"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn67@2020_3/2020/10/20/02-05-22-757_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=Vmwn7zJEfWU:7qd5nMb376w:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn87@2020_1/2020/10/20/02-05-21-457_54ab7c55953eb8bd.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=Vmwn7zJEfWU:7qd5nMb376w:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx23/cdn100@2020_5/2020/10/20/02-05-15-881_0c2eca4e1433342c.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn79@2020_1/2020/10/20/02-05-18-571_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=Vmwn7zJEfWU:7qd5nMb376w:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn35@2020_5/2020/10/20/02-05-24-128_c0f2cbc7c5082510.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/Vmwn7zJEfWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn15@2020_6/2020/10/20/02-05-22-348_7b9ceee1f755a0eb.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1603159473338},{"createdTime":"2020-10-20 10:04:33","updatedTime":"2020-10-20 10:04:33","title":"After a lemur was stolen from the San Francisco Zoo, a 5-year-old boy helped zookeepers track it down","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/san-francisco-zookeepers-find-stolen-lemur-with-young-helper-2020-10","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f8df4ce9e9fe4001900a341?format=jpeg\" alt=\"maki the lemur\" height=\"2152\" width=\"3000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A photo of Maki, the ring-tailed lemur that was reported missing from the San Francisco Zoo on October 14, 2020.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Marianne V. Hale/San Francisco Zoo via AP</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>When Maki the lemur was stolen from the San Francisco Zoo on Tuesday, authorities asked the public to help find him.&#160;</li>\n<li>The following day, 5-year-old James Trinh <a href=\"https://www.insider.com/missing-lemur-was-found-returned-safely-san-francisco-zoo-2020-10\">found Maki outside of his preschool</a>.</li>\n<li>Maki's now safely back at the zoo. A suspect has been charged with theft after police officers found pictures of the lemur on his cell phone.&#160;</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>It seemed unlikely that Maki, a 21-year-old arthritic lemur, could have gotten very far on his own.&#160;</p><p>So when officials at the San Francisco Zoo realized that the animal was missing from his enclosure on Wednesday, they immediately suspected foul play. They'd also <a href=\"https://www.insider.com/missing-lemur-was-found-returned-safely-san-francisco-zoo-2020-10\">found evidence of forced entry at the enclosure</a>.</p><p>The search was on for Maki and his suspected kidnapper. San Francisco Police opened a case, and officers and zookeepers called on the public to help them find the ring-tailed lemur – a member of an endangered species whose median life expectancy is around 16 years.</p><p>Zoo officials even offered a $2,100 reward for information leading to Maki's safe retrieval.</p><p>\"We understand that lemurs are adorable animals, but Maki is a highly endangered animal that requires special care. We are asking the public for help in his return,\" Dr. Jason Watters, the zoo's executive vice president of animal behavior and wellness, <a href=\"https://abc7news.com/san-francisco-zoo-missing-lemur-maki-police/7031021/\">told ABC 7</a>.</p><p>Fortunately, the search ended quickly. On Thursday, 5-year-old James Trinh was leaving preschool when he spotted Maki in the parking by his school's playground. Trinh attends the Hope Lutheran Day School in Daly City, just 5 miles from the zoo.&#160;</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f8df5189e9fe4001900a345?format=jpeg\" alt=\"maki the lemur 2\" height=\"3000\" width=\"2250\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Maki the lemur, December 17, 2018.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Marianne V. Hale/San Francisco Zoo via AP</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>\"There's a lemur! There's a lemur!\" Trinh cried.</p><p>School director Cynthia Huang was skeptical at first, but soon realized Trinh was correct. Maki bounded from the parking lot to a miniature playhouse on the playground, where he hid as the school alerted the police. Officers from the Daly City Police Department contained Maki until zoo caretakers arrived on the scene.</p><blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet blockquote\" data-lang=\"en\" data-cards=\"\" data-conversation=\"\">&#8212;Daly City Police  (@DalyCityPD) <a href=\"https://twitter.com/mims/statuses/1316940964552998914?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw\">October 16, 2020</a></blockquote><script async src=\"//platform.twitter.com/widgets.js\" charset=\"utf-8\"></script><p>&#160;</p><p>Just like humans who've traveled far from home in 2020, Maki will spend the next few days \"socially distancing from his primate family,\" San Francisco Zoo director Tanya Peterson <a href=\"https://apnews.com/article/lemur-theft-san-francisco-zoo-962bb0064c2129c8da75cf4f5780b11b\">told the Associated Press</a>. Caretakers found him hungry, dehydrated and agitated, she added. But otherwise, he appeared to be in good health, <a href=\"https://www.sanfranciscopolice.org/news/sfpd-makes-arrest-stolen-lemur-case-20-116b\">according to the SFPD</a>.&#160;</p><p>The zoo is giving the $2,100 reward to the Hope Lutheran Church, which hosts Trinh's preschool. The boy and his family are receiving a free lifetime zoo membership, according to Peterson.&#160;</p><p>Trinh, Huang, and others who helped find Maki \"literally saved a life,\" Peterson added.</p><p>On Thursday, police in San Rafael, California, announced that they'd narrowed in on a suspect in the kidnapping. After arresting 30-year-old Cory McGilloway on an unrelated charge of stealing a truck, officers found photos of Maki on McGilloway's phone, <a href=\"https://www.sfchronicle.com/bayarea/article/Suspect-in-custody-in-Marin-County-in-theft-of-15654212.php\">according to the San Francisco Chronicle.&#160;</a></p><p>The San Rafael Police alerted the SFPD, who have charged McGilloway with \"grand theft of an animal,\" along with burglary, looting, and vandalism.&#160;</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a 10:04:33","updatedTime":"2020-10-20 10:04:33","title":"Markets are pricing in a Biden victory and a Democratic Senate to fuel massive stimulus in 2021, JPMorgan says","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/markets-outlook-biden-election-victory-democratic-senate-fiscal-stimulus-jpmorgan-2020-10","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f8da1c5c21cfb0019468bbf?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Joe Biden\" height=\"600\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">BRENDAN SMIALOWSKI/AFP via Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul><li><strong>Investors are increasingly preparing for a Democratic sweep in November and frontloaded stimulus to boost the economic recovery, <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/stocks/jpm-stock\">JPMorgan</a> said following a recent call with clients.</strong></li><li><strong>Joe Biden, the Democratic nominee, maintains a hefty lead in polls in what's shaping up to be \"the most stable election in modern history,\" the bank said.</strong></li><li><strong>Markets now view a Biden win and a split Congress as the worst outcome for stocks, as it would likely further the stimulus stalemate seen in recent months.</strong></li><li><strong>\"There could be some disappointment\" if Republicans maintain their Senate majority, JPMorgan added.</strong></li><li><strong><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingest?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingestutm_source=msn.com&utm_medium=referral&utm_content=msn-slideshow&utm_campaign=bodyurl?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingestts&#38;utm_medium=ingest\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</strong></li></ul><hr><p>Markets are increasingly pricing in a Joe Biden victory and fresh stimulus, leaving room for a sudden slump should election results miss expectations.</p><p><a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/stocks/jpm-stock\">JPMorgan</a> held a call with investors last Wednesday to gauge sentiments ahead of Election Day. Many speakers and market participants said they see a so-called blue wave solidifying, with little time left for President Donald Trump to shift momentum in his favor, the bank said in a recap note on Monday.</p><p>Biden, the Democratic presidential nominee, has enjoyed a consistent lead in what's shaping up to be \"the most stable election in modern history,\" the bank said, leaving investors to position for a Democratic sweep.</p><p>All eyes are now on Senate races, as stimulus hinges on Congress' makeup. Markets expect frontloaded stimulus as a Biden administration works to pull the US economy out of its virus-induced downturn. The projection marks a stark shift from past months when investors viewed a split Congress as the best outcome.</p><p><em><strong>Read more:</strong> <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/stock-picks-to-buy-etf-strategy-cathie-wood-ark-invest-2020-10\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Cathie Wood runs 5 funds that more than doubled broader market returns in the 3rd quarter. She and her team break down 8 winning stocks turbocharging the outperformance of its top ETFs.</a></em></p><p>\"There could be some disappointment\" if Republicans maintain a Senate majority and hold up a massive relief package, JPMorgan said.</p><p>Markets have also grown less concerned about a contested election, the bank added. More than 26 million votes had been cast as of Saturday, representing nearly a fifth of all votes cast in the 2016 presidential election. With 21 states able to start counting ballots early, results could arrive on or soon after Election Day on November 3 and allay fears of a significant delay.</p><p>Economists and lawmakers have repeatedly called for fresh stimulus ahead of the election, but the chance of such a deal is fading fast. House Speaker Nancy Pelosi on Sunday imposed a 48-hour deadline for negotiations with the White House, seeking to fast-track the talks after three months of sluggish progress.</p><p>Even if the two groups reach a deal, Senate Republicans oppose a large bill. Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell has indicated the body could vote on a $500 billion proposal as soon as Tuesday. But Senate Democrats are poised to block the measure, diminishing hopes for near-term fiscal support.</p><p><em><strong>Read more:</strong> <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/stock-picks-to-buy-small-companies-recommendations-high-upside-rbc-2020-10\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" data-analytics-position=\"4\" data-analytics-module=\"\">Buy these 7 unheralded stocks right now for near-term upside of at least 25% as growth accelerates to a new level, RBC says</a></em></p><p>Investors still might not get the stimulus boost they're hoping for should a blue wave materialize. Democrats would need at least 60 Senate seats or the elimination of the filibuster to completely control Congress. Participants on the call described stimulus approval in a lame-duck session as \"unlikely,\" JPMorgan said.</p><p>In all, an orderly transfer of power and Senate election outcomes would overshadow the winner of the presidential race, JPMorgan said. A split Congress under a Biden administration is now viewed as the worst outcome for the S&#38;P 500, as it would likely yield the same stimulus stalemate.</p><p>Investors should pay attention to Senate races in swing states and to chatter about a Biden Cabinet, as both would play critical roles in economic policy moving forward, the bank added.</p><p><em><strong>Now read more markets coverage from Markets Insider and Business Insider:</strong></em></p><p><em><strong><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/investing-strategy-4-stocks-to-buy-market-leaders-nancy-zevenbergen-2020-10\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Nancy Zevenbergen is in the top 1% of investors over the past 5 years. She breaks down what she looks for in young companies — and shares 4 stocks she thinks could be market leaders 10 years from now.</a></strong></em></p><p><em><strong><a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/stocks/tesla-stock-price-target-lifted-china-demand-deliveries-pace-wedbush-2020-10-1029693540\" data-analytics-position=\"3\" data-analytics-module=\"\">Tesla will gain another 14% as company closes in on 500,000 annual deliveries, Wedbush says</a></strong></em></p><p><em><strong><a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/stocks/economic-outlook-executives-coronavirus-stimulus-deadlock-credit-risks-banks-airlines-2020-10-1029691035\" data-analytics-position=\"4\" data-analytics-module=\"\">'Not out of the woods': Here's what 5 top executives said this week about the prospect of more economic stimulus</a></strong></em></p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=3a2oct-2xto:m-Yk32UcUqg:F7zBnMyn0Lo\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=3a2oct-2xto:m-Yk32UcUqg:V_sGLiPBpWU\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=3a2oct-2xto:m-Yk32UcUqg:V_sGLiPBpWU\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=3a2oct-2xto:m-Yk32UcUqg:gIN9vFwOqvQ\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=3a2oct-2xto:m-Yk32UcUqg:gIN9vFwOqvQ\" border=\"0\"></img></a>\n</div><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/3a2oct-2xto\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\"/>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 19 Oct 2020 17:18:00 +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5f8da1cf9e9fe4001900a0d2?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"6bbc8c50550d0fd8cfc78a90fdbc2df6","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn25@2020_1/2020/10/20/02-05-12-876_b949ab26a68ea2d1.webp","destWidth":1068,"destHeight":799,"sourceBytes":26604,"destBytes":26604,"author":"bwinck@businessinsider.com (Ben Winck)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5f8da1c5c21cfb0019468bbf?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn60@2020_5/2020/10/20/02-05-24-217_98e850b55079dcd0.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn67@2020_3/2020/10/20/02-05-22-757_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=3a2oct-2xto:m-Yk32UcUqg:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn27@2020_5/2020/10/20/02-05-16-632_7cae7a5be35c1454.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=3a2oct-2xto:m-Yk32UcUqg:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn4@2020_3/2020/10/20/02-05-25-532_e1593168c5c5df7f.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn79@2020_1/2020/10/20/02-05-18-571_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=3a2oct-2xto:m-Yk32UcUqg:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn95@2020_2/2020/10/20/02-05-17-283_3d3ff25e3e8e94cc.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/3a2oct-2xto":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn75@2020_5/2020/10/20/02-05-16-137_5194ecd99c9380f1.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1603159473348},{"createdTime":"2020-10-20 10:04:33","updatedTime":"2020-10-20 10:04:33","title":"WHO: The US and Europe still aren't quarantining correctly, and that's why we're headed for a COVID-19 disaster this winter","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/who-us-europe-need-to-get-better-at-quarantining-2020-10","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f2c39b0aee6a8404d684948?format=jpeg\" alt=\"grocery store clerk\" height=\"2533\" width=\"3800\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Jeffrey Greenberg/Education Images/Universal Images Group via Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Quarantining people who've been exposed to sick patients is one of the most basic ways to end the spread of an infectious disease, like COVID-19.</li>\n<li>But the WHO says proper quarantining is still not being done \"systematically, anywhere\" during this pandemic.</li>\n<li>That's a problem, especially in Europe and the US, where cases and hospitalizations are on the rise again.&#160;</li>\n<li>Effective quarantining \"means not going to work. It means not going to the grocery store. It means not socializing with friends. It means not having people over at your home,\" the WHO said.&#160;</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>Coronavirus cases are ticking up across many parts of Europe and North America, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/us-third-wave-coronavirus-cases-hospitalizations-surge-2020-10\">signaling the beginning of a new wave</a> of this pandemic.</p><p>The number of new confirmed cases is rising especially <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/us-third-wave-coronavirus-cases-hospitalizations-surge-2020-10\">fast in the US</a>, <a href=\"https://coronavirus.jhu.edu/data/new-cases\">UK, Italy, and Belgium</a>&#160;but the increase is not limited to those spots.&#160;</p><p>\"About half of our member states within the European region have experienced a 50% increase in cases in the last week,\" World Health Organization executive director of health emergencies Dr. Mike Ryan said during a virtual press briefing from Geneva on Monday. \"Clearly, across the board, we're seeing a large increase in cases.\"</p><p>Part of the reason for the increase in cases of COVID-19, the disease caused by the virus, across so much of the Northern Hemisphere right now is because as temperatures fall, more gatherings are being held indoors, where the virus spreads best.&#160;</p><p>But there is also one neglected virus-fighting strategy that Ryan says is a major reason why the virus isn't going away in certain places. There is one more measure in addition to widespread mask wearing, handwashing, and social distancing that is essential to combatting the virus' spread, and preventing more deaths, and it is not being done enough: Get people who've been exposed to the virus away from everybody else, fast.&#160;</p><p>Ryan said this concept, called quarantining, is his single \"golden wish\" to improve the state of the pandemic.&#160;</p><p>\"As a public health physician, if I was asked for one thing that could improve that might change the game here, that is: making sure that each and every contact of a confirmed case is in quarantine for the appropriate period of time, so as to break chains of transmission,\" he said.&#160;</p><h2>Quarantining works. But the US and Europe aren't doing enough of it right now.</h2><p>\"I do not believe that has occurred systematically anywhere, and particularly in countries that are experiencing large increases now,\" Ryan said. \"If you know yourself to be having been in contact with a case, you should be in full quarantine, at home, without contact with other people.\"&#160;&#160;</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f8df610c21cfb0019468e27?format=jpeg\" alt=\"mike ryan WHO tedros\" height=\"1467\" width=\"2200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>World Health Organization Director-General Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus (right) speaks with WHO Health Emergencies Programme Director Dr. Michael Ryan during a press briefing on COVID-19 at the WHO headquarters in Geneva on March 6, 2020.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Fabrice Coffrini/AFP via Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>The <a href=\"https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/if-you-are-sick/quarantine.html\">US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention recommends</a> a 14-day stay at home period for anyone who's been in close contact with others who have tested positive for COVID-19, unless those people have already had the virus some time in the past three months.&#160;</p><p>Quarantining prevents people who may be harboring the virus, unknowingly, from passing it to others. It works so well because if everyone who has the virus in a community stays home, no one new can get it, and the local outbreak ends.</p><p>It's happened <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/jacinda-ardern-dance-for-new-zealand-beating-coronavirus-2020-6\">before in New Zealand</a>, it's <a href=\"https://www.scmp.com/news/asia/east-asia/article/3082265/coronavirus-south-korea-reports-zero-new-local-cases-first-time\">happened in South Korea</a>, it's <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/china-reported-no-new-coronavirus-cases-as-new-hotspots-emerge-2020-5\">happened in China</a>, and it could be happening in more places, too. But it's not.&#160;</p><h2>'Not going to the grocery store' and 'not socializing with friends'</h2><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f8ddb98c21cfb0019468d71?format=jpeg\" alt=\"gloves mask grocery shopping lockdown stay at home orders\" height=\"1333\" width=\"1777\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Gary Towler puts on gloves to protect against coronavirus, before entering a grocery store Wednesday, April 22, 2020, in Spring, Texas.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"http://www.apimages.com/metadata/Index/Virus-Outbreak-Texas-Daily-Life/2c7b2ab576e345b6bd9350d82d95fc3a/11/0\" target=\"_blank\">AP Photo/David J. Phillip</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>Maria Van Kerkhove, the WHO's technical lead for COVID-19 said during the meeting Monday that she's had lots of friends and family asking her in recent days what, exactly, quarantine is. Essentially, it's complete isolation from other people, including those you'd normally live with and breathe around, to the fullest extent possible.&#160;</p><p>\"That means not going to work,\" Van Kerkhove said. \"It means not going to the grocery store. It means not socializing with friends. It means not having people over at your home.\"</p><p>Ideally, quarantining is a disease-fighting measure that is supported by local health programs and government support that can allow people to continue making a living and feeding their families while in quarantine, she said.&#160;</p><p>But finances and social support are not the only hurdle to overcome to enact proper quarantining in places around the globe.</p><h2>Faster test results are sorely needed for quarantining to really work right</h2><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f7742800ab50d00184add1c?format=jpeg\" alt=\"trump covid test swab\" height=\"1872\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>President Donald Trump pretends to take a Covid-19 test while holding a swab during his visit of the Puritan Medical Products facility in Guilford, Maine on June 5, 2020.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Nicholas Kamm/Getty</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>A big part of the reason that it's become so difficult to quarantine people effectively in the US is because COVID-19 test results are still too slow to put people on proper alert to stay home.</p><p>A recent nationwide survey from researchers at Northeastern, Harvard, Northwestern, and Rutgers Universities found that the average turnaround time for coronavirus lab tests in the US in September was about 2.7 days, which is an improvement from the average 4.4 days it took to get tests back in March. However, many public health experts, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/bill-gates-us-coronavirus-testing-system-is-absolutely-useless-slow-2020-7\">including Bill Gates</a>, agree that test results must get returned reliably within around 24 hours in order to really alert everyone who might've been exposed to the virus properly, and get those people into quarantine.&#160;</p><p>Ryan noted that many Asian countries have had very low numbers of cases for quite some time, by employing tests strategically, then squashing local clusters of cases by quarantining close contacts of the sick, before those clusters expand.</p><p>He stressed that success is due, in large part, to COVID-19 case detection, case isolation, \"and, especially, quarantining of contacts.\"</p><div href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=x-sXRbkAUPs:691IhNmCOK0:V_sGLiPBpWU\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=x-sXRbkAUPs:691IhNmCOK0:V_sGLiPBpWU\"
