Proctor)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5f8df5359e9fe4001900a347?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn64@2020_6/2020/10/20/02-05-18-493_5a75bf5265bd86d9.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn67@2020_3/2020/10/20/02-05-22-757_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=VDHKL-j7N08:7DF6Jon2Q4g:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn91@2020_3/2020/10/20/02-05-21-535_63342ca7a7f75ac2.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=VDHKL-j7N08:7DF6Jon2Q4g:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn88@2020_1/2020/10/20/02-05-19-054_adc57a9f61d8349c.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn79@2020_1/2020/10/20/02-05-18-571_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=VDHKL-j7N08:7DF6Jon2Q4g:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn32@2020_3/2020/10/20/02-05-24-332_ded002fb59166397.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/VDHKL-j7N08":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn19@2020_3/2020/10/20/02-05-22-278_abac99bc1629d9b9.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1603159473318},{"createdTime":"2020-10-20 10:04:33","updatedTime":"2020-10-20 10:04:33","title":"The $1.6 million SSC Tuatara just became the world's fastest car by topping 316 mph","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/worlds-fastest-production-car-16-million-316-mph-ssc-tuatara-2020-10","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f8dce8f9e9fe4001900a237?format=jpeg\" alt=\"SSC Tuatara_35\" height=\"1667\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The SSC Tuatara looks like someone turned a batarang into a car and can hit 316 mph.\n<p class=\"copyright\">James Lipman/SSC North America</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>The SSC Tuatara set the new record for world's fastest production car on a seven-mile stretch of State Route 160 in Nevada.</li>\n<li>The old record belonged to the Bugatti Chiron Super Sport's 304.77 mph.</li>\n<li>SSC will only build 100 Tuataras and each will be priced starting at $1.6 million.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>The title of \"world's fastest production vehicle\" now belongs to the Tuatara, the latest creation of SSC North America. The boutique American car company announced the record on Monday, after setting it on October 10, when the car used a claimed 1,750 horsepower to clock an average speed of 316.11 mph on a pair of high-speed runs. On the quicker of the two, the car hit 331.15 mph; it reached 301.07 on the \"slower\" run.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f8dce8bc21cfb0019468d1b?format=jpeg\" alt=\"SSC Tuatara_9\" height=\"1667\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The car averaged a speed of 316.11 mph on two consecutive runs.\n<p class=\"copyright\">James Lipman/SSC North America</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>The production car speed record is what its name suggests: a record set by a street-legal production car. A car that you or I could theoretically buy and drive legally on US roads, provided that you have $1.6 million because that's what SSC will demand of you if you want to put the Tuatara in your driveway.&#160;<p>Other record criteria include traveling the same route in opposite directions (to balance out any effect of wind and terrain) and achieving the speeds within an hour. The record has to be achieved on a public road for \"real world\" driving conditions and the car must run on non-race fuel and be equipped with street tires.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f8dce939e9fe4001900a23f?format=jpeg\" alt=\"SSC Tuatara_17\" height=\"1667\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>It&#39;s powered by a 1,750-horsepower engine.\n<p class=\"copyright\">James Lipman/SSC North America</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>The last car to set the production car speed record was the Bugatti Chiron Super Sport in 2019 at Volkswagen's giant Ehra-Lessien test track in Germany. The Chiron Super Sport achieved a speed of 304.77 mph, according to <a href=\"https://arstechnica.com/cars/2020/10/ssc-takes-bugattis-crown-with-a-new-316mph-production-car-speed-record/\">Ars Technica</a>.&#160;</p><p>Pro racing driver Oliver Webb set the record&#160;outside of Las Vegas and near Pahrump, Nevada, on a closed, seven-mile stretch of State Route 160.&#160; Onsite officials, using Dewetron GPS measurements that tracked the speed runs with an average of 15 satellites, verified the new 316.11-mph record.&#160;</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f8dce999e9fe4001900a249?format=jpeg\" alt=\"SSC Tuatara_45\" height=\"1667\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>SSC founder Jerod Shelby (left, and of no relation to Carroll Shelby) stands with driver Oliver Webb after successfully setting the new record.\n<p class=\"copyright\">James Lipman/SSC North America</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>The SSC Tuatara itself uses a 5.9-liter, twin-turbocharged, flat-plane crank V8 engine that produces those 1,750 horsepower on <a href=\"https://afdc.energy.gov/fuels/ethanol_e85.html\">E85</a>, or 1,350 horsepower on 91 octane gasoline. It was designed to have a very low drag coefficient of 0.279.&#160;</p><p>SSC will build just 100 examples of the Tuatara. Fully optioned with the High Downforce Track Pack, the $1.6 million base price jumps to $1.9 million. Still cheaper than a <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/bugatti-chiron-pur-sport-supercar-best-features-photos-2020-10\">Bugatti Chiron Pur Sport</a>, though! And with so many more bragging rights.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f8dce90c21cfb0019468d23?format=jpeg\" alt=\"SSC Tuatara_39\" height=\"1667\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The SSC Tuatara was designed to have an extremely low drag coefficient.\n<p class=\"copyright\">James Lipman/SSC North America</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>You might remember SSC as the automaker behind the <a href=\"https://drivetribe.com/p/ssc-ultimate-aero-tt-the-forgotten-SawqVHYxTZWgixD_pRgslw?iid=Xggll3Z1RwuqtYnTH-7-CQ\">SSC Ultimate Aero</a>, which held the fastest production car record of 256.14 mph from 2007 until 2010, when the Bugatti Veyron 16.4 Super Sport claimed the title.&#160;</p><p><a href=\"https://www.caranddriver.com/news/a34406893/ssc-tuatara-fastest-production-car/\">Car and Driver</a> notes that even though the speed run was tested and measured according to Guinness criteria, Guinness hasn't yet officially certified it as a world record.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f8dce88c21cfb0019468d1a?format=jpeg\" alt=\"SSC Tuatara_42\" height=\"1667\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Webb set the record on a closed, seven-mile stretch of public highway.\n<p class=\"copyright\">James Lipman/SSC North America</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/worlds-fastest-production-car-16-million-316-mph-ssc-tuatara-2020-10'>Business Insider</a></div><div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a 1@2020_4/2020/10/20/02-05-23-677_edd0da2fa56fde83.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1603159473330},{"createdTime":"2020-10-20 10:04:33","updatedTime":"2020-10-20 10:04:33","title":"How to go live on YouTube on your computer or mobile device – though you'll need 1,000 subscribers to live stream on mobile","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-go-live-on-youtube","description":"<iframe width=\"560\" height=\"315\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/zBNUzHEovHc\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen></iframe><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li><strong>In order to go live on YouTube, you have to first activate the feature &#8212; this takes 24 hours to complete and requires you to have a verified account.</strong></li>\n<li><strong>You can go live on YouTube on your computer or the mobile app, but only those with at least 1,000 subscribers can use the mobile version of live streaming.</strong></li>\n<li><strong>Here's what you need to know to go live on YouTube.</strong></li>\n<li><strong><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/tech-reference\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" data-analytics-module=\"summary_bullets\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"0\" data-uri=\"4c86c1c3a45644bf07d168dc4c802e5e\">Visit Business Insider's Tech Reference library for more stories</a>.</strong></li>\n</ul><p>Live streaming on <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/category/youtube\">YouTube</a> can help creators make more personal connections with their audience, but there is a bit of prep work required before you can take advantage of the feature.&#160;</p><p>For example, you should be aware that it takes 24 hours to activate your account for live streaming.&#160;</p><p>First, be sure to <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-verify-youtube-account\">verify your YouTube account</a>, then go to your <a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/dashboard?ar=2&o=U;o=U\">Creator Studio Tools</a> page and select the \"Live Streaming\" tab, located in the column on the left side of the screen.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5d5ffb432e22af5f4e07bd94?format=jpeg\" alt=\"1 HOW TO GO LIVE YOUTUBE\" height=\"639\" width=\"1427\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Select Live Streaming on the left side of the screen.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Devon Delfino/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>Once that's out of the way, here's how to go live on <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/category/youtube\">YouTube</a>, whether you're using a webcam on your computer or the mobile app.</p><h2><strong>How to go live on <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/category/youtube\">YouTube</a> on your computer</strong></h2><p>For those using a webcam to livestream, this is a fairly simple process, provided that you're using Chrome 60+ or Firefox 53+:</p><p><strong>1.</strong> Go to <a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/\">youtube.com</a> and sign into your account, if necessary.</p><p><strong>2.</strong> Click the camera icon in the top toolbar (it has a plus sign inside of it) and select \"Go live.\"</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5d5ffb5c00ef2b61063026fa?format=jpeg\" alt=\"2 HOW TO GO LIVE YOUTUBE\" height=\"597\" width=\"1440\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Select Go Live.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Devon Delfino/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p><strong>3.</strong> Select \"Webcam\" at the top of the screen.</p><p><strong>4.</strong> Enter your title and description, and establish the privacy settings (you could also schedule the livestream for a later date from this screen).</p><p><strong>5.</strong> Click \"Save\" — your webcam will take a thumbnail for the livestream at this point, so make sure you're prepared for that.</p><p><strong>6.</strong> Click \"Go Live.\"</p><p>When you're done, simply click \"End Stream\" at the bottom of the screen. As long as you didn't go over 12 hours, your livestream video will be archived.</p><h2><strong>How to go live on YouTube on the mobile app</strong></h2><p>Creators should be aware that the ability to go live on mobile is only available to those who have at least 1,000 subscribers.</p><p><strong>1.</strong> Open the YouTube app on your phone and log into your account, if necessary.</p><p><strong>2.</strong> Tap the capture button, which is a camera icon, then select \"Go Live.\"</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5d5ffb83cd97846b792b9873?format=jpeg\" alt=\"3 HOW TO GO LIVE YOUTUBE\" height=\"1920\" width=\"1080\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Tap Go Live.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Devon Delfino/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p><strong>3.</strong> If necessary, allow YouTube to record audio on your phone — you may also have to allow access to things like your camera, microphone, and location.</p><p><strong>4.</strong> At the top, select either the camera icon to use your camera to record the livestream, or select the phone icon to capture whatever is on your screen.</p><p><strong>5.</strong> Create the title and establish the privacy settings.</p><p><strong>6.</strong> If desired, you can select \"More Options\" to further customize your livestream, by adding things like scheduling, live chats, and age restrictions for viewers.</p><p><strong>7.</strong> Tap \"Next\" to take your thumbnail photo (or you can choose to upload a thumbnail).</p><p><strong>8.</strong> Select \"Share\" and then \"Go Live\" to start your livestream.</p><p>To end a livestream from a mobile phone, tap \"Finish\" and then \"Ok.\"</p><h2><strong>Related coverage from&#160;<a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/tech-reference\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"100\" data-uri=\"4c86c1c3a45644bf07d168dc4c802e5e\">Tech Reference</a>:</strong></h2><ul><li><h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/what-does-highlighted-comment-mean-on-youtube\">'What does a highlighted comment mean on YouTube?': What you need to know about the feature that helps you navigate YouTube's comment section</a></h3></li><li><h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-see-subscribers-on-youtube\">How to see a list of your YouTube subscribers on a computer or mobile device</a></h3></li><li><h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-go-live-on-instagram\">How to go live on Instagram, to broadcast video in real time to your followers</a></h3></li><li><h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-go-live-on-facebook-from-phone-computer\">How to go live on Facebook from your phone or computer</a></h3></li></ul><div class=\"read-original\">Read the border=\"0\"></img></a>\n</div><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/tfnWAK6F4Gc\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\"/>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 19 Oct 2020 17:09:00 +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5d6009399563f45ef71627a2?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"d0107795e94f10c0ace08a81e3bda8c8","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn52@2020_4/2020/10/20/02-05-13-007_9cd2c1a6d645ae75.webp","destWidth":1987,"destHeight":1491,"sourceBytes":61888,"destBytes":61888,"author":"insider@insider.com (Devon Delfino)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5d5ffb432e22af5f4e07bd94?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn63@2020_5/2020/10/20/02-05-22-753_428b8ab73e8e45e7.webp","https://i.insider.com/5d5ffb5c00ef2b61063026fa?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn16@2020_2/2020/10/20/02-05-21-520_d4afbec58c5b17e8.webp","https://i.insider.com/5d5ffb83cd97846b792b9873?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn43@2020_2/2020/10/20/02-05-16-664_d7ec32ce35614e64.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn67@2020_3/2020/10/20/02-05-22-757_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=tfnWAK6F4Gc:-hET1RtyaPQ:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn96@2020_5/2020/10/20/02-05-25-294_953d45f41143e688.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=tfnWAK6F4Gc:-hET1RtyaPQ:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn69@2020_2/2020/10/20/02-05-14-369_52286c1324523b48.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn79@2020_1/2020/10/20/02-05-18-571_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=tfnWAK6F4Gc:-hET1RtyaPQ:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn35@2020_2/2020/10/20/02-05-15-880_334ff2bb7d9be5e5.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/tfnWAK6F4Gc":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn20@2020_1/2020/10/20/02-05-21-470_cf9d7d19171aefda.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1603159473348},{"createdTime":"2020-10-20 10:04:33","updatedTime":"2020-10-20 10:04:33","title":"Experts say Amy Coney Barrett's nomination could threaten IVF. Here's why.","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/amy-coney-barretts-nomination-could-threaten-ivf-experts-explain-2020-10","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f85b88391aa9e001880b3ec?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Amy Coney Barrett\" height=\"1268\" width=\"2000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Supreme Court nominee Judge Amy Coney Barrett attends the second day of her confirmation hearing before the Senate Judiciary Committee on Capitol Hill in Washington, DC, October 13, 2020.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Kevin Dietsch/Reuters</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Amy Coney Barrett has a history of supporting anti-choice groups that believe in fetal personhood.</li>\n<li>Legislation that recognizes embryos as legal persons would complicate standard procedures involved in IVF.</li>\n<li>Freezing embryos and performing genetic testing, as well as discarding unused embryos, could be criminalized if personhood bills were to be passed.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>If Amy Coney Barrett is seated on the Supreme Court, the implications for reproductive rights will extend far beyond birth control, Eve Feinberg, MD, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/fertility-doctors-oppose-barretts-nomination-fear-threats-to-ivf-2020-10\">told Business Insider last week</a>.&#160;</p><p>The judge has a history of <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/amy-coney-barrett-supreme-court-nomination-judicial-questionnaires-2020-10\">supporting anti-choice groups</a> that promote the belief that life begins at fertilization, or \"fetal personhood,\" and seek to criminalize aspects of in vitro fertilization.</p><p>During her confirmation hearing, Barrett has evaded questions about her views on IVF and whether she would move to overturn Roe v. Wade. When asked whether criminalizing IVF would be constitutional, she <a href=\"https://twitter.com/therecount/status/1316115415832178689https://twitter.com/therecount/status/1316115415832178689\">replied</a> that she couldn't \"answer questions in the abstract.\"&#160;</p><p>Still, Barrett's association with anti-choice groups like Right to Life Michiana — a group whose stance against discarding unused embryos created in the IVF process is considered <a href=\"https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2020/oct/01/amy-coney-barrett-supported-group-fertilization\">extreme even in anti-abortion circles</a> — is enough to raise concern among fertility experts.</p><p>\"The seating of Amy Coney Barrett to the Supreme Court threatens those who seek to build a family through in-vitro fertilization,\" Feinberg and co-editors of the journal <a href=\"https://els-jbs-prod-cdn.jbs.elsevierhealth.com/pb/assets/raw/Health%20Advance/journals/fns/oyez.pdf?fbclid=IwAR371uv9GYJrJJ8MwUH_HQZiavrkPDX4GD8_mDnCYI7Qyg5yJAvNJ4XTQF8\">Fertility and Sterility</a> wrote in a letter published last Monday.</p><p>They worry that if Barrett supports legislation that recognizes every embryo created during IVF as a legal person, performing standard procedures involving those embryos could put physicians at risk for criminal violation.</p><h2><strong>Personhood legislation could criminalize genetic testing and freezing embryos</strong></h2><p>It's unlikely that personhood legislation would result in IVF being outlawed entirely, but it would make it \"incredibly difficult\" for physicians to perform assisted reproductive technology to the current standard of care, said Barbara Collura, president and CEO of RESOLVE: The National Infertility Association.</p><p>\"If you are stating that an embryo is a person, then many things that occur in an IVF laboratory become extremely difficult,\" Collura told Business Insider.&#160;</p><p><a href=\"https://www.insider.com/what-is-ivf-2018-12\">In a typical IVF treatment</a>, doctors will try to fertilize as many embryos as possible because not every embryo results in a live birth, Collura said. After fertilizing the embryos in a lab, the doctor will freeze them all and often order genetic testing to rule out abnormalities that could lead to pregnancy loss or stillbirth.</p><p>From there, the doctor would thaw and implant the embryos one at a time until one results in a successful pregnancy.</p><p>If the embryos have the right of legal personhood, standard procedures like genetic testing and cryopreservation, or freezing, could be called into question because there's a small chance of harm to the embryo.&#160;</p><p>Some personhood bills proposed at the state level have been written under homicide statutes, Collura said, meaning that a lab worker who inadvertently damages an embryo while unfreezing it could even be charged with manslaughter.</p><h2><strong>Discarding unused embryos would also be a crime under personhood laws</strong></h2><p>After a family is finished with IVF, they have the option of saving unused embryos for future attempts at pregnancy, donating them to science, or discarding them. Collura said some people just leave the embryos frozen if they can't make a decision.</p><p>In some situations, people may want to discard embryos that have tested positive for a genetic disease that would affect the viability of the pregnancy.</p><p>\"Not every embryo leads to a live birth,\" Feinberg previously told Business Insider. \"I think women who have embryos that are positive for a genetic disease should not be forced to transfer those embryos. And I think that in certain situations, discarding of embryos is morally acceptable.\"</p><p>Certain anti-choice groups, like Right to Life Michiana, equate discarding embryos to abortion.&#160;</p><p>In <a href=\"https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2020/oct/01/amy-coney-barrett-supported-group-fertilization\">an interview with The Guardian</a>, the group's executive director Jackie Appleman said: \"Whether embryos are implanted in the woman and then selectively reduced or it's done in a petri dish and then discarded, you're still ending a new human life at that point and we do oppose that.\"</p><h2><strong>Not all abortion adversaries are against IVF</strong></h2><p>At this point, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/barrett-wont-say-whether-thinks-roe-v-wade-wrongly-decided-2020-10\">no one knows how Barrett would vote on Roe v. Wade</a> and associated personhood bills if she's confirmed to the Supreme Court.</p><p>It's not a given that someone who supports personhood legislation would be against IVF, Collura said. She's spoken with \"staunch, publicly pro-life state legislators\" who, when faced with the implications of personhood for IVF, reevaluated their views.</p><p>\"It just goes to show you that you can have people who are pro-life and have this pro-life record as a legislator, yet, a lot of times, they'll say personhood goes too far,\" Collura said.</p><p><strong>Read more:</strong></p><p><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/fertility-doctors-oppose-barretts-nomination-fear-threats-to-ivf-2020-10\">Top fertility doctors oppose Amy Coney Barrett's nomination, warning it could threaten access to IVF, contraception, and abortion</a></p><p><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/biggest-takeaways-amy-coney-barrett-confirmation-hearing-2020-10\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"100\" data-uri=\"f41929226dcc4926d43a2b554e4aaf0e\">The 7 biggest takeaways from day 2 of Amy Coney Barrett's confirmation hearing</a></p><p><a href=\"https://www.insider.com/long-acting-birth-control-options-to-consider-roe-v-wade-2020-10\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"100\" data-uri=\"3474d91faa3d0c4687d4cae1ce94cbf7\">4 long-acting birth control options to consider if the Supreme Court limits contraception and abortion access</a></p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=ouVG5wG-w3c:tiTNQjS260U:yIl2AUoC8zA\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=ouVG5wG-w3c:tiTNQjS260U:F7zBnMyn0Lo\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=ouVG5wG-w3c:tiTNQjS260U:F7zBnMyn0Lo\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=ouVG5wG-w3c:tiTNQjS260U:V_sGLiPBpWU\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=ouVG5wG-w3c:tiTNQjS260U:V_sGLiPBpWU\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a border=\"0\"></img></a>\n</div><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/ouVG5wG-w3c\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\"/>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 19 Oct 2020 20:33:00 +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5f85b88991aa9e001880b3ee?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"53c14836d6642181818f2e9138b1191a","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn24@2020_5/2020/10/20/02-05-13-898_ef25f1a918b8e2cb.webp","destWidth":1690,"destHeight":1268,"sourceBytes":135146,"destBytes":135146,"author":"amichelson@businessinsider.com (Andrea Michelson)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5f85b88391aa9e001880b3ec?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn3@2020_6/2020/10/20/02-05-17-124_90b056bc2e56f7d3.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn67@2020_3/2020/10/20/02-05-22-757_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=ouVG5wG-w3c:tiTNQjS260U:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn51@2020_1/2020/10/20/02-05-25-116_b272ca566b0eb4eb.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=ouVG5wG-w3c:tiTNQjS260U:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn79@2020_6/2020/10/20/02-05-17-104_35791edb1ea44d87.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn79@2020_1/2020/10/20/02-05-18-571_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=ouVG5wG-w3c:tiTNQjS260U:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn48@2020_1/2020/10/20/02-05-16-249_33dbe64a726cf0b1.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/ouVG5wG-w3c":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn8@2020_6/2020/10/20/02-05-23-891_df982074403d52cc.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1603159473308},{"createdTime":"2020-10-20 10:04:33","updatedTime":"2020-10-20 10:04:33","title":"Average credit scores rose slightly over the summer, despite record unemployment and economic pain","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/americans-have-seen-their-credit-scores-rise-during-the-pandemic-2020-10","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f05ddbb1918242e04550a28?format=jpeg\" alt=\"average credit card interest rate\" height=\"1200\" width=\"1800\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Crystal Cox/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>In July, the average credit score was 711 compared to a reading of 708 in April, according to a report by The Wall Street Journal.</li>\n<li>The report concluded that the increase in credit scores nationwide stemmed from both financial assistance by the government and expanded unemployment benefits.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>The average credit score for Americans rose slightly during the novel coronavirus pandemic, even though times have gotten more stressful and difficult for many.&#160;</p><p>In July, the average credit score was 711 compared to an average score of 708 in April, the Wall Street Journal <a href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/coronavirus-tanked-the-economy-then-credit-scores-went-up-11603013402\">reported</a> on Sunday. July's average also compares to an average credit score of 706 just one year ago.&#160;</p><p>The report concluded that the increase in credit scores nationwide stemmed from both financial assistance by the government as well as expanded unemployment benefits that made it easier for some Americans pay their bills on time and pay off any debt they might have.&#160;</p><p>FICO scores range from 300 to 850. They're calculated based on numerous factors such as payment history, loan applications and credit reports from consumers.&#160;The Journal received its data from Fair Isaac Corp., the California-based data analytics company that creates the score.&#160;</p><p>\"First the macro stress occurs, and then it takes a few months for the strain to show up in people's credit reports,\" Ethan Dornhelm, vice president of scores and predictive analytics at FICO, <a href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/coronavirus-tanked-the-economy-then-credit-scores-went-up-11603013402\">said to The Journal</a>. Dornhelm added that both federal stimulus and deferment programs \"are having a further effect of pushing out that stress for many people.\"</p><p>The unemployment rate <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/september-jobs-report-nonfarm-payrolls-us-unemployment-rate-economy-recovery-2020-10\">declined</a> to 7.9% in September, down from a historic high 14.7% in April, with the US economy adding 661,000 more jobs. Despite the drop in unemployment, other pieces of economic data portray that millions of Americans are still struggling to get by on a daily basis.</p><p>\"The first few months after reopening was always going to see the easy economic gains,\" Seema Shah, chief strategist at Principal Global Investors, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/september-jobs-report-nonfarm-payrolls-us-unemployment-rate-economy-recovery-2020-10\">said</a> following the release of September's jobs report by the Bureau of Labor Statistics. \"Now is when additional positive economic surprises become harder to come by.\"</p><p>Long-term unemployment <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/long-term-unemployed-permanent-layoffs-rising-coronavirus-2020-10\">continues to increase</a> after coming off the biggest spike on record, and on Thursday the Labor Department announced that US jobless claims <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/us-jobless-claims-weekly-unemployment-benefits-insurance-filings-rise-economy-2020-10\">jumped</a> to an unadjusted 898,000 for the week that ended Saturday, October 10.&#160;</p><p>Negotiations between Congress and the White House for a second stimulus package have <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/why-republicans-havent-passed-a-new-covid-19-stimulus-bill-2020-10\">stalled</a> ever since the Coronavirus Aid, Relief, and Economic Security Act, or the $2.2 trillion CARES Act, passed in March. On Sunday, House Speaker Nancy Pelosi <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/pelosi-says-stimulus-negotiators-have-48-hours-to-reach-agreement-2020-10\">said</a> that a stimulus deal needs to be reached by Tuesday in order for some type of legislation to be passed by election day on November 3.</p><p>Consequently, if both parties can't reach a deal, then American consumers might see the quality of their credit slowly decline, <a href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/coronavirus-tanked-the-economy-then-credit-scores-went-up-11603013402\">according to The Journal's report</a>.</p><p>\"We're afraid that in a couple months there could be real damage to credit reports,\" Francis Creighton, chief executive of the Consumer Data Industry Association, <a href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/coronavirus-tanked-the-economy-then-credit-scores-went-up-11603013402\">told</a> The Journal.</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/americans-have-seen-their-credit-scores-rise-during-the-pandemic-2020-10'>Business Insider</a></div><div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a warmth","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/united-by-blue-bison-puffer-jacket-review","description":"<p class=\"financial-disclaimer\"><i>When you buy through our links, we may earn money from href=\"http://www.avantlink.com/click.php?tt=cl&merchant_id=7926b4ed-3067-491f-ba95-7b20f93335e9&website_id=9597bdee-ce2a-4552-aa13-419b5f275c06&url=https%3A%2F%2Funitedbyblue.com%2Fyblue.com%2F\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener nofollow sponsored\">United By Blue</a> just released its popular <a href=\"http://www.avantlink.com/click.php?tt=cl&merchant_id=7926b4ed-3067-491f-ba95-7b20f93335e9&website_id=9597bdee-ce2a-4552-aa13-419b5f275c06&url=https%3A%2F%2Funitedbyblue.com%2Fproducts%2Fmens-bison-puffer-jacket%3Fvariant%3D31480798019656480798019656\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener nofollow sponsored\">Bison Puffer Jackets</a> and <a href=\"http://www.avantlink.com/click.php?tt=cl&merchant_id=7926b4ed-3067-491f-ba95-7b20f93335e9&website_id=9597bdee-ce2a-4552-aa13-419b5f275c06&url=https%3A%2F%2Funitedbyblue.com%2Fproducts%2Fmens-bison-puffer-vest%3Fvariant%3D30892342018120892342018120\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Bison Puffer Vests</a> in new colors for men and women.</li><li>Instead of using duck or goose down, <a href=\"http://www.avantlink.com/click.php?tt=cl&merchant_id=7926b4ed-3067-491f-ba95-7b20f93335e9&website_id=9597bdee-ce2a-4552-aa13-419b5f275c06&url=https%3A%2F%2Funitedbyblue.com%2Fproducts%2Fmens-bison-puffer-jacket%3Fvariant%3D31480798019656480798019656\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener nofollow sponsored\">The United By Blue Bison Down Puffers</a> use a proprietary blend of sustainably sourced bison down and recycled polyester.&#160;</li><li>After owning my <a href=\"http://www.avantlink.com/click.php?tt=cl&merchant_id=7926b4ed-3067-491f-ba95-7b20f93335e9&website_id=9597bdee-ce2a-4552-aa13-419b5f275c06&url=https%3A%2F%2Funitedbyblue.com%2Fproducts%2Fmens-bison-puffer-jacket%3Fvariant%3D31480798019656480798019656\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener nofollow sponsored\">Bison Puffer Jacket</a> for two years, it's held up well and I'm still impressed with how warm it is considering its light weight. I know why the brand believes bison down is the future of sustainable outerwear.</li><li>At $228 (currently $136), the <a href=\"http://www.avantlink.com/click.php?tt=cl&merchant_id=7926b4ed-3067-491f-ba95-7b20f93335e9&website_id=9597bdee-ce2a-4552-aa13-419b5f275c06&url=https%3A%2F%2Funitedbyblue.com%2Fproducts%2Fmens-bison-puffer-jacket%3Fvariant%3D31480798019656480798019656\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Bison Puffer Jacket</a>&#160;is similarly priced to traditional, less sustainable options from other brands.</li></ul><div id=\"ProductCard_5e149c75855cc24b9d338876\" style=\"position:relative; display:block; width: 100%\"><iframe src=\"https://produktor.businessinsider.com/productCardService?id=5e149c75855cc24b9d338876&type=small&live=true\" width=\"100%\" height=\"150%\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\" style=\"position:absolute; top:0; left: 0\"></iframe></div><div id=\"ProductCard_5e149df7855cc242e622027a\" style=\"position:relative; display:block; width: 100%\"><iframe src=\"https://produktor.businessinsider.com/productCardService?id=5e149df7855cc242e622027a&type=small&live=true\" width=\"100%\" height=\"150%\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\" style=\"position:absolute; top:0; left: 0\"></iframe></div><p>While the&#160;purpose of most outdoor brands is simply to&#160;provide adventurers with dependable apparel and gear, <a href=\"http://www.avantlink.com/click.php?tt=cl&merchant_id=7926b4ed-3067-491f-ba95-7b20f93335e9&website_id=9597bdee-ce2a-4552-aa13-419b5f275c06&url=https%3A%2F%2Funitedbyblue.com%2Fyblue.com%2F\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\">United By Blue</a>, a new startup in the space, wants to do much more.</p><p>Founded in 2010 by Brian Linton, the company was started with the primary goal to&#160;preserve and protect the place in which explorers play. In doing that, the brand has put great emphasis on sustainability in its designs, and an unsuspecting material has been a huge part of its success.</p><p><a href=\"http://www.avantlink.com/click.php?tt=cl&merchant_id=7926b4ed-3067-491f-ba95-7b20f93335e9&website_id=9597bdee-ce2a-4552-aa13-419b5f275c06&url=https%3A%2F%2Funitedbyblue.com%2Fyblue.com%2F\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\">United By Blue</a> launched a&#160;<a href=\"http://www.avantlink.com/click.php?tt=cl&merchant_id=7926b4ed-3067-491f-ba95-7b20f93335e9&website_id=9597bdee-ce2a-4552-aa13-419b5f275c06&url=https%3A%2F%2Funitedbyblue.com%2Fpages%2Fbison-pufferbison-puffer\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\">collection of bison down-filled puffer jackets and vests</a> for men and women, and it's proving to be the future of sustainable outdoor apparel.</p><h2>About the material</h2><p>The <a href=\"http://www.avantlink.com/click.php?tt=cl&merchant_id=7926b4ed-3067-491f-ba95-7b20f93335e9&website_id=9597bdee-ce2a-4552-aa13-419b5f275c06&url=https%3A%2F%2Funitedbyblue.com%2Fpages%2Fbison-pufferbison-puffer\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\">United By Blue Bison Puffer Collection</a> uses the brand's proprietary B100 insulation, which is a 50/50 blend of North American bison fiber and recycled polyester. The material is naturally temperature regulating, hypoallergenic, lightweight, and it provides superior warmth. With the B100 bison down, you get to take advantage of the natural properties that allow bison to tough out cold winters instead of migrating south.</p><p>Typically regarded as waste in the ranching industry, bison down can be sustainably sourced and repurposed as opposed to other materials like duck or goose down where the animals are often treated inhumanely or killed specifically for their feathers.&#160;</p><p><a href=\"http://www.avantlink.com/click.php?tt=cl&merchant_id=7926b4ed-3067-491f-ba95-7b20f93335e9&website_id=9597bdee-ce2a-4552-aa13-419b5f275c06&url=https%3A%2F%2Funitedbyblue.com%2Fpages%2Fbison-pufferhttp://www.avantlink.com/click.php?tt=cl&merchant_id=7926b4ed-3067-491f-ba95-7b20f93335e9&website_id=9597bdee-ce2a-4552-aa13-419b5f275c06&url=https%3A%2F%2Funitedbyblue.com%2Fproducts%2Fmens-bison-puffer-jacket%3Fvariant%3D31480798019656variant%3D31480798019656\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\"><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5bd9d41fc9570133e32f701d?format=jpeg\" alt=\"bisonmanufacturing13_print\" height=\"2000\" width=\"2667\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">United By Blue</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure></a></p><p>Instead of seeing the bison down go to waste in landfills as a byproduct of the bison meat industry, the materials are sheared from hides, combed, cleaned, and blended with polyester. The end result is a super lightweight and warm material.</p><p>\"The Bison Puffer Jacket is the most sustainable down-alternative jacket we have ever produced,\" said Brendan Rauth, Product Designer for United By Blue. \"Incorporating lighter weight and higher performance recycled and natural materials, the bison puffer raises the bar for not just bison-insulated outerwear, but sustainable outerwear.\"</p><h2>United By Blue's impact on the environment</h2><p>With a forward-thinking approach to sustainability, the brand's efforts don't end with the special material.&#160;For every product sold, <a href=\"http://www.avantlink.com/click.php?tt=cl&merchant_id=7926b4ed-3067-491f-ba95-7b20f93335e9&website_id=9597bdee-ce2a-4552-aa13-419b5f275c06&url=https%3A%2F%2Funitedbyblue.com%2Fyblue.com%2F\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow nofollow sponsored\">United By Blue</a> removes one pound of trash from the world's oceans and waterways. To date, they've removed more than 3.42 million pounds of waste — over 1.97 million pounds more than when I first review the United By Blue Puffer in October 2018. It's clear that the brand has a strong initiative to take care of the planet, and if you'd like to contribute by joining a community-based cleanup, you can <a href=\"http://www.avantlink.com/click.php?tt=cl&merchant_id=7926b4ed-3067-491f-ba95-7b20f93335e9&website_id=9597bdee-ce2a-4552-aa13-419b5f275c06&url=https%3A%2F%2Funitedbyblue.com%2Fpages%2Fjoin-a-cleanupin-a-cleanup\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener nofollow sponsored\">sign up here</a>.</p><p><a href=\"http://www.avantlink.com/click.php?tt=cl&merchant_id=7926b4ed-3067-491f-ba95-7b20f93335e9&website_id=9597bdee-ce2a-4552-aa13-419b5f275c06&url=https%3A%2F%2Funitedbyblue.com%2Fproducts%2Fmens-bison-puffer-jacket%3Fvariant%3D31480798019656480798019656\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener nofollow sponsored\"><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e13933e855cc270ba256643?format=jpeg\" alt=\"United By Blue mens jacket vest\" height=\"2496\" width=\"3328\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">United By Blue</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure></a></p><p>After wearing the <a href=\"http://www.avantlink.com/click.php?tt=cl&merchant_id=7926b4ed-3067-491f-ba95-7b20f93335e9&website_id=9597bdee-ce2a-4552-aa13-419b5f275c06&url=https%3A%2F%2Funitedbyblue.com%2Fproducts%2Fmens-bison-puffer-jacket%3Fvariant%3D13043352666184043352666184\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\">Bison Puffer Jacket</a> in the original olive and orange colorway (now sold out), I understood why the brand believes in the material so strongly.</p><p>My review below is based on the <a href=\"http://www.avantlink.com/click.php?tt=cl&merchant_id=7926b4ed-3067-491f-ba95-7b20f93335e9&website_id=9597bdee-ce2a-4552-aa13-419b5f275c06&url=https%3A%2F%2Funitedbyblue.com%2Fproducts%2Fmens-bison-puffer-jacket%3Fvariant%3D13043352666184043352666184\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\">men's jacket</a>, but can be applied to the women's version and the vests, with the exception of obvious differences like colors and fit.&#160;</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e1394f0855cc27c9f09bd74?format=jpeg\" alt=\"United By Blue womens jacket vest\" height=\"2250\" width=\"3000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">United By Blue</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><h2>My initial review of the Bison Puffer Jacket</h2><p>My first impression of the <a href=\"http://www.avantlink.com/click.php?tt=cl&merchant_id=7926b4ed-3067-491f-ba95-7b20f93335e9&website_id=9597bdee-ce2a-4552-aa13-419b5f275c06&url=https%3A%2F%2Funitedbyblue.com%2Fproducts%2Fmens-bison-puffer-jacket%3Fvariant%3D13043352666184043352666184\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\">United By Blue Bison Puffer Jacket</a> was that it was a lot lighter than I thought it would be. When I think of a warm jacket, I usually think of something that has some weight to it. After wearing the jacket a few times, I can say that it's noticeably warmer than other jackets I own of similar weight. I found this to be a great advantage for staying mobile and comfortable overall, whether commuting or adventuring outdoors. It's not bulky, but still has the main features you'd expect from a cold-weather jacket like a high neck collar and a waterproof finish.</p><p>As simple as it may seem, one of my favorite features is the fleece-lined pocket. There's nothing worse than trying to keep your hands warm, only to shove them into freezing cold nylon pockets. I also really like the adjustable drawcords at them. They helped make the jacket fit my body better, and once it really starts to get cold it'll help keep the elements out. The sleeve cuffs are elastic, but I do wish they were adjustable with Velcro for the same reason.</p><p><a href=\"http://www.avantlink.com/click.php?tt=cl&merchant_id=7926b4ed-3067-491f-ba95-7b20f93335e9&website_id=9597bdee-ce2a-4552-aa13-419b5f275c06&url=https%3A%2F%2Funitedbyblue.com%2Fproducts%2Fmens-bison-puffer-jacket%3Fvariant%3D13043352666184043352666184\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\"><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5bd9c6705f1f7531ce4e73c1?format=jpeg\" alt=\"ubb details\" height=\"2490\" width=\"3320\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">United By Blue</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure></a></p><h2>How it's held up after two years of wear</h2><p>Since reviewing the <a href=\"http://www.avantlink.com/click.php?tt=cl&merchant_id=7926b4ed-3067-491f-ba95-7b20f93335e9&website_id=9597bdee-ce2a-4552-aa13-419b5f275c06&url=https%3A%2F%2Funitedbyblue.com%2Fproducts%2Fmens-bison-puffer-jacket%3Fvariant%3D31480798019656480798019656\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener nofollow sponsored\">United By Blue Puffer</a> in October 2018, it hasn't been my go-to jacket mainly because the color isn't extremely versatile, but I have worn it a handful of times. Don't get me wrong, the color is great, but it does require more effort to wear than the new Midnight Blue and Dark Olive colorways available now. While the new color choices are purely a matter of aesthetics, I consider them to be an improvement because you can wear them a lot more.&#160;</p><p>After experiencing the jacket in both fall and winter seasons, it has kept me warm in moderately cold weather. United By Blue claims the jacket is built for -20<a href=\"https://www.degreesymbol.net/\"></a>° F to 30° F temperatures, but I haven't put it to the test in weather <em>that&#160;</em>cold. If the weather is well below freezing, <a href=\"https://www.degreesymbol.net/\"></a>I tend to choose a heavier parka with a hood. If you're looking for an extreme conditions winter coat, this is not it. With that said, I'm still impressed with how warm the United By Blue Bison Puffer is compared to other jackets that are not quite meant for super cold weather like fleeces, packable down jackets, and sherpas.&#160;</p><p><a href=\"http://www.avantlink.com/click.php?tt=cl&merchant_id=7926b4ed-3067-491f-ba95-7b20f93335e9&website_id=9597bdee-ce2a-4552-aa13-419b5f275c06&url=https%3A%2F%2Funitedbyblue.com%2Fproducts%2Fmens-bison-puffer-jacket%3Fvariant%3D31480798019656480798019656\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\"><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e13b093855cc20dab3a0723?format=jpeg\" alt=\"United By Blue Puffer and Beanie\" height=\"2250\" width=\"3000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Amir Ismael/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure></a></p><h2>The bottom line</h2><p>At $112 for the vest and $136 for the jacket, the <a href=\"http://www.avantlink.com/click.php?tt=cl&merchant_id=7926b4ed-3067-491f-ba95-7b20f93335e9&website_id=9597bdee-ce2a-4552-aa13-419b5f275c06&url=https%3A%2F%2Funitedbyblue.com%2Fpages%2Fbison-pufferbison-puffer\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\">United By Blue Bison Puffer Collection</a> has good value. Give or take a few dollars depending on the exact style you compare it to, both the vest and jacket are similarly priced to options from brands like <a href=\"https://www.avantlink.com/click.php?tt=cl&mi=10083&pw=184534&ctc=&url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.patagonia.com%2Fhome%2Fia.com%2Fhome%2F\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\">Patagonia</a> and <a href=\"https://track.flexlinkspro.com/a.ashx?foid=1067927.140208444&foc=1&fot=9999&fos=1&url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.thenorthface.com%2Fnorthface.com%2F\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\">The North Face</a>, but are equally, if not more, sustainably made.</p><p>In terms of style, the new <a href=\"http://www.avantlink.com/click.php?tt=cl&merchant_id=7926b4ed-3067-491f-ba95-7b20f93335e9&website_id=9597bdee-ce2a-4552-aa13-419b5f275c06&url=https%3A%2F%2Funitedbyblue.com%2Fproducts%2Fmens-bison-puffer-jacket%3Fvariant%3D13043352666184043352666184\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\">United By Blue Bison Puffer Jacket</a> has a timeless design, meaning you'll be able to wear it year after year regardless of which color you decide on.&#160;</p><p>With <a href=\"http://www.avantlink.com/click.php?tt=cl&merchant_id=7926b4ed-3067-491f-ba95-7b20f93335e9&website_id=9597bdee-ce2a-4552-aa13-419b5f275c06&url=https%3A%2F%2Funitedbyblue.com%2Fyblue.com%2F\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow nofollow sponsored\">United By Blue</a>, you won't have to worry about what's inside your jacket or how it got there. And if you're looking for a warm option that doesn't compromise your ethics or the environment, the <a href=\"http://www.avantlink.com/click.php?tt=cl&merchant_id=7926b4ed-3067-491f-ba95-7b20f93335e9&website_id=9597bdee-ce2a-4552-aa13-419b5f275c06&url=https%3A%2F%2Funitedbyblue.com%2Fproducts%2Fmens-bison-puffer-jacket%3Fvariant%3D13043352666184043352666184\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\">United By Blue Bison Puffer Jacket</a> is the best choice you can make.&#160;</p><h3><a href=\"https://unitedbyblue.com/collections/outerwear\" 10:04:33","updatedTime":"2020-10-20 10:04:33","title":"The New Yorker reportedly suspends Jeffrey Toobin for exposing himself during a Zoom call with coworkers","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/jeffrey-toobin-new-yorker-zoom-video-conferencing-suspension-2020-10","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f8ddec8c21cfb0019468d90?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Toobin.\" height=\"2672\" width=\"3563\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Jeffrey Toobin.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Paul Marotta/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>The New Yorker magazine has suspended staff writer Jeffrey Toobin for exposing himself while on a Zoom call, <a href=\"https://www.vice.com/en/article/epdgm4/new-yorker-suspends-jeffrey-toobin-for-zoom-dick-incident\">according to Vice News</a>.</li>\n<li>The video call where the incident occured was reportedly between Toobin and members of the New Yorker and WNYC radio.</li>\n<li>Toobin apologized, saying he \"made an embarrassingly stupid mistake\" and was under the belief that he was \"off-camera.\"</li>\n<li>Toobin is also the chief legal analyst at CNN and will take a hiatus from the network.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>The New Yorker magazine has suspended staff writer Jeffrey Toobin for exposing himself while on a Zoom call, <a href=\"https://www.vice.com/en/article/epdgm4/new-yorker-suspends-jeffrey-toobin-for-zoom-dick-incident\">according to Vice News</a>.</p><p>The video conference call where the incident occured was reportedly between Toobin and members of the New Yorker and WNYC radio.</p><p>In a statement to Motherboard, Vice's online magazine dedicated to technology and science, Toobin expressed regret for the incident.</p><p>\"I made an embarrassingly stupid mistake, believing I was off-camera,\" he said. \"I apologize to my wife, family, friends and co-workers.\"</p><p>He added: \"I believed I was not visible on Zoom. I thought no one on the Zoom call could see me. I thought I had muted the Zoom video.\"</p><p>Motherboard reported that two individuals said that the call was an election simulation with several of the magazine's top writers, including Evan Osnos, Jelani Cobb, Masha Gessen, Andrew Marantz, Sue Halpern, Dexter Filkins, and Toobin. Producers from the magazine and WNYC were also reportedly on the call.</p><p><a href=\"https://twitter.com/laurawags/status/1318302215711358977\">The two individuals told Motherboard</a> that \"it was unclear how much each individual person on the call saw,\" but they said it appeared as though Toobin took another call at one point and lowered his camera to reveal himself masturbating.</p><p>Natalie Raabe, a spokesperson for the New Yorker, announced the punitive action by the Condé Nast publication.</p><p>\"Jeffrey Toobin has been suspended while we investigate the matter,\" she said.</p><p>David Remnick, editor of the New Yorker, sent a note to staffers on Monday regarding the incident.</p><p>\"As you may have read in various news reports today, one of our writers, Jeff Toobin, was suspended after an incident on a Zoom call last week,\" he wrote. \"Please be assured that we take such matters seriously and that we are looking into it.\"</p><p>According to Vice, Toobin's Condé Nast email address has reportedly been disabled.</p><p>In his last tweet on October 13, Toobin commented on the upcoming challenge to the Affordable Care Act during the Supreme Court nomination hearing for Judge Amy Coney Barrett.</p><blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet blockquote\" data-lang=\"en\" data-cards=\"\" data-conversation=\"\">&#8212;Jeffrey Toobin  (@JeffreyToobin) <a href=\"https://twitter.com/mims/statuses/1316027127607648261?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw\">October 13, 2020</a></blockquote><script async src=\"//platform.twitter.com/widgets.js\" charset=\"utf-8\"></script><p>On Saturday, Toobin appeared on CNN, where he is the channel's chief legal analyst. However, on Monday, the network announced that he was taking a hiatus.</p><p>\"Jeff Toobin has asked for some time off while he deals with a personal issue, which we have granted,\" the network said in a statement.</p><p>Toobin, one of the country's most well-known legal journalists, has been a go-to media figure for Supreme Court news for decades.</p><p><em>This story has been updated.</em></p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/jeffrey-toobin-new-yorker-zoom-video-conferencing-suspension-2020-10'>Business 10:04:33","updatedTime":"2020-10-20 10:04:33","title":"Trump ridicules Fauci for throwing 'the worst first pitch' in baseball history and urges him to stop wearing a Washington Nationals face mask","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/trump-ridicules-fauci-for-worst-first-pitch-in-baseball-history-2020-10","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f8ddc989e9fe4001900a2a9?format=jpeg\" alt=\"GettyImages donald trump\" height=\"683\" width=\"1024\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>President Donald Trump throws a baseball on the South Lawn of the White House on July 23, 2020 in Washington, DC.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Drew Angerer/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>On Monday, President Donald Trump scorned Dr. Anthony Fauci's baseball skills and said the US' top infectious disease expert should stop wearing a Washington Nationals mask.</li>\n<li>\"Tony threw out perhaps the worst first pitch in the history of Baseball!\" Trump tweeted.&#160;</li>\n<li>The comments came hours after Trump ranted against Fauci and called him a \"disaster\" on a campaign call, according to multiple reports.&#160;</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>President Donald Trump on Monday mocked Dr. Anthony Fauci's baseball skills and said the nation's leading infectious disease expert should no longer wear a mask with the Washington Nationals' logo that he's been <a href=\"https://www.nbcwashington.com/news/sports/nbcsports/dr-fauci-wears-nationals-themed-mask-before-testifying-on-u-s-covid-19-response/2341773/\">frequently pictured</a> in.</p><p>\"Tony should stop wearing the Washington Nationals' Mask for two reasons. Number one, it is not up to the high standards that he should be exposing,\" Trump tweeted. \"Number two, it keeps reminding me that Tony threw out perhaps the worst first pitch in the history of Baseball!\"</p><p>The post references Fauci's ceremonial pitch at the Washington Nationals and New York Yankees opening game in July for the 2020 Major League Baseball season. Fauci, a longtime Nationals fan, was invited <a href=\"https://www.today.com/news/dr-anthony-fauci-throws-first-pitch-washington-nationals-season-opener-t187625\">by the team</a> because he's been \"a true champion for our country during the COVID-19 pandemic and throughout his distinguished career,\" its statement read.</p><p>The president's latest attack comes hours after he ranted about the US' top public health official during a call with campaign staff, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/anthony-fauci-donald-trump-coronavirus-restrictions-election-2020-10\">reportedly</a> calling him a \"disaster\" and downplaying concerns about the coronavirus while infection and death rates surge in dozens of states.&#160;</p><p>\"People are tired of hearing Fauci and all these idiots,\" Trump said on the call, according to <a href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2020/10/19/politics/donald-trump-anthony-fauci-coronavirus/index.html\">multiple</a> <a href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2020/10/19/politics/donald-trump-anthony-fauci-coronavirus/index.html\">reports</a>.&#160;</p><p>In recent days, the president has expressed his growing frustration with Fauci, a member of the White House coronavirus task force who has served as director of the National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases since 1984. At a campaign rally last week, Trump accused Fauci of <a href=\"https://www.cbsnews.com/news/trump-calls-fauci-democrat/\">being a Democrat</a>, though he is not registered with either party.&#160;</p><p>On Sunday, Fauci said in an <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/dr-fauci-absolutely-not-surprised-that-trump-contracted-coronavirus-2020-10\">interview</a> with CBS' \"60 Minutes\" that he was not surprised Trump had contracted COVID-19, given his regular flouting of public health guidelines, such as mask-wearing. The health expert also spoke about&#160;his concerns over the president's use of his image in a <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/fauci-trump-campaign-harassment-clip-out-of-context-in-ad-2020-10\">recent campaign video</a>.&#160;</p><p>At the time of the baseball pitch, Trump signaled his annoyance by stating that he was also scheduled to throw a pitch at a Yankees game in August. The announcement surprised both the New York baseball team and White House staff, who said they had no knowledge of such an event, which eventually never made it on the calendar, <a href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/07/27/us/politics/trump-yankees-fauci.html\">The New York Times reported.</a></p><p>Trump also made sure in Monday's tweet to criticize Fauci's \"bad arm.\" And a Washington Post data reporter showed that Fauci's curveball could be ranked as one of the worst in history.&#160;</p><blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet blockquote\" data-lang=\"en\" data-cards=\"\" data-conversation=\"\">&#8212;Christopher Ingraham  (@_cingraham) <a href=\"https://twitter.com/mims/statuses/1318257529470644225?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw\">October 19, 2020</a></blockquote><script async src=\"//platform.twitter.com/widgets.js\" charset=\"utf-8\"></script><p>So far, Trump is the only president who has not thrown a ceremonial pitch while in office since the tradition was established in 1910. Yet he had done so before his election, and shared a clip of the scene on Monday along with the caption: \"A perfect strike for the American people!\"</p><blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet blockquote\" data-lang=\"en\" data-cards=\"\" data-conversation=\"\">&#8212;Donald J. the U.S. Federal Reserve System\n<p class=\"copyright\">REUTERS/ Robert Galbraith</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul><li><strong>Additional fiscal stimulus is needed to keep the economic recovery on track, former Federal Reserve Chair Janet Yellen said Monday.</strong></li><li><strong>The central bank \"has already done a huge amount,\" and now Congress needs to pick up the slack, she said on <a href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-10-19/former-fed-leader-yellen-says-fiscal-support-vital-for-economy?srnd=markets-vp\">Bloomberg TV</a>.</strong></li><li><strong>\"While the pandemic is still seriously affecting the economy, we need to continue extraordinary fiscal support,\" she added.</strong></li><li><strong>Yellen also echoed current Fed Chair Jerome Powell in noting that the path of the US economy hinges on the path of the virus. The country should push for more testing and improved contact tracing to better contain the pandemic, she said.</strong></li><li><strong><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingest?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingestutm_source=msn.com&utm_medium=referral&utm_content=msn-slideshow&utm_campaign=bodyurl?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingestts&#38;utm_medium=ingest\">Visit the Business Insider homepage for more stories</a>.</strong></li></ul><hr><p>Former Federal Reserve Chair Janet Yellen on Monday joined the throngs of investors, economists, and legislators calling for more fiscal stimulus.</p><p>The $2.2 trillion CARES Act and other spending measures were \"impressive\" and played a major role in starting the US economic recovery, Yellen said on <a href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-10-19/former-fed-leader-yellen-says-fiscal-support-vital-for-economy?srnd=markets-vp\">Bloomberg TV</a>. Yet that fiscal relief has expired and the Fed \"has already done a huge amount\" to keep its support in place. Congress needs to pick up the slack to ensure the nation's rebound stays on track, Yellen said.</p><p>\"There are some limits [to monetary policy] and it's important for fiscal policy to fill in that gap,\" the former Fed chief said. \"While the pandemic is still seriously affecting the economy, we need to continue extraordinary fiscal support.\"</p><p><em><strong>Read more:</strong> <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/investing-outlook-crowded-trades-overweight-underweight-stocks-ubs-asset-managers-2020-10\" data-analytics-position=\"4\" data-analytics-module=\"\">These are the 10 most crowded trades among global money managers, UBS says. The biggest underweight stocks might surprise you</a></em></p><p>The remarks echo statements from current chair Jerome Powell and regional Fed presidents. Officials have repeatedly urged Congress to approve new aid, emphasizing the Fed's ability to lend, not spend.</p><p>Yet months of talks between Democrats and the White House yielded little progress. The two parties remain stuck in negotiations despite House Speaker Nancy Pelosi imposing on Sunday a 48-hour deadline for talks. Even if the White House reaches a compromise with House Democrats, Senate Republicans are poised to kill the bill.</p><p>Yellen also repeated Powell's warnings that the path of the US recovery hinges on its containment of the coronavirus. While President Donald Trump continues to downplay the virus and praise a V-shaped bounce-back, his Fed chair has cautioned that a resurgence of COVID-19 cases could derail the economic rebound.</p><p>Efforts including increased testing, contact tracing, and mask-wearing will play a critical role in bringing the US back to pre-pandemic levels of growth, Yellen said.</p><p>\"We need a much more effective effort than we've had. If we had that it would be good not only for health but for being able to open up the economy, and we've seen that in countries ranging from Germany to Korea to China that have been successful,\" she said.</p><p><em><strong>Read more:</strong> <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/stock-picks-to-buy-etf-strategy-cathie-wood-ark-invest-2020-10\" data-analytics-position=\"5\" data-analytics-module=\"\">Cathie Wood runs 5 funds that more than doubled broader market returns in the 3rd quarter. She and her team break down 8 winning stocks turbocharging the outperformance of its top ETFs.</a></em></p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a border=\"0\"></img></a>\n</div><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/VpWMrUYbCas\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\"/>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 19 Oct 2020 17:41:15 +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5f8dc2019e9fe4001900a1e9?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"fa9af476c46799441b374c74a5a44c40","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn4@2020_5/2020/10/20/02-05-15-871_99ae88df9f49c5e0.webp","destWidth":1174,"destHeight":880,"sourceBytes":30032,"destBytes":30032,"author":"bwinck@businessinsider.com (Ben Winck)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5f8dc20fc21cfb0019468ce4?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn55@2020_4/2020/10/20/02-05-16-788_681e6dfd47ea536f.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn67@2020_3/2020/10/20/02-05-22-757_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=VpWMrUYbCas:doxfGvuYCss:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn68@2020_2/2020/10/20/02-05-15-268_de9fdd8bdc1920e5.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=VpWMrUYbCas:doxfGvuYCss:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn7@2020_4/2020/10/20/02-05-14-309_7993cf611e6fb385.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn79@2020_1/2020/10/20/02-05-18-571_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=VpWMrUYbCas:doxfGvuYCss:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn96@2020_3/2020/10/20/02-05-24-661_b9dc2d9505672738.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/VpWMrUYbCas":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn55@2020_3/2020/10/20/02-05-21-810_dd0b6416643b5403.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1603159473340},{"createdTime":"2020-10-20 10:04:33","updatedTime":"2020-10-20 10:04:33","title":"The US has charged 6 Russian hackers for a string of 'destructive' cyberattacks that targeted elections, shut down hospitals, and crippled a power grid","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/us-doj-russia-hackers-gru-olympics-notpetya-ukraine-sandworm-2020-10","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f8dd1adc21cfb0019468d43?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Russian President Vladimir Putin applauds during the State Awards Ceremony at the Grand Kremlin Palace in Moscow, Russia, June,12,2019\" height=\"766\" width=\"1021\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Russian president Vladimir Putin.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Photo by Mikhail Svetlov/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>The United States accused six Russian government officials of orchestrating a string of high-profile cyberattacks that caused billions of dollars in damage in indictments unsealed on Monday.</li>\n<li>The alleged cybercrimes include attacks that took down parts of Ukraine's power grid, disrupted the Olympic games in South Korea, and disrupted the computer systems of several US hospitals.</li>\n<li>The six Russians are accused of comprising Sandworm, a Russian hacking collective that has wreaked havoc internationally but avoided prosecution until now.</li>\n<li>Justice Department officials called the alleged hacking \"the most destructive, most costly, and most egregious cyberattacks ever known\" to be carried out by a single group.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>Federal prosecutors accused six Russian government officials of orchestrating widespread cyberattacks that targeted Russia's perceived enemies across the globe in a sweeping indictment unsealed Monday.</p><p>The six men are charged with creating <a href=\"https://slate.com/technology/2019/11/sandworm-andy-greenberg-excerpt-notpetya-hospitals.html\">a worm called NotPetya</a> that infected computers across the globe and caused $10 billion in damage, as well as carrying out individual attacks that <a href=\"https://www.wired.com/story/crash-override-malware/\">shut down the power grid in Ukraine</a>, disrupted the IT infrastructure of the <a href=\"https://www.bbc.com/news/technology-43030673\">2018 Olympics in South Korea</a>, and <a href=\"https://www.vox.com/2017/6/27/15881666/global-eu-cyber-attack-us-hackers-nsa-hospitals\">took down the computer systems</a> of a chain of hospitals in Western Pennsylvania.&#160;</p><p>The string of hacks are the \"most destructive, most costly, and most egregious cyberattacks ever known,\" US attorney Scott Brady said in a press conference on Monday.</p><p>The hackers — Yuriy Sergeyevich Andrienko, Sergey Vladimirovich Detistov, Pavel Valeryevich Frolov, Artem Valeryevich Ochichenko, Petr Nikolayevich Pliskin, and Anatoliy Sergeyevich Kovalev — are accused of comprising <a href=\"https://www.wired.com/story/sandworm-kremlin-most-dangerous-hackers/\">Sandworm</a>, a Russian hacking group that has wreaked havoc for years but avoided prosecution until now.</p><p>They're all members of the GRU, a Russian intelligence agency that the FBI <a href=\"https://www.fbi.gov/wanted/cyber/Russian-interference-in-2016-u-s-elections\">said</a> was behind Russian efforts to interfere in the 2016 presidential election. However, federal prosecutors did not charge the men with planning any attacks on the upcoming US election, and Brady said Monday that law enforcement doesn't have any reason to believe that Russian hackers have compromised US voting systems.</p><p>But according to the indictment, the six Russian hackers did carry out repeated attempts to sabotage Russia's perceived enemies in recent years, including a <a href=\"https://www.cnet.com/news/macron-french-presidential-campaign-says-it-was-hacked/\">2017 attack on French voting infrastructure</a> and <a href=\"https://redirect.viglink.com/?format=go&jsonp=vglnk_160313120438112&key=ce074976249105acf14d8c9cf69bdcd1&libId=kgguvhd301003n6p000DLaz2y8okt&loc=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.cnet.com%2Fnews%2Fus-charges-Russian-hackers-over-3-of-worlds-biggest-cyberattacks%2F&v=1&out=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.wired.com%2Fstory%2Fus-blames-russia-gru-sweeping-cyberattacks-georgia%2F&ref=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.google.com%2F&title=US%20charges%20Russian%20hackers%20over%203%20of%20world%27s%20biggest%20cyberattacks%20-%20CNET&txt=%20the%20Georgian%20government%20in%202019%20Georgian%20government%20in%202019\">a string of cyberattacks against the Georgian government</a> in 2019.</p><p>In one of the most severe cases, the hackers are accused of <a href=\"https://www.wired.com/story/russia-ukraine-cyberattack-power-grid-blackout-destruction/\">disrupting Ukraine's power grid</a> in December 2015, assistant attorney general John Demers said during the press conference Monday.</p><p>\"These attacks turned out the lights and turned off the heat in the middle of the Eastern European winter, as the lives of hundreds of thousands of Ukrainian men, women and children went dark and cold,\" Demers said.</p><p>The six hackers are also accused of orchestrating a cyberattack against the <a href=\"https://www.vox.com/2017/6/27/15881666/global-eu-cyber-attack-us-hackers-nsa-hospitals\">Heritage Valley Health Systems</a>, a hospital chain in Western Pennsylvania. The attack used ransomware built into the group's NotPetya worm, which shut down the computer systems of two hospitals and demanded a ransom payment, shutting down surgeries for about a week.</p><p>\"These are crimes committed by Russian government officials against real victims who suffered real harms,\" Brady said.</p><p>The six men are believed to still be residents of Russia, according to the indictment. Russia has repeatedly denied US allegations that it orchestrated cyberattacks.</p><p>Read the full indictment below:</p><div class=\"insider-raw-embed\"><div
