height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\"/>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 19 Oct 2020 18:48:27 +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5f8dd1adc21cfb0019468d43?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"e19e566f8c8859a023300652fc68f1c3","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn19@2020_3/2020/10/20/02-04-36-957_194bd403704d4462.webp","destWidth":1021,"destHeight":766,"sourceBytes":27012,"destBytes":27012,"author":"aholmes@businessinsider.com (Aaron Holmes)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5f8dd1adc21cfb0019468d43?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn19@2020_3/2020/10/20/02-04-36-957_194bd403704d4462.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn67@2020_3/2020/10/20/02-05-22-757_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=M5EOnrz7yVU:aeJcJUkCFUY:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx23/cdn68@2020_1/2020/10/20/02-05-21-301_00dc063545941dd4.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=M5EOnrz7yVU:aeJcJUkCFUY:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn88@2020_3/2020/10/20/02-05-25-228_9707685145e4b26e.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn79@2020_1/2020/10/20/02-05-18-571_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=M5EOnrz7yVU:aeJcJUkCFUY:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn67@2020_3/2020/10/20/02-05-18-720_845798a859486c3e.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/M5EOnrz7yVU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn91@2020_6/2020/10/20/02-05-22-026_de4aa2c4b476e245.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1603159473344},{"createdTime":"2020-10-20 10:04:33","updatedTime":"2020-10-20 10:04:33","title":"The convertible Lincoln limo JFK rode in the morning before his assassination just sold for $375,000 — take a closer look","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/lincoln-continental-bulletproof-presidential-limo-kennedy-rode-assassination-auction-photos-2020-10","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f76488574fe5b0018a8e9b5?format=jpeg\" alt=\"JFK WHITE 1963 LINCOLN &#34;LIMO ONE&#34; B\" height=\"1668\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>1963 Lincoln Continental Convertible.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Bonhams</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Two Lincoln Continentals that transported President John F. Kennedy crossed the auction block on October 14 through Bonhams.&#160;</li>\n<li>The 1963 Continental President Kennedy rode in the morning before his assassination sold for $375,000.&#160;</li>\n<li>It was the last car to safely transport the president and was sold with a fully original interior.&#160;</li>\n<li>The 1960 Continental Mark V that the president used for personal jaunts around Washington, DC, carried a pre-auction estimate of up to $300,000 but didn't sell.&#160;</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>President John F. Kennedy's convertible Lincoln Continental limo lives in infamy as the car the 46-year-old president was shot in on November 22, 1963 in Dallas. That car is on display at the <a href=\"https://www.thehenryford.org/collections-and-research/digital-resources/popular-topics/kennedy-limo/\">Henry Ford Museum</a> in Dearborn, Michigan, but another Lincoln JFK rode in on that fateful day crossed the auction block last week.&#160;</p><p>The last car to safely transport the president — a <a href=\"https://www.bonhams.com/auctions/25258/lot/49/\">1963 Continental</a> that he and first lady rode in the morning of the assassination — raked in $375,075 at Bonhams' The American Presidential Experience auction on October 14.&#160;A <a href=\"https://www.bonhams.com/auctions/25258/lot/50/\">1960 Continental Mark V</a> that served as President Kennedy's personal car was also up for grabs, but that car didn't sell, despite its historical significance.&#160;</p><p>The pandemic may have dealt a blow to global markets and resulted in mass unemployment, but <a href=\"https://www.automobilemag.com/news/2020-collector-car-market-update-prices-values-information/\">the classic-car market is still going strong</a>. Many large auction houses quickly pivoted to online-only events, brokering some of the <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/ferrari-enzo-most-expensive-car-ever-sold-online-auction-2020-5\">most expensive web-based car sales ever</a>.</p><p>The Lincoln Continentals that crossed the block last week didn't set any sky-high records, but in any case, you can take a closer look at the historically significant cars below.</p>\n<div id=\"slideshow\">\n\tTwo historic Lincoln Continentals associated with JFK's presidency hit the market this month through the Bonhams auction house.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f7e2bda282c500018c793bd?format=jpeg\" alt=\"1963 Lincoln Continental Convertible Sedan 1\" height=\"1876\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>1963 Lincoln Continental Convertible.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Bonhams</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tOne — the limo President John F. Kennedy rode in the morning before his assassination — sold for $375,000.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f7648850ab50d00184adb34?format=jpeg\" alt=\"JFK WHITE 1963 LINCOLN &#34;LIMO ONE&#34; \" height=\"1667\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>1963 Lincoln Continental Convertible.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Bonhams</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThe 1963 Lincoln Continental Convertible ferried the president, Jackie Kennedy, and Texas Governor John Connally to an Air Force base in Forth Worth the morning of November 22, 1963.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f76488174fe5b0018a8e9b4?format=jpeg\" alt=\"1963 Lincoln Continental Convertible Sedan 2\" height=\"1668\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>1963 Lincoln Continental Convertible.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Bonhams</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tFrom there, the president and first lady flew to Dallas, making this the last car to safely transport the late president.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f76488774fe5b0018a8e9b7?format=jpeg\" alt=\"JFK LIMO ONE D\" height=\"1668\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>1963 Lincoln Continental Convertible.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Bonhams</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tOfficially dubbed \"Limo One\" during JFK's time in Fort Worth, the white four-door was loaned out to the US by local car dealer Bill Golightly.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f7648800ab50d00184adb32?format=jpeg\" alt=\"1963 Lincoln Continental Convertible Sedan 3\" height=\"1668\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>1963 Lincoln Continental Convertible.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Bonhams</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tSince its time serving as Limo One, the Lincoln was repainted and had its engine replaced.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f76488774fe5b0018a8e9b6?format=jpeg\" alt=\"JFK WHITE 1963 LINCOLN &#34;LIMO ONE&#34; C\" height=\"1668\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>1963 Lincoln Continental Convertible.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Bonhams</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tBut its interior — including its red-leather seats — has remained mostly original.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f7648860ab50d00184adb36?format=jpeg\" alt=\"JFK WHITE 1963 LINCOLN &#34;LIMO ONE&#34; D\" height=\"1668\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>1963 Lincoln Continental Convertible.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Bonhams</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tA black 1960 Lincoln Continental Mark V that President Kennedy used for personal errands around Washington, DC, was also up for grabs.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f7e3af7282c500018c79400?format=jpeg\" alt=\"JOHN F. KENNEDY BLACK MARK V LINCOLN USED AS HIS &#34;PERSONAL&#34; CAR\" height=\"1513\" width=\"2018\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>1960 Lincoln Continental Mark V.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Bonhams</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tBonhams valued it at $200,000 to $300,000, but the car didn't sell.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f7e3a41282c500018c793f6?format=jpeg\" alt=\"1960 Lincoln Continental Mark V Executive Limousine 3\" height=\"1668\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>1960 Lincoln Continental Mark V Executive Limousine.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Bonhams</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThe government leased the car from Ford for $500 per year, and it was bought by an acquaintance of the late president in 1964.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f7e3a60282c500018c793f7?format=jpeg\" alt=\"1960 Lincoln Continental Mark V Executive Limousine 5\" height=\"1668\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>1960 Lincoln Continental Mark V Executive Limousine.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Bonhams</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThe car features an unusual two-way telephone.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f7e3aa2282c500018c793fb?format=jpeg\" alt=\"1960 Lincoln Continental Mark V Executive Limousine 12\" height=\"1668\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>1960 Lincoln Continental Mark V Executive Limousine.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Bonhams</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tIt also boasts appointments like power steering and brakes, along passenger air controls.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f7e3abec655f6001969ed2d?format=jpeg\" alt=\"1960 Lincoln Continental Mark V Executive Limousine 4\" height=\"1667\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>1960 Lincoln Continental Mark V Executive Limousine.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Bonhams</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tWhile the Lincoln's body was restored, its beige interior is all original.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f7e3a7cc655f6001969ed2c?format=jpeg\" alt=\"1960 Lincoln Continental Mark V 5f6001969ed2d?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn40@2020_4/2020/10/20/02-05-21-726_f4a4526139c00c8a.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f7e3a7cc655f6001969ed2c?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn7@2020_3/2020/10/20/02-05-19-095_6157b0c4422a28ef.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f7648850ab50d00184adb35?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn83@2020_5/2020/10/20/02-05-25-337_59572b52645c1fb9.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn67@2020_3/2020/10/20/02-05-22-757_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=mn6OpLvM3nY:cEincYZRQWY:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn84@2020_2/2020/10/20/02-05-23-616_e6ac2fb555ecd7ff.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=mn6OpLvM3nY:cEincYZRQWY:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn11@2020_5/2020/10/20/02-05-21-669_2d91193e56ec9ec8.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn79@2020_1/2020/10/20/02-05-18-571_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=mn6OpLvM3nY:cEincYZRQWY:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn75@2020_3/2020/10/20/02-05-15-343_93d73b577a44d4bb.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/mn6OpLvM3nY":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn60@2020_5/2020/10/20/02-05-19-266_679520e4443b6789.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1603159473352},{"createdTime":"2020-10-20 10:04:33","updatedTime":"2020-10-20 10:04:33","title":"Federal judge rules against Trump administration's proposal that would have rid food stamps for 700,000","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/federal-judge-blocks-trump-proposal-ridding-food-stamps-for-700000-2020-10","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f8deffb9e9fe4001900a318?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Trump Administration Sets New Work Requirement Rules For Food Stamp Recipients\" height=\"396\" width=\"528\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A sign alerting customers about SNAP food stamps benefits is displayed in a Brooklyn grocery store on December 5, 2019 in New York City. Earlier this week the Trump Administration announced stricter requirements for food stamps benefits that would cut support for nearly 700,000 poor Americans.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Scott Heins/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>On Sunday, a federal judge struck down the Trump administration's proposal that would have disqualified nearly 700,000 American adults from food stamps.</li>\n<li>The Trump administration's proposed change to the <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/food-stamp-eligibility-proposal-may-negatively-impact-food-security-2019-7\">Supplemental Nutritional Assistance Program</a> would have made it more difficult for Americans to qualify for the program.</li>\n<li>The proposed rule's impact would have likely been larger during the pandemic. The ruling cited that as of May 2020, SNAP rosters added <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/us-coronavirus-outbreak-6m-enrolled-food-stamps-superrich-wealthier-2020-7\">over 6 million new enrollees.&#160;</a></li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>A federal judge on Sunday struck down the Trump administration's proposal that would have kicked off nearly 700,000 American adults from food stamps.&#160;</p><p>According to the ruling of <a href=\"https://ecf.dcd.uscourts.gov/cgi-bin/show_public_doc?2020cv0119-107\">D.C. US District Court,</a> the Trump administration's proposed changes to alter <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/food-stamp-eligibility-proposal-may-negatively-impact-food-security-2019-7\"> Supplemental Nutritional Assistance Program (SNAP) </a>\"radically and abruptly alters decades of regulatory practice, leaving States scrambling and exponentially increasing food insecurity for tens of thousands of Americans.\"</p><p>Last year, the Trump administration <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/food-stamp-eligibility-proposal-may-negatively-impact-food-security-2019-7\">proposed a series of changes to the Supplemental Nutritional Assistance Program </a>which tightened requirements for Americans to be eligible to qualify for the program. An analysis from <a href=\"https://www.urban.org/sites/default/files/publication/101368/estimated_effect_of_recent_proposed_changes_to_snap_regulations.pdf\">the Urban Institute</a> estimated the proposals combined could kick off <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/proposed-trump-administration-rules-affect-millions-snap-food-stamps-study-2019-12\">around 3.7 million low-income Americans</a> of food stamps.&#160;</p><p>Even as the pandemic began to hit the United States, the <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/trump-rule-change-kicks-food-stamps-americans-off-coronavirus-outbreak-2020-3\">Trump administration announced in March</a> it would move forward with the proposal to raise the bar to qualify for SNAP. It was estimated in March this change would <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/trump-rule-change-kicks-food-stamps-americans-off-coronavirus-outbreak-2020-3\">have disqualified nearly 700,000 American adults from food stamps.&#160;</a></p><p>The ruling noted the USDA, the agency administering the program, has been \"icily silent\" about how many American adults would have been denied from SNAP benefits during the pandemic. The federal ruling cited that \"as of May 2020, SNAP rosters have grown by over 17 percent with <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/us-coronavirus-outbreak-6m-enrolled-food-stamps-superrich-wealthier-2020-7\">over 6 million new enrollees</a>\" in the wake of the coronavirus pandemic.&#160; The USDA did not immediately respond to Business Insider's request for comment.</p><p>Meanwhile, many Americans across the country are suffering from the financial insecurities of <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/unemployed-states-of-america-life-without-a-paycheck-in-2020-2020-9\">chronic unemployment.&#160;</a>According to a survey <a href=\"https://www.pewresearch.org/\">by Pew</a> in August, half of adults who lost a job due to the coronavirus pandemic <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/pew-half-of-adults-lost-jobs-during-covid-still-unemployed-2020-9\">remain unemployed</a> and 60% who took a pay cut continue to make less than their income prior to March.</p><ul class=\"read-more-links\"><li>Read more:</li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/us-coronavirus-outbreak-6m-enrolled-food-stamps-superrich-wealthier-2020-7\" data-read-more-link=\"\" data-e2e-name=\"read-more-link\">6 million people enrolled for food stamps in the first 3 months of the US coronavirus outbreak as America's superrich kept getting wealthier</a></li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/families-that-receive-snap-benefits-will-have-coverage-gap-due-to-shutdown-2019-1\" data-read-more-link=\"\" data-e2e-name=\"read-more-link\">15 million low-income households will have a lapse in food benefits because of the government shutdown</a></li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/walmart-target-impact-from-trump-food-stamp-changes-2019-12\" data-read-more-link=\"\" data-e2e-name=\"read-more-link\">More than 700,00 people will soon lose food-stamp benefits under a new Trump administration rule — and that's terrible news for Walmart, Target, Kroger, and dollar stores</a></li><li><a proposal to tighten eligibility for food stamps could affect millions of Americans and hurt some low-cost retailers</a></li></ul><p>&#160;</p><p>&#160;</p><p>&#160;</p><div 10:04:33","updatedTime":"2020-10-20 10:04:33","title":"14 important people to know if you want a job at a growing startup","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/who-are-recruiters-for-startups-2020-10","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f80742fea74820019ca62bd?format=jpeg\" alt=\"must know recruiters in VC firms 2x1\" height=\"1200\" width=\"2400\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">First Round Capital; Redpoint Ventures; Otto Baba/Brandon McGanty; Operator Collective; Samantha Lee/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Do you want to work for a hot-and-growing startup?</li>\n<li>Instead of sending a resume into the startup, a better method is to get to know the \"talent partners\" who work for the startup's venture capital investors.</li>\n<li>We spoke to 14 of top talent partners in our first-ever list of the people to know if you want to work at a startup.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>After a rough start to the year, startups are hiring again. Do you want to work at a hot-and-growing startup?</p><p>The secret to landing such jobs might surprise you. Rather than sending a resume directly to the startup, a better method may be to meet the \"talent partners\" who work for the startup's venture capital investors.&#160;</p><p>Portfolio companies often lean on them to help them find the right people to hire.</p><p>Our first-ever list of the top people to know if you want to work at a startup highlights top talent partners at venture capital firms. We considered factors like experience, scope of work, and the caliber of companies in their network.</p><p>We spoke to 14 of these partners, all of whom specialize in recruiting for their portfolio companies. They told us how their jobs have changed in a pandemic-world and on what advice they have for companies and job-seekers right now.</p><p>There's never been a more interesting time to work at a startup, talent partners agree. And when it comes to finding the perfect candidates, they have whole world in their hands.</p><p>\"While Covid-19 has resulted in tragic layoffs across sectors, remote work has also opened up access to opportunities on a global level that we've never seen before,\" said Nicole North, an executive talent partner at Lightspeed Venture Partners. Her advice: \"Apply for the job at that high growth start up in Lithuania <em>and</em> the one in your backyard. Why not?\"</p><h2><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/vc-recruiters-you-need-to-know-2020-10\">Subscribe to Business Insider to read the full list of important people to know if you want to work a startup, including tips and insight from each of them.</a></h2><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a 2020 21:12:16 +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5f8074444c3b2e0019bba1cc?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"cb7f7217f3cdefc43abd746884df72d9","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn58@2020_1/2020/10/20/02-05-46-411_09b59c69d36e51f1.webp","destWidth":2400,"destHeight":1800,"sourceBytes":183970,"destBytes":183970,"author":"mrussell@businessinsider.com 10:04:33","updatedTime":"2020-10-20 10:04:33","title":"Google rolls out new program with HBCUs to help Black job seekers secure in-demand jobs","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/google-hbcu-program-black-job-seekers-digital-skills-2020-10","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5bad05e81582d437c77b86b6?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Howard University\" height=\"669\" width=\"1024\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Google&#39;s digital skills program will be available at all HBCUs in 2021.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Alex Wong/GettyImages</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Google is rolling out a <a href=\"https://blog.google/outreach-initiatives/grow-with-google/career-readiness-hbcus\">new program</a> with Historically Black Colleges and Universities (HBCUs) to close the digital skills gap in the Black community.</li>\n<li>Nearly two-thirds of the <a href=\"https://www.cfr.org/report/the-work-ahead/report/findings.html\">13 million new jobs</a> created in the US since 2010 required medium or advanced levels of digital skills like UX design, data analytics, or computer programming.</li>\n<li>But 50% of Black job seekers today lack sufficient digital skills, per the nonprofit the <a href=\"https://www.nationalskillscoalition.org/resources/publications/file/Digital-Skills-Racial-Equity-Final.pdf\">National Skills Coalition</a>.</li>\n<li>The program is rolling out at four HBCUs this fall, and will be available at all HBCUs by fall 2021.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>Nearly two-thirds of the <a href=\"https://www.cfr.org/report/the-work-ahead/report/findings.html\">13 million new jobs</a> created in the US since 2010 required medium or advanced levels of digital skills like digital marketing, data analytics, or computer programming. And digital skills are set to become more in-demand in the future, research from the <a href=\"https://www.cfr.org/report/the-work-ahead/report/findings.html\">Council on Foreign Relations</a> shows.&#160;</p><p>But 50% of Black job seekers today lack sufficient digital skills, per the nonprofit the <a href=\"https://www.nationalskillscoalition.org/resources/publications/file/Digital-Skills-Racial-Equity-Final.pdf\">National Skills Coalition</a>.&#160;</p><p>To help close the racial gap in digital skills, Google <a href=\"https://blog.google/outreach-initiatives/grow-with-google/career-readiness-hbcus\">announced last week</a> a new program with the Thurgood Marshall College Fund to provide 20,000 students from Historically Black Colleges and Universities (HBCUs) with access to digital skills training starting in November.</p><p>Google is working first with four institutions: Bowie State University, Virginia State University, Winston-Salem State University, and Southern University A&#38;M College. Some 16 more HBCUs will join the program in January. By the fall of 2021, the program will be available to all HBCUs.&#160;</p><p>The new program is part of its $15 million June investment to bridge the racial digital skills gap, which comes amid the tech giant's larger <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/google-promises-several-changes-improve-racial-diversity-across-the-company-2020-6\">$175 million commitment</a> to racial equity.&#160;</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/google-hbcu-program-black-job-seekers-digital-skills-2020-10'>Business Insider</a></div><div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=CbnmJanSoDU:fUZ-txsKscs:yIl2AUoC8zA\"><img Jackson</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul><li><strong>The S&#38;P 500 is likely to fall 10% in the near term before the bull market resumes, Morgan Stanley's Mike Wilson said on Monday.</strong></li><li><strong>The investment chief said the benchmark's failed attempt to break through 3,550 last week signaled that its correction that began in September is not over href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/index/s&p_500_500\">S&#38;P 500</a> is likely to see a 10% correction in the near term before the bull market continues, according to Morgan Stanley's chief investment officer.</p><p>\"With so many uncertainties over the next month, we think another 10% correction from Monday's highs is the most likely outcome in the near term before this bull market can resume,\" Mike Wilson, also Morgan Stanley's chief US equity strategist, wrote in a Monday note.</p><p>The benchmark index saw its first 10% correction in the new bull market in September — after breaking 3,500, it quickly retreated, Wilson said. Last week, the S&#38;P 500 attempted to break through 3,550 but failed, a sign that the correction that began in September is not over, he said.</p><p>Wilson added that the S&#38;P 500's attempt last week \"occurred on less momentum\" than in September, suggesting that there is more downside to come.</p><p><em><strong>Read more:</strong> <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/stock-picks-to-buy-small-companies-recommendations-high-upside-rbc-2020-10\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" data-analytics-position=\"4\" data-analytics-module=\"\">Buy these 7 unheralded stocks right now for near-term upside of at least 25% as growth accelerates to a new level, RBC says</a></em></p><p>\"Last week's failure to break through technical resistance for the second time suggests the correction isn't over,\" Wilson said. \"We expect softness into and past the election before the next leg of the bull market.\"</p><p>Wilson added that the lack of a fiscal stimulus deal, uncertainty about the outcome and timing of the election, and another wave of coronavirus cases were headwinds to higher stock prices in the near term.</p><p>Going into any pullbacks, investors should look to reallocate their portfolios toward stocks that will benefit from the reopening of the economy, the investment chief said.</p><p><em><strong>Read more:</strong> <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/stock-picks-to-buy-etf-strategy-cathie-wood-ark-invest-2020-10\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Cathie Wood runs 5 funds that more than doubled broader market returns in the 3rd quarter. She and her team break down 8 winning stocks turbocharging the outperformance of its top ETFs.</a></em></p><p>\"The best opportunities lie in stocks where earnings are growing with the cyclical rebound, and importantly, growing by enough to offset any headwinds from multiple contraction as rates move higher with the recovery,\" he said.</p><p>These earnings-driven stocks have been outperforming, and Wilson said this implies further upside ahead.</p><p>Wilson said stocks like <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/stocks/rl-stock\">Ralph Lauren</a>, <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/stocks/skx-stock\">Skechers</a>, <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/stocks/plnt-stock\">Planet Fitness</a>, <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/stocks/xrx-stock\">Xerox Holdings</a>, and <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/stocks/amd-stock\">Advanced Micro Devices</a> had upside potential.</p><p>The S&#38;P 500 fell as much as 0.8% on Monday and traded at about 3,457.44 on Monday afternoon.</p><p><em><strong>Read more:</strong> <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/investing-strategy-4-stocks-to-buy-market-leaders-nancy-zevenbergen-2020-10\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Nancy Zevenbergen is in the top 1% of investors over the past 5 years. She breaks down what she looks for in young companies — and shares 4 stocks she thinks could be market leaders 10 years from now.</a></em></p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on Graffeo)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5f47cb51db1ed000297143ff?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn72@2020_6/2020/10/20/02-05-19-517_112c2d69144a7028.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn67@2020_3/2020/10/20/02-05-22-757_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=oKHXugvydAQ:0zwXKtM14vM:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn96@2020_2/2020/10/20/02-05-22-294_0b1abab0736876f1.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=oKHXugvydAQ:0zwXKtM14vM:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn84@2020_3/2020/10/20/02-05-18-892_2075bf0cfdff7152.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn79@2020_1/2020/10/20/02-05-18-571_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=oKHXugvydAQ:0zwXKtM14vM:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn47@2020_4/2020/10/20/02-05-25-022_ca64c675bb07480e.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/oKHXugvydAQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn71@2020_5/2020/10/20/02-05-21-227_852623080cc9930f.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1603159473304},{"createdTime":"2020-10-20 10:04:33","updatedTime":"2020-10-20 10:04:33","title":"The best cold products and remedies to manage common cold symptoms, according to an infectious disease expert","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-products-remedies-to-cure-cold-fast","description":"<p class=\"financial-disclaimer\"><i>When you buy through our links, we may earn money from our affiliate partners. <a href=\"https://www.insider-inc.com/commerce-on-insider-inc/\">Learn more.</a></i></p><p><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/category/insider-picks-how-to\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\"><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5d1a3f46a17d6c00740c0e89?format=jpeg\" alt=\"How to get rid of a cold\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure></a></p><ul class=\"summary-list\"><li><strong>According to the CDC, there are millions of cases of the common cold that affect both adults and children in the US each year.&#160;</strong></li><li><strong>Adults come down with roughly two or three colds annually and while they</strong><strong><strong> tend to last around a week, there's no cure — but there are ways to make yourself more comfortable as your immune system fights off the virus.</strong></strong></li><li><strong>We spoke to <a href=\"https://www.gwdocs.com/find-a-doctor/aimee-desrosiers-pa-c/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Dr. Aimee </a></strong><a href=\"https://www.gwdocs.com/find-a-doctor/aimee-desrosiers-pa-c/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Desrosiers</a>, PA-C, and an infectious disease expert about the most popular home remedies and drug store products for treating the common cold, and the best practices for feeling better.</li><li><strong>This article was&#160;<a href=\"https://www.insider.com/insider-medical-review-board\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" data-analytics-module=\"summary_bullets\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"0\">medically reviewed</a>&#160;by&#160;<a href=\"https://health.tamu.edu/experts/jason-mcknight.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" data-analytics-module=\"summary_bullets\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"0\">Jason R. McKnight</a>, MD, MS, a family medicine physician and clinical assistant professor at&#160;<a href=\"https://medicine.tamu.edu/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" data-analytics-module=\"summary_bullets\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"20\">Texas A&#38;M College of Medicine</a>.&#160;</strong></li></ul><p><em>Editor's note: </em><em>If your child is suffering from a cold, please consult your pediatrician for recommendations on how to properly manage symptoms.</em></p><p>We've all experienced them: The runny and yet simultaneously stuffy nose, sneezing, sore throat, cough, fatigue, and the general feeling of \"I'm not so sick I need a doctor, but I sure wish I was still in bed.\" These are hallmarks of the common cold and the culprit for many a groggy fall or winter day.</p><p><a href=\"https://www.health.harvard.edu/a_to_z/common-cold-viral-rhinitis-a-to-z\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">According to Harvard Health</a>, over 200 different viruses may cause this miserable but generally not too serious illness, but the most common by far are rhinoviruses, which are responsible for up to 40% of all colds. And contrary to popular belief, you can't catch a cold merely by getting chilled or wet — it takes exposure to someone infected with the virus or contact with contaminated surfaces to spread this common malady.</p><p>Once exposed to the virus, you'll generally start to show symptoms within one to three days and feel under the weather for <a href=\"https://www.insider.com/how-long-does-a-cold-last\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">anywhere from five to 10 days</a>. While there's still no cure for the common cold, and no magical treatment to instantly dispel its symptoms, <a href=\"https://www.insider.com/what-to-do-when-you-feel-a-cold-coming-on\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">there's<em>&#160;</em>a variety of options</a> for helping your body fight off the infection and feel a little better while doing so.</p><p>To help, we spoke to infectious disease specialist, <a href=\"https://www.gwdocs.com/find-a-doctor/aimee-desrosiers-pa-c/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Dr. Aimee </a><a href=\"https://www.gwdocs.com/find-a-doctor/aimee-desrosiers-pa-c/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Desrosiers</a>, about the best home remedies and drug store medication capable of <a href=\"https://www.insider.com/common-cold-symptoms-treatment\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">softening the agony</a> of being under the weather. Some are even as simple as just getting a little more rest each night or drinking more fluids.&#160;</p><h2>Here are some general tips for getting rid of a cold as quickly and comfortably as possible&#160;&#160;<a href=\"http://goto.target.com/c/196318/81938/2092?subId1=biip_070119_how-to-get-rid-of-a-cold&u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.target.com%2Fp%2Fadvil-pain-reliever-fever-reducer-tablets-ibuprofen-nsaid%2F-%2FA-157722192219\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\"></a></h2>\n<div id=\"slideshow\">\n\tGet plenty of rest\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5d839c5c2e22af2b93318d86?format=jpeg\" alt=\"rest sick\" height=\"4000\" width=\"5333\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Shutterstock</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>One of the best things to do when a cold strikes is to get as much rest as you can while your immune system gears up to battle the invading virus. When your symptoms are at their peak, skip that intensive exercise session and just take it easy. Stay in bed and sleep, or indulge in <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-hulu-orignals-to-stream\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">a binge-watching session</a> while relaxing on the couch.&#160;&#160;</p><p>If a runny nose and any congestion are keeping you from getting some proper rest, look for products that use a combination of a nasal decongestant like phenylephrine and an antihistamine like diphenhydramine or doxylamine. We recommend something like Nyquil's Severe Cold and Flu or Robitussin Severe Multi-Symptom Cough, Cold, and Flu Nighttime.</p><p>Dr.&#160; Desrosiers says to \"be sure to read the label carefully and make sure you aren't taking too much of the ingredients during the day.\" She also says to check with your doctor before taking powerful decongestants if you have high blood pressure, heart disease, diabetes, thyroid problems, prostate issues or take MAOI medications for psychiatric disease or Parkinson's.</p>\n\tDrink lots of fluids\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5d839ad62e22af040f5993c3?format=jpeg\" alt=\"cold drink fluids\" height=\"3840\" width=\"5120\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Shutterstock</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>Congestion, mild fever, and fatigue make it very easy to become dehydrated, which leads to feeling even worse. Downing plenty of fluids helps keep you comfortable and may help your immune system function better.</p><p>That doesn't mean you should pour yourself alcohol, coffee, or soda, however. It's best to stick with water, small cups of juice, iced or hot tea, or other beverages that are easy on your stomach.</p>\n\tRun a humidifier\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5d8393742e22af1eea434912?format=jpeg\" alt=\"pure enrichment mistaire humidifier\" height=\"1200\" width=\"1600\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Amazon</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>While you can catch a cold any time of year, they're more common during the winter, when the air tends to be dryer &#8212; and that makes your scratchy throat and congestion even worse. Add some moisture to the air with a cool-mist humidifier like the excellent ultrasonic model from <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B013IJPTFK/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biip_070119_how-to-get-rid-of-a-cold-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B013IJPTFK&#38;linkId=df7ce0c5aeee062119a642c795235c11\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\">Pure Enrichment</a>, which is our top pick in our guide to the <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-humidifier\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">best humidifiers</a>. You'll breathe a little easier, and feel a whole lot better.</p><div id=\"ProductCard_5d3220f9454a391584406122\" style=\"position:relative; display:block; width: 100%\"><iframe src=\"https://produktor.businessinsider.com/productCardService?id=5d3220f9454a391584406122&type=button&live=true\" width=\"100%\" height=\"150%\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\" style=\"position:absolute; top:0; left: 0\"></iframe></div><h3>&#160;</h3>\n\tTake zinc\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f8d8e969e9fe4001900a032?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Cold eeze\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Amazon</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>While results are not entirely conclusive, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/can-zinc-really-shorten-a-cold-2015-1\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">there's some evidence</a> that taking zinc lozenges within the first day or two of cold symptoms may potentially help shorten the duration of your illness by a day or more. Many people swear by <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B000KOPX4O/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biip_070119_how-to-get-rid-of-a-cold-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B000KOPX4O&#38;linkId=94fbfcf5b32e3278927317a496579264\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Cold-Eeze</a> lozenges to help ease the discomfort of a sore throat and cough while providing a reasonably tasty dose of zinc.</p><div id=\"ProductCard_5f8d8e792c44cc297d1b5640\" style=\"position:relative; display:block; width: 100%\"><iframe src=\"https://produktor.businessinsider.com/productCardService?id=5f8d8e792c44cc297d1b5640&type=button&live=true\" width=\"100%\" height=\"150%\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\" style=\"position:absolute; top:0; left: 0\"></iframe></div>\n\tRelieve nasal congestion\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5d1a4091a17d6c00d25f1d72?format=jpeg\" alt=\"XLEAR nasal spray\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Amazon</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>A stuffy, runny nose is one of the primary symptoms of a cold and also the one likeliest to linger. While there are over-the-counter nasal decongestants that help shrink swollen nasal tissue, such as <a href=\"http://goto.target.com/c/196318/81938/2092?subId1=biip_070119_how-to-get-rid-of-a-cold&#38;u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.target.com%2Fp%2Fmucinex-sinus-max-full-force-nasal-decongestant-spray-0-75-fl-oz%2F-%2FA-51277128\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Mucinex Sinus-Max</a>, these medications aren't recommended for those with high blood pressure, heart disease, diabetes, or thyroid disease, among <a href=\"https://dailymed.nlm.nih.gov/dailymed/drugInfo.cfm?setid=d03ef2fd-1a08-42c0-b69d-fd4e4285ccd3\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">other conditions</a>. If you do use Mucinex's spray, try to limit use to three days. If you're looking for a safer alternative, go for&#160;a saline nasal spray like <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B000M4W2E6/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biip_070119_how-to-get-rid-of-a-cold-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B000M4W2E6&#38;linkId=f62dce20a0974e041d786e69a477a444\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">XLEAR Nasal Spray</a>.&#160;</p><p>According to Dr. <a href=\"https://www.gwdocs.com/find-a-doctor/aimee-desrosiers-pa-c/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\"></a>Desrosiers, it's also important to avoid zinc nasal sprays, if at all possible. The FDA itself warns against the use of these sprays and there's even a likelihood that they can <a href=\"https://www.webmd.com/cold-and-flu/qa/can-zinc-nasal-sprays-cause-loss-of-sense-of-smell\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">cause a permanent loss of smell</a>.</p><h3><a href=\"http://goto.target.com/c/196318/81938/2092?subId1=biip_070119_how-to-get-rid-of-a-cold&#38;u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.target.com%2Fp%2Fmucinex-sinus-max-full-force-nasal-decongestant-spray-0-75-fl-oz%2F-%2FA-51277128\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\">Mucinex Sinus-Max</a></h3><div id=\"ProductCard_5f8d8f6fbf96b976b866cd3e\" style=\"position:relative; display:block; width: 100%\"><iframe src=\"https://produktor.businessinsider.com/productCardService?id=5f8d8f6fbf96b976b866cd3e&type=button&live=true\" width=\"100%\" height=\"150%\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\" style=\"position:absolute; top:0; left: 0\"></iframe></div><h3><a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B000M4W2E6/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biip_070119_how-to-get-rid-of-a-cold-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B000M4W2E6&#38;linkId=f62dce20a0974e041d786e69a477a444\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">XLEAR Nasal Spray</a></h3><div id=\"ProductCard_5f8d90020afbe73689598beb\" style=\"position:relative; display:block; width: 100%\"><iframe src=\"https://produktor.businessinsider.com/productCardService?id=5f8d90020afbe73689598beb&type=button&live=true\" width=\"100%\" height=\"150%\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\" style=\"position:absolute; top:0; left: 0\"></iframe></div>\n\tSoothe a sore throat\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5d1a40d3a17d6c0070357d20?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Chloraseptic\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Target</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>For most people, a scratchy and sore throat is the first cold symptom to strike. While throat pain often eases up after the first day or so, you can make yourself far more comfortable by trying a saltwater gargle (dissolve &#189;-teaspoon of salt in a full glass of water), sucking on ice chips or throat lozenges, or reaching for an over-the-counter throat reliever like <a href=\"http://www.anrdoezrs.net/links/6415797/type/dlg/sid/biip_070119_how-to-get-rid-of-a-cold/https://www.walgreens.com/store/c/chloraseptic-sore-throat-spray-cherry-cherry/ID=prod1169-product\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\">Chloraseptic</a> to minimize the aches and scratchiness.</p><div id=\"ProductCard_5f8d92fc514672303d353a0d\" style=\"position:relative; display:block; width: 100%\"><iframe src=\"https://produktor.businessinsider.com/productCardService?id=5f8d92fc514672303d353a0d&type=button&live=true\" width=\"100%\" height=\"150%\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\" style=\"position:absolute; top:0; left: 0\"></iframe></div>\n\tTreat your aches and pains\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5d839b4f2e22af270f07ce8d?format=jpeg\" alt=\"tylenol\" height=\"378\" width=\"504\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Target</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>While a cold doesn't bring about the severe headache, high fever, and body pains of the flu, it can make you feel mildly achy and sore. Over-the-counter pain relievers like <a href=\"http://goto.target.com/c/196318/81938/2092?subId1=biip_070119_how-to-get-rid-of-a-cold&#38;u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.target.com%2Fp%2Faleve-pain-reliever-fever-reducer-caplets-naproxen-sodium-nsaid%2F-%2FA-15130764\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\">Aleve</a>, <a href=\"http://goto.target.com/c/196318/81938/2092?subId1=biip_070119_how-to-get-rid-of-a-cold&#38;u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.target.com%2Fp%2Ftylenol-extra-strength-pain-reliever-and-fever-reducer-caplets-acetaminophen%2F-%2FA-14852008\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\">Tylenol</a>, and <a href=\"http://goto.target.com/c/196318/81938/2092?subId1=biip_070119_how-to-get-rid-of-a-cold&#38;u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.target.com%2Fp%2Fadvil-pain-reliever-fever-reducer-tablets-ibuprofen-nsaid%2F-%2FA-15772219\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\">Advil</a> are all very effective at reducing the discomfort.</p><h3><a href=\"http://goto.target.com/c/196318/81938/2092?subId1=biip_070119_how-to-get-rid-of-a-cold&#38;u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.target.com%2Fp%2Faleve-pain-reliever-fever-reducer-caplets-naproxen-sodium-nsaid%2F-%2FA-15130764\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\">Aleve Pain Reliever &#38; Fever Reducer Caplets (24-count)</a></h3><div id=\"ProductCard_5f8d94137be3a446242cae06\" style=\"position:relative; display:block; width: 100%\"><iframe src=\"https://produktor.businessinsider.com/productCardService?id=5f8d94137be3a446242cae06&type=button&live=true\" width=\"100%\" height=\"150%\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\" style=\"position:absolute; top:0; left: 0\"></iframe></div><h3><a href=\"http://goto.target.com/c/196318/81938/2092?subId1=biip_070119_how-to-get-rid-of-a-cold&#38;u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.target.com%2Fp%2Ftylenol-extra-strength-pain-reliever-and-fever-reducer-caplets-acetaminophen%2F-%2FA-14852008\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\">Tylenol Extra Strength Pain Reliever and Fever Reducer Caplets (24-count)</a></h3><div id=\"ProductCard_5e72304bc4854062aa0c0826\" style=\"position:relative; display:block; width: 100%\"><iframe src=\"https://produktor.businessinsider.com/productCardService?id=5e72304bc4854062aa0c0826&type=button&live=true\" width=\"100%\" height=\"150%\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\" style=\"position:absolute; top:0; left: 0\"></iframe></div><h3><a href=\"http://goto.target.com/c/196318/81938/2092?subId1=biip_070119_how-to-get-rid-of-a-cold&#38;u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.target.com%2Fp%2Fadvil-pain-reliever-fever-reducer-tablets-ibuprofen-nsaid%2F-%2FA-15772219\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\">Advil Pain Reliever/Fever Reducer Tablets (24-count)</a></h3><div id=\"ProductCard_5f8d9532851d5a3022443ad3\" style=\"position:relative; display:block; width: 100%\"><iframe src=\"https://produktor.businessinsider.com/productCardService?id=5f8d9532851d5a3022443ad3&type=button&live=true\" width=\"100%\" height=\"150%\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\" style=\"position:absolute; top:0; left: 0\"></iframe></div>\n\tTry honey\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5d83990f2e22af21393c59f3?format=jpeg\" alt=\"honey\" height=\"3789\" width=\"5052\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Shutterstock</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>While there's no hard-and-fast evidence that it works to boost the immune system, many people do find that a spoonful of honey is an excellent way to quiet a cough and soothe a sore throat. Even the World Health Organization recommends giving children honey to act as an <a href=\"http://www.who.int/maternal_child_adolescent/documents/fch_cah_01_02/en/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">alternative to cough medicine</a> &#8212; and yes, it's alright for adults, too, especially if you're not a huge fan of the taste of cough syrup.</p><p>If you do administer honey as a remedy, it's important to point out that you <a href=\"https://www.cdc.gov/botulism/prevention.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\"><em>shouldn't</em> give honey</a> to children under the age of 12 months as it may contain the bacteria that causes infant botulism.</p>\n\tA few more recommendations\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5d839bea2e22af2740138767?format=jpeg\" alt=\"call doctor\" height=\"3840\" width=\"5120\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Shutterstock</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>The following are a few more general recommendations from <a href=\"https://www.gwdocs.com/find-a-doctor/aimee-desrosiers-pa-c/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Dr. Desrosiers</a> for what to do and what to keep in mind when you have a cold.</p><ul><li><strong>When to seek medical help: </strong>If you have a fever over 101 degrees Fahrenheit, start to feel chest pain, or have difficulty breathing, call and consult with your primary care doctor. You should also call a doctor if your cold isn't gone after two weeks, if it's so severe that you're bringing up colored phlegm, or if you're experiencing wheezing, shortness of breath, or your throat hurts so bad that you're unable to eat or drink.</li><li><strong>Yellow or green nasal discharge is normal:&#160;</strong>Though many clinicians may think yellow or green nasal discharge is cause for antibiotics, it's actually quite common to see this color of mucous with the common cold. However, if those symptoms last longer than 10 days, and you're experiencing a fever, facial, dental, or ear pain and aches, see a doctor to make sure you don't have something more serious like a sinus or ear infection.</li><li><strong>Don't ask for antibiotics:&#160;</strong>Antibiotics don't treat viruses (only bacteria) and may cause greater harm in terms of the side effects and bacterial resistance against antibiotics.</li><li><strong>Wear a mask when going outside: </strong><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/face-masks-effective-in-protecting-against-coronavirus-2020-6\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">It's important to wear a mask</a> when out in public in an effort to stop the spread of the common cold, as well as the flu and COVID-19.&#160;</li><li><strong>Keep your hands washed: </strong>It's highly recommended that you <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-hand-soap\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">wash your hands</a> often after blowing your nose, sneezing, coughing, or touching anything in public places.&#160;</li><li><strong>Stay socially distanced: </strong>As the COVID-19 pandemic persists, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/why-social-distancing-might-last-several-months-2020-3\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">staying socially distanced</a> (and socially isolated, if able) is crucial in helping curb the spread not just of COVID-19 but also of the common cold and flu.&#160;</li></ul>\n</div><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a Ullman)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5d1a3f46a17d6c00740c0e89?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn7@2020_1/2020/10/20/02-05-21-568_55574681cbd492c5.webp","https://i.insider.com/5d839c5c2e22af2b93318d86?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn75@2020_3/2020/10/20/02-05-14-190_899bc9f97cc24d11.webp","https://i.insider.com/5d839ad62e22af040f5993c3?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn87@2020_1/2020/10/20/02-05-22-885_ad2c948271ae77e9.webp","https://i.insider.com/5d8393742e22af1eea434912?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn4@2020_5/2020/10/20/02-05-23-048_30649a24f8f95e7f.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f8d8e969e9fe4001900a032?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn23@2020_5/2020/10/20/02-05-23-275_c667c08b3c581864.webp","https://i.insider.com/5d1a4091a17d6c00d25f1d72?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn92@2020_3/2020/10/20/02-05-17-226_3d0e622bf518e32d.webp","https://i.insider.com/5d1a40d3a17d6c0070357d20?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn19@2020_2/2020/10/20/02-05-16-507_e3a0daab5bc99729.webp","https://i.insider.com/5d839b4f2e22af270f07ce8d?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn16@2020_4/2020/10/20/02-05-14-571_0e1f94ff260b23df.webp","https://i.insider.com/5d83990f2e22af21393c59f3?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn20@2020_5/2020/10/20/02-05-20-683_a91a2a7eae2d38ec.webp","https://i.insider.com/5d839bea2e22af2740138767?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn39@2020_2/2020/10/20/02-05-24-075_1a8e5af0a361391b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn67@2020_3/2020/10/20/02-05-22-757_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=9tAo7Ki-88s:u27ijQXf2Oo:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn28@2020_6/2020/10/20/02-05-24-785_a55c5b8ed0f75e28.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=9tAo7Ki-88s:u27ijQXf2Oo:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn88@2020_3/2020/10/20/02-05-17-960_e9535836a3728d7e.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn79@2020_1/2020/10/20/02-05-18-571_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=9tAo7Ki-88s:u27ijQXf2Oo:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn59@2020_3/2020/10/20/02-05-14-266_06ec5241d5c9a192.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/9tAo7Ki-88s":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn80@2020_3/2020/10/20/02-05-16-107_4bd2d8957c651ce3.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1603159473386},{"createdTime":"2020-10-20 10:04:33","updatedTime":"2020-10-20 10:04:33","title":"Workers for Target-owned Shipt are walking off the job and protesting outside the company's headquarters, calling for better pay","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/target-owned-shipt-workers-are-striking-over-pay-algorithm-2020-10","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f8dc90ac21cfb0019468d07?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Target\" height=\"1656\" width=\"2208\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Workers at the Target-owned company Shipt are protesting to demand fairer pay.\n<p class=\"copyright\">AP</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Independent contractors for Shipt, a Target-owned delivery service, are protesting and holding a demonstration in Minneapolis today demanding fairer pay.</li>\n<li>Shipt introduced a new pay model for shoppers that uses an algorithm to determine wages, <a href=\"https://www.vice.com/en/article/qj49jv/targets-delivery-app-workers-to-be-paid-by-a-blackbox-algorithm-nationwide\">Vice first reported</a>. Some workers say their pay has decreased since the change, which expanded to all markets at the end of September.</li>\n<li>Molly Snyder, the chief communications officer for Shipt, told Business Insider that the company had \"more shoppers than ever before\" working last weekend despite the protest.</li>\n<li><em>If you are a Shipt shopper and would like to share your story, email aakhtar@businessinsider.com.</em></li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>Gig workers for Shipt, a Target-owned grocery delivery service, are protesting for fairer pay.</p><p>Workers penned a letter on <a href=\"https://medium.com/@shiptshopper/announcing-shipt-shopper-protest-59ce13ff6964\">Medium</a> announcing that they would protest Monday to bring attention to the company's new pay model that they said slashed wages.&#160;</p><p>Shipt workers, called Shoppers, said they will host a demonstration outside Target's headquarters in Minneapolis, and have been walking out of work since Saturday. Organizers will be reading letters from workers impacted by the price change.</p><p>Shoppers, who are independent contractors and don't get benefits like minimum wage or healthcare, were originally paid a flat rate based on the total amount of money customers spent for their delivery. The new price model uses an algorithm that calculates pay based on \"effort,\" by using factors like items in the bag, the city shoppers are in, the delivery route taken, and other variables.</p><blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet blockquote\" data-lang=\"en\" data-cards=\"\" data-conversation=\"\">&#8212;Nicole Norfleet  (@nicolenorfleet) <a href=\"https://twitter.com/mims/statuses/1318245586085285891?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw\">October 19, 2020</a></blockquote><script async src=\"//platform.twitter.com/widgets.js\" charset=\"utf-8\"></script><p>&#160;</p><p>Instacart, DoorDash, and Lyft implement a similar algorithm that workers say do not guarantee minimum wage, <a href=\"https://www.vice.com/en/article/qj49jv/targets-delivery-app-workers-to-be-paid-by-a-blackbox-algorithm-nationwide\">Vice</a> reported.</p><p>The new pay model had been implemented in some cities earlier this year, and Shipt confirmed to Business Insider that it expanded the price model to the entire country at the end of September.&#160;</p><p>Molly Snyder, the chief communications officer for Shipt, said the new pay model on average didn't change wages — positively or negatively — but certain some workers may have seen a decline in pay. A <a href=\"https://home.coworker.org/data-shows-shipts-black-box-algorithm-reduces-pay-of-40-of-workers/\">study</a> conducted by <a href=\"https://home.coworker.org/\">Coworker.org</a> and in partnership with an MIT PhD student found the new pay model resulted in less pay for 41% of shoppers, and the number of people earning less is growing.</p><p>Snyder also told Business Insider Shipt had \"more shoppers than ever before\" this weekend.</p><p>\"While we respect that not everyone is going to agree with the decision we made that is in the best interest overall for the company and shoppers, we believe the model we rolled out is the right one for the company,\" she said.</p><p>Target declined to comment on the protest.</p><p><em>If you have information to share, you can contact the author at aakhtar@businessinsider.com.</em></p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a
